Jest coverage report

Action ID: marketplace/ArtiomTr/jest-coverage-report-action

Author: Artiom Tretjakovas <artiom.tretjakovas2@gmail.com>

Publisher: ArtiomTr

Repository: github.com/ArtiomTr/jest-coverage-report-action

Description

Track your code coverage in each pull request.

Categories

TestingCode qualityNotification

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
github-token Yes A github access token
test-script No A custom npm script to get coverage
threshold No Coverage threshold. If total coverage is less than threshold, PR will be rejected
working-directory No Custom working directory
icons No Which icons to use. Available choices: emoji, ascii
annotations No What type of annotations show. Options: none, coverage, failed-tests, all
package-manager No Which package manager to use; can be `npm`, `yarn`, `pnpm`, or `bun`
skip-step No `none` for running all steps, `install` to skip installing dependencies or `all` to skip installing dependencies and running the test script
custom-title No Sets the title of the coverage report comment in Github.
coverage-file No Path to file the a previously generated report.json file. (bypasses running the test again)
base-coverage-file No Path to the report.json file to compare against. This should be from the branch the PR is merging into.
prnumber No Pull Request number for this commit. Use if your action is running in a PR, but non on the pull_request event, so that you do not get multiple comments.
output No What output should action produce? `comment` - add comment to PR, `report-markdown` - report markdown text in "outputs.report".

Outputs

NameDescription
report Generated markdown report. Exists only if input option "output" is set to "report-markdown".
×

NPM Publish

Action ID: marketplace/JS-DevTools/npm-publish

Author: James Messinger

Publisher: JS-DevTools

Repository: github.com/JS-DevTools/npm-publish

Description

Fast, easy publishing to NPM

Categories

PublishingAuthenticationPackaging

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
token No The NPM access token to use when publishing
registry No The NPM registry URL to use
package No The path to your package or its package.json file
tag No The distribution tag to publish
access No Determines whether the published package should be publicly visible, or restricted to members of your NPM organization.
provenance No Attach provenance statements when publishing.
strategy No Version check and release strategy. If "all" (default), package will be published if its version is simply not yet published. If "upgrade", package will be published if its version is higher than the existing tag, according to semantic versioning.
ignore-scripts No Run npm with the --ignore-scripts flag as a security precaution. Enabled by default.
dry-run No Run npm with the --dry-run flag to avoid actually publishing anything.

Outputs

NameDescription
id The identifier of the published package. If a release was published, format is `${name}@${version}. If no release occurred, will be an empty string.
type The type of version change that occurred on the published tag. If release was an upgrade, will be a semver release type ("major", "minor", ...). If the published tag had no previous version, will be "initial". If version was change was not an upgrade, will be "different". If no release occurred, will be an empty string.
name Name of the package.
version Version of the package.
old-version The previous version on the distribution tag. If there was no previous version on the tag, will be an empty string.
registry The registry used for version checking and publishing.
tag The distribution tag used for version checking and publishing.
access The package access setting used. If configured by the action or package.json, will be "public" or "protected". If not configured for a non-scoped package, will be "public". If not configured for a scoped package, will be "default".
×

F45 Lionheart Strava Importer

Action ID: marketplace/JamesIves/f45-lionheart-strava-importer

Author: James Ives <iam@jamesiv.es> (https://jives.dev)

Publisher: JamesIves

Repository: github.com/JamesIves/f45-lionheart-strava-importer

Description

Fetches a workout from the F45 Lionheart API and pushes it to Strava. ü¶Å

Categories

CommunicationAuthenticationDeployment

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
STRAVA_CLIENT_ID Yes Your Strava Client ID
STRAVA_CLIENT_SECRET Yes Your Strava Client Secret
STRAVA_REFRESH_TOKEN Yes Your Strava Refresh Token
F45_CLASS_DATE Yes The date that the F45 Class was taken, this should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
F45_CLASS_TIME Yes The time of the F45 Class, this should be in 24 hour format and mirror the time the class was scheduled to start.
F45_STUDIO_CODE Yes The F45 Studio Code where the class was taken
F45_USER_ID Yes Your F45 User ID
F45_LIONHEART_SERIAL_NUMBER Yes Your F45 Lionheart Serial Number
DRY_RUN No If set to true the script will not push the workout to Strava.

Outputs

NameDescription
deployment-status The status of the deployment that indicates if the run failed or passed. Possible outputs include: success|failed|skipped

Fetch API Data

Action ID: marketplace/JamesIves/fetch-api-data-action

Author: James Ives <iam@jamesiv.es>

Publisher: JamesIves

Repository: github.com/JamesIves/fetch-api-data-action

Description

This action will handle authenticated API requests, allowing you to save the data from the request into your workspace.

Categories

AuthenticationCommunicationDependency management

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
endpoint Yes The URL of the endpoint you would like to retrieve data from.
configuration No Any applicable configuration settings that should be set such as authentication tokens. You can reference secrets using the secrets syntax, or you can reference data returned from the `TOKEN_ENDPOINT` request using the triple bracket syntax.
token-endpoint No If the `ENDPOINT` API requires you to make a request to get an access token prior to fetching data you can perform this task by specifying a token endpoint. Any data returned from the token end can be referenced in the `CONFIGURATION` variable using the triple bracket syntax.
token-configuration No Any applicable configuration settings that should be set such as authentication tokens. You can reference secrets using the secrets syntax.
retry No If you are working with an intermittent API you can toggle this option to true. Doing so will make the action try the request 3 times at random invervals before failing.
save-location No By default the save location of the JSON file is `fetch-api-data-action/data.json`, if you would like to override the directory you can do so by specifying a new one with this variable.
save-name No You can override the name of the exported `.json` file by specifying a new one here. You should _not_ include the file extension in your name.
variable-name No You can override the name of the variable name the action exports. This will work so long as set-output is true.
set-output No Determines if the returned data should be saved as an environment variable or not. This field defaults to `true`, but depending on your API response length you may need to toggle this.
debug No If set to true the action will log the API responses it receives in the terminal.
format No Allows you to modify the format of the saved file, for example you can use txt here to save the file as a txt file. This field defaults to json.
encoding No Allows you to specify the encoding the saved file, can be of type BufferEncoding: "ascii" | "utf8" | "utf-8" | "utf16le" | "ucs2" | "ucs-2" | "base64" | "latin1" | "binary" | "hex".

Outputs

NameDescription
fetchApiData The requested data from the API stored as a string.
×

Deploy to GitHub Pages

Action ID: marketplace/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action

Author: James Ives <iam@jamesiv.es>

Publisher: JamesIves

Repository: github.com/JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action

Description

This action will handle the deployment process of your project to GitHub Pages.

Categories

DeploymentAuthenticationInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
ssh-key No This option allows you to define a private SSH key to be used in conjunction with a repository deployment key to deploy using SSH. The private key should be stored in the `secrets / with` menu **as a secret**. The public should be stored in the repositories deployment keys menu and be given write access. Alternatively you can set this field to `true` to enable SSH endpoints for deployment without configuring the ssh client. This can be useful if you've already setup the SSH client using another package or action in a previous step.
token No This option defaults to the repository scoped GitHub Token. However if you need more permissions for things such as deploying to another repository, you can add a Personal Access Token (PAT) here. This should be stored in the `secrets / with` menu **as a secret**. We recommend using a service account with the least permissions necessary and when generating a new PAT that you select the least permission scopes required. [Learn more about creating and using encrypted secrets here.](https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/creating-and-using-encrypted-secrets)
branch No This is the branch you wish to deploy to, for example gh-pages or docs.
folder Yes The folder in your repository that you want to deploy. If your build script compiles into a directory named build you would put it here. Folder paths cannot have a leading / or ./. If you wish to deploy the root directory you can place a . here.
target-folder No If you would like to push the contents of the deployment folder into a specific directory on the deployment branch you can specify it here.
commit-message No If you need to customize the commit message for an integration you can do so.
clean No If your project generates hashed files on build you can use this option to automatically delete them from the target folder on the deployment branch with each deploy. This option is on by default and can be toggled off by setting it to false.
clean-exclude No If you need to use clean but you would like to preserve certain files or folders you can use this option. This should contain each pattern as a single line in a multiline string.
dry-run No Do not actually push back, but use `--dry-run` on `git push` invocations instead.
force No Whether to force-push and overwrite any existing deployment. Setting this to false will attempt to rebase simultaneous deployments. This option is on by default and can be toggled off by setting it to false.
git-config-name No Allows you to customize the name that is attached to the GitHub config which is used when pushing the deployment commits. If this is not included it will use the name in the GitHub context, followed by the name of the action.
git-config-email No Allows you to customize the email that is attached to the GitHub config which is used when pushing the deployment commits. If this is not included it will use the email in the GitHub context, followed by a generic noreply GitHub email.
repository-name No Allows you to specify a different repository path so long as you have permissions to push to it. This should be formatted like so: JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action
tag No Add a tag to the commit, this can be used like so: 'v0.1'. Only works when 'dry-run' is not used.
single-commit No This option can be used if you'd prefer to have a single commit on the deployment branch instead of maintaining the full history.
silent No Silences the action output preventing it from displaying git messages.
attempt-limit No How many rebase attempts to make before suspending the job. This option defaults to `3` and may be useful to increase when there are multiple deployments in a single branch.

Outputs

NameDescription
deployment-status The status of the deployment that indicates if the run failed or passed. Possible outputs include: success|failed|skipped
×

Add GitHub Sponsors to Readme

Action ID: marketplace/JamesIves/github-sponsors-readme-action

Author: James Ives <iam@jamesiv.es>

Publisher: JamesIves

Repository: github.com/JamesIves/github-sponsors-readme-action

Description

This GitHub Action will automatically add your GitHub Sponsors to your README.

Categories

DocumentationCommunicationCode quality

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
token Yes You must provide the action with a Personal Access Token (PAT) with either the user:read and org:read permission scope and store it in the secrets / with menu as a secret. This should be generated from the account or organization that receives sponsorship. [Learn more about creating and using encrypted secrets here.](https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/creating-and-using-encrypted-secrets)
file Yes This should point to the file that you're generating, for example README.md or path/to/CREDITS.md
organization No If you're displaying sponsorship information as an organization you should toggle this option to true. You also need to provide the action with an org:read scoped PAT.
minimum No Using this input you can set the minimum sponsorship threshold. For example setting this to 500 will only display sponsors who give of $5 USD and more. By default the action will display all of your sponsors.
maximum No For example setting this to 1000 will only display sponsors who give of $10 USD and less. By default the action will display all of your sponsors.
marker No This allows you to modify the marker comment that is placed in your file. By default this is set to sponsors - <!-- sponsors --> <!-- sponsors -->, if you set this to gold for example you can place <!-- gold --> <!-- gold --> in your file.
template No Allows you to modify the default template. Please refer to the `template` section of this README for more information.
fallback No Allows you to specify a fallback if you have no sponsors. By default nothing is displayed.
active-only No If set to false, inactive sponsors will be displayed. This can be useful if you want to display all sponsors, regardless of their status.
include-private No If set to true, private sponsors will be displayed in the list, however any identifying information will be redacted. This can be useful if you want to display all sponsors, regardless of their privacy settings.

Outputs

NameDescription
sponsorshipStatus The status of the action that indicates if the run failed or passed. Possible outputs include: success|failed
×

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/add-to-project

Description

Automatically add issues and PRs to GitHub projects

Inputs

github-token Yes A GitHub personal access token with write access to the project
labeled No A comma-separated list of labels to use as a filter for issue to be added
label-operator No The behavior of the labels filter, AND to match all labels, OR to match any label, NOT to exclude any listed label (default is OR)

Outputs

NameDescription
itemId The ID of the item that was added to the project

AI Inference

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/ai-inference

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/ai-inference

Description

Generate an AI response based on a provided prompt

Categories

CommunicationTesting

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
prompt No The prompt for the model
prompt-file No Path to a file containing the prompt (supports .txt and .prompt.yml formats)
input No Template variables in YAML format for .prompt.yml files
file_input No Template variables in YAML format mapping variable names to file paths. The file contents will be used for templating.
model No The model to use
endpoint No The endpoint to use
system-prompt No The system prompt for the model
system-prompt-file No Path to a file containing the system prompt
max-tokens No The maximum number of tokens to generate
token No The token to use
enable-github-mcp No Enable Model Context Protocol integration with GitHub tools
github-mcp-token No The token to use for GitHub MCP server (defaults to the main token if not specified). This must be a PAT for MCP to work.
github-mcp-toolsets No Comma-separated list of toolsets to enable for GitHub MCP (e.g., "repos,issues,pull_requests,actions"). Use "all" for all toolsets, "default" for default set. If not specified, uses default toolsets (context,repos,issues,pull_requests,users).

Outputs

NameDescription
response The response from the model
response-file The file path where the response is saved

Generate Generic Attestations

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/attest

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/attest

Description

Generate attestations for build artifacts

Categories

SecurityBuildDocumentation

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
subject-path No Path to the artifact serving as the subject of the attestation. Must specify exactly one of "subject-path", "subject-digest", or "subject-checksums". May contain a glob pattern or list of paths (total subject count cannot exceed 1024).
subject-digest No Digest of the subject for the attestation. Must be in the form "algorithm:hex_digest" (e.g. "sha256:abc123..."). Must specify exactly one of "subject-path", "subject-digest", or "subject-checksums".
subject-name No Subject name as it should appear in the attestation. Required when identifying the subject with the "subject-digest" input.
subject-checksums No Path to checksums file containing digest and name of subjects for attestation. Must specify exactly one of "subject-path", "subject-digest", or "subject-checksums".
predicate-type Yes URI identifying the type of the predicate.
predicate No String containing the value for the attestation predicate. String length cannot exceed 16MB. Must supply exactly one of "predicate-path" or "predicate".
predicate-path No Path to the file which contains the content for the attestation predicate. File size cannot exceed 16MB. Must supply exactly one of "predicate-path" or "predicate".
push-to-registry No Whether to push the attestation to the image registry. Requires that the "subject-name" parameter specify the fully-qualified image name and that the "subject-digest" parameter be specified. Defaults to false.
show-summary No Whether to attach a list of generated attestations to the workflow run summary page. Defaults to true.
github-token No The GitHub token used to make authenticated API requests.

Outputs

NameDescription
bundle-path The path to the file containing the attestation bundle.
attestation-id The ID of the attestation.
attestation-url The URL for the attestation summary.
×

Attest Build Provenance

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/attest-build-provenance

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/attest-build-provenance

Description

Generate provenance attestations for build artifacts

Categories

SecurityDocumentation

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
subject-path No Path to the artifact serving as the subject of the attestation. Must specify exactly one of "subject-path", "subject-digest", or "subject-checksums". May contain a glob pattern or list of paths (total subject count cannot exceed 1024).
subject-digest No Digest of the subject for which provenance will be generated. Must be in the form "algorithm:hex_digest" (e.g. "sha256:abc123..."). Must specify exactly one of "subject-path", "subject-digest", or "subject-checksums".
subject-name No Subject name as it should appear in the attestation. Required when identifying the subject with the "subject-digest" input.
subject-checksums No Path to checksums file containing digest and name of subjects for attestation. Must specify exactly one of "subject-path", "subject-digest", or "subject-checksums".
push-to-registry No Whether to push the provenance statement to the image registry. Requires that the "subject-name" parameter specify the fully-qualified image name and that the "subject-digest" parameter be specified. Defaults to false.
show-summary No Whether to attach a list of generated attestations to the workflow run summary page. Defaults to true.
github-token No The GitHub token used to make authenticated API requests.

Outputs

NameDescription
bundle-path The path to the file containing the attestation bundle.
attestation-id The ID of the attestation.
attestation-url The URL for the attestation summary.

Attest SBOM

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/attest-sbom

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/attest-sbom

Description

Generate SBOM attestations for build artifacts

Categories

SecurityDocumentationCode quality

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
subject-path No Path to the artifact serving as the subject of the attestation. Must specify exactly one of "subject-path", "subject-digest", or "subject-checksums". May contain a glob pattern or list of paths (total subject count cannot exceed 1024).
subject-digest No SHA256 digest of the subject for the attestation. Must be in the form "sha256:hex_digest" (e.g. "sha256:abc123..."). Must specify exactly one of "subject-path", "subject-digest", or "subject-checksums".
subject-name No Subject name as it should appear in the attestation. Required when identifying the subject with the "subject-digest" input.
subject-checksums No Path to checksums file containing digest and name of subjects for attestation. Must specify exactly one of "subject-path", "subject-digest", or "subject-checksums".
sbom-path Yes Path to the JSON-formatted SBOM file to attest. File size cannot exceed 16MB.
push-to-registry No Whether to push the provenance statement to the image registry. Requires that the "subject-name" parameter specify the fully-qualified image name and that the "subject-digest" parameter be specified. Defaults to false.
show-summary No Whether to attach a list of generated attestations to the workflow run summary page. Defaults to true.
github-token No The GitHub token used to make authenticated API requests.

NameDescription
bundle-path The path to the file containing the attestation bundle.
attestation-id The ID of the attestation.
attestation-url The URL for the attestation summary.

Cache

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/cache

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/cache

Description

Cache artifacts like dependencies and build outputs to improve workflow execution time

Categories

Dependency managementCaching

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
path Yes A list of files, directories, and wildcard patterns to cache and restore
key Yes An explicit key for restoring and saving the cache
restore-keys No An ordered multiline string listing the prefix-matched keys, that are used for restoring stale cache if no cache hit occurred for key. Note `cache-hit` returns false in this case.
upload-chunk-size No The chunk size used to split up large files during upload, in bytes
enableCrossOsArchive No An optional boolean when enabled, allows windows runners to save or restore caches that can be restored or saved respectively on other platforms
fail-on-cache-miss No Fail the workflow if cache entry is not found
lookup-only No Check if a cache entry exists for the given input(s) (key, restore-keys) without downloading the cache
save-always No Run the post step to save the cache even if another step before fails

Outputs

NameDescription
cache-hit A boolean value to indicate an exact match was found for the primary key
×

Checkout Test

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/checkout

Author: Unknown

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/checkout

Description

Checkout a Git repository at a particular version

Categories

Dependency managementAuthentication

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
repository No Repository name with owner. For example, actions/checkout
ref No The branch, tag or SHA to checkout. When checking out the repository that triggered a workflow, this defaults to the reference or SHA for that event. Otherwise, uses the default branch.
token No Personal access token (PAT) used to fetch the repository. The PAT is configured with the local git config, which enables your scripts to run authenticated git commands. The post-job step removes the PAT. We recommend using a service account with the least permissions necessary. Also when generating a new PAT, select the least scopes necessary. [Learn more about creating and using encrypted secrets](https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/creating-and-using-encrypted-secrets)
ssh-key No SSH key used to fetch the repository. The SSH key is configured with the local git config, which enables your scripts to run authenticated git commands. The post-job step removes the SSH key. We recommend using a service account with the least permissions necessary. [Learn more about creating and using encrypted secrets](https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/creating-and-using-encrypted-secrets)
ssh-known-hosts No Known hosts in addition to the user and global host key database. The public SSH keys for a host may be obtained using the utility `ssh-keyscan`. For example, `ssh-keyscan github.com`. The public key for github.com is always implicitly added.
ssh-strict No Whether to perform strict host key checking. When true, adds the options `StrictHostKeyChecking=yes` and `CheckHostIP=no` to the SSH command line. Use the input `ssh-known-hosts` to configure additional hosts.
ssh-user No The user to use when connecting to the remote SSH host. By default 'git' is used.
persist-credentials No Whether to configure the token or SSH key with the local git config
path No Relative path under $GITHUB_WORKSPACE to place the repository
clean No Whether to execute `git clean -ffdx && git reset --hard HEAD` before fetching
filter No Partially clone against a given filter. Overrides sparse-checkout if set.
sparse-checkout No Do a sparse checkout on given patterns. Each pattern should be separated with new lines.
sparse-checkout-cone-mode No Specifies whether to use cone-mode when doing a sparse checkout.
fetch-depth No Number of commits to fetch. 0 indicates all history for all branches and tags.
fetch-tags No Whether to fetch tags, even if fetch-depth > 0.
show-progress No Whether to show progress status output when fetching.
lfs No Whether to download Git-LFS files
submodules No Whether to checkout submodules: `true` to checkout submodules or `recursive` to recursively checkout submodules. When the `ssh-key` input is not provided, SSH URLs beginning with `git@github.com:` are converted to HTTPS.
set-safe-directory No Add repository path as safe.directory for Git global config by running `git config --global --add safe.directory <path>`
github-server-url No The base URL for the GitHub instance that you are trying to clone from, will use environment defaults to fetch from the same instance that the workflow is running from unless specified. Example URLs are https://github.com or https://my-ghes-server.example.com

Outputs

NameDescription
ref The branch, tag or SHA that was checked out
commit The commit SHA that was checked out
×

Component Detection dependency submission action

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/component-detection-dependency-submission-action

Author: Unknown

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/component-detection-dependency-submission-action

Description

Upload information about your dependencies to the GitHub dependency graph using dependency submission API.

Categories

Dependency managementDocumentation

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
token No GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT). Defaults to PAT provided by Actions runner.
filePath No The path to the directory containing the environment files to upload. Defaults to Actions working directory.
directoryExclusionList No Filters out specific directories following a minimatch pattern.
detectorArgs No Comma separated list of properties that can affect the detectors execution, like EnableIfDefaultOff that allows a specific detector that is in beta to run, the format for this property is DetectorId=EnableIfDefaultOff, for example Pip=EnableIfDefaultOff.
dockerImagesToScan No Comma separated list of docker image names or hashes to execute container scanning on, ex: ubuntu:16.04,56bab49eef2ef07505f6a1b0d5bd3a601dfc3c76ad4460f24c91d6fa298369ab
detectorsFilter No A comma separated list with the identifiers of the specific detectors to be used. This is meant to be used for testing purposes only.
detectorsCategories No A comma separated list with the categories of components that are going to be scanned. The detectors that are going to run are the ones that belongs to the categories. The possible values are: Npm, NuGet, Maven, RubyGems, Cargo, Pip, GoMod, CocoaPods, Linux.
correlator No An optional identifier to distinguish between multiple dependency snapshots of the same type.
detector-name No The name of the detector. If provided, detector-version and detector-url must also be provided.
detector-version No The version of the detector. If provided, detector-name and detector-url must also be provided.
detector-url No The URL of the detector. If provided, detector-name and detector-version must also be provided.
snapshot-sha No The SHA of the commit to associate with the snapshot. If provided, snapshot-ref must also be provided.
snapshot-ref No The Git reference to associate with the snapshot. If provided, snapshot-sha must also be provided.
×

Configure GitHub Pages

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/configure-pages

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/configure-pages

Description

A GitHub Action to enable Pages, extract various metadata about a site, and configure some supported static site generators.

Categories

DeploymentDocumentationInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
static_site_generator No Optional static site generator to attempt to configure: "nuxt", "next", "gatsby", or "sveltekit"
generator_config_file No Optional file path to static site generator configuration file
token Yes GitHub token
enablement No Try to enable Pages for the repository if it is not already enabled. This option requires a token other than `GITHUB_TOKEN` to be provided. In the context of a Personal Access Token, the `repo` scope or Pages write permission is required. In the context of a GitHub App, the `administration:write` and `pages:write` permissions are required.

Outputs

NameDescription
base_url GitHub Pages site full base URL. Examples: "https://octocat.github.io/my-repo", "https://octocat.github.io", "https://www.example.com"
origin GitHub Pages site origin. Examples: "https://octocat.github.io", "https://www.example.com"
host GitHub Pages site host. Examples: "octocat.github.io", "www.example.com"
base_path GitHub Pages site full base path. Examples: "/my-repo" or ""
×

Create GitHub App Token

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/create-github-app-token

Author: Gregor Martynus and Parker Brown

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/create-github-app-token

Description

GitHub Action for creating a GitHub App installation access token

Categories

AuthenticationInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
app-id Yes GitHub App ID
private-key Yes GitHub App private key
owner No The owner of the GitHub App installation (defaults to current repository owner)
repositories No Comma or newline-separated list of repositories to install the GitHub App on (defaults to current repository if owner is unset)
skip-token-revoke No If true, the token will not be revoked when the current job is complete
github-api-url No The URL of the GitHub REST API.
permission-actions No The level of permission to grant the access token for GitHub Actions workflows, workflow runs, and artifacts. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-administration No The level of permission to grant the access token for repository creation, deletion, settings, teams, and collaborators creation. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-checks No The level of permission to grant the access token for checks on code. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-codespaces No The level of permission to grant the access token to create, edit, delete, and list Codespaces. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-contents No The level of permission to grant the access token for repository contents, commits, branches, downloads, releases, and merges. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-custom-properties-for-organizations No The level of permission to grant the access token to view and edit custom properties for an organization, when allowed by the property. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-dependabot-secrets No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage Dependabot secrets. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-deployments No The level of permission to grant the access token for deployments and deployment statuses. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-email-addresses No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage the email addresses belonging to a user. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-enterprise-custom-properties-for-organizations No The level of permission to grant the access token for organization custom properties management at the enterprise level. Can be set to 'read', 'write', or 'admin'.
permission-environments No The level of permission to grant the access token for managing repository environments. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-followers No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage the followers belonging to a user. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-git-ssh-keys No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage git SSH keys. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-gpg-keys No The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage GPG keys belonging to a user. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-interaction-limits No The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage interaction limits on a repository. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-issues No The level of permission to grant the access token for issues and related comments, assignees, labels, and milestones. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-members No The level of permission to grant the access token for organization teams and members. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-metadata No The level of permission to grant the access token to search repositories, list collaborators, and access repository metadata. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-administration No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage access to an organization. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-announcement-banners No The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage announcement banners for an organization. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-copilot-seat-management No The level of permission to grant the access token for managing access to GitHub Copilot for members of an organization with a Copilot Business subscription. This property is in public preview and is subject to change. Can be set to 'write'.
permission-organization-custom-org-roles No The level of permission to grant the access token for custom organization roles management. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-custom-properties No The level of permission to grant the access token for repository custom properties management at the organization level. Can be set to 'read', 'write', or 'admin'.
permission-organization-custom-roles No The level of permission to grant the access token for custom repository roles management. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-events No The level of permission to grant the access token to view events triggered by an activity in an organization. Can be set to 'read'.
permission-organization-hooks No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage the post-receive hooks for an organization. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-packages No The level of permission to grant the access token for organization packages published to GitHub Packages. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-personal-access-token-requests No The level of permission to grant the access token for viewing and managing fine-grained personal access tokens that have been approved by an organization. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-personal-access-tokens No The level of permission to grant the access token for viewing and managing fine-grained personal access token requests to an organization. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-plan No The level of permission to grant the access token for viewing an organization's plan. Can be set to 'read'.
permission-organization-projects No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage organization projects and projects public preview (where available). Can be set to 'read', 'write', or 'admin'.
permission-organization-secrets No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage organization secrets. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-self-hosted-runners No The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage GitHub Actions self-hosted runners available to an organization. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-organization-user-blocking No The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage users blocked by the organization. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-packages No The level of permission to grant the access token for packages published to GitHub Packages. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-pages No The level of permission to grant the access token to retrieve Pages statuses, configuration, and builds, as well as create new builds. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-profile No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage the profile settings belonging to a user. Can be set to 'write'.
permission-pull-requests No The level of permission to grant the access token for pull requests and related comments, assignees, labels, milestones, and merges. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-repository-custom-properties No The level of permission to grant the access token to view and edit custom properties for a repository, when allowed by the property. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-repository-hooks No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage the post-receive hooks for a repository. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-repository-projects No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage repository projects, columns, and cards. Can be set to 'read', 'write', or 'admin'.
permission-secret-scanning-alerts No The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage secret scanning alerts. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-secrets No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage repository secrets. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-security-events No The level of permission to grant the access token to view and manage security events like code scanning alerts. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-single-file No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage just a single file. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-starring No The level of permission to grant the access token to list and manage repositories a user is starring. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-statuses No The level of permission to grant the access token for commit statuses. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-team-discussions No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage team discussions and related comments. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-vulnerability-alerts No The level of permission to grant the access token to manage Dependabot alerts. Can be set to 'read' or 'write'.
permission-workflows No The level of permission to grant the access token to update GitHub Actions workflow files. Can be set to 'write'.

Outputs

NameDescription
token GitHub installation access token
installation-id GitHub App installation ID
app-slug GitHub App slug
×

Create a Release

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/create-release

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/create-release

Description

Create a release for a tag in your repository

Categories

PublishingDeployment

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
tag_name Yes The name of the tag. This should come from the webhook payload, `github.GITHUB_REF` when a user pushes a new tag
release_name Yes The name of the release. For example, `Release v1.0.1`
body No Text describing the contents of the tag.
body_path No Path to file with information about the tag.
draft No `true` to create a draft (unpublished) release, `false` to create a published one. Default: `false`
prerelease No `true` to identify the release as a prerelease. `false` to identify the release as a full release. Default: `false`
commitish No Any branch or commit SHA the Git tag is created from, unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: SHA of current commit
owner No Owner of the repository if it is not the current one
repo No Repository on which to release. Used only if you want to create the release on another repo

Outputs

NameDescription
id The ID of the created Release
html_url The URL users can navigate to in order to view the release
upload_url The URL for uploading assets to the release
×

Delete Package Versions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/delete-package-versions

Author: Unknown

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/delete-package-versions

Description

Deletes package versions

Categories

Dependency managementPackaging

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
package-version-ids No Comma separated string of package version ids to delete.
owner No Owner of the repo containing the package version to delete. Defaults to the owner of the repo running the action.
package-name Yes Name of the package containing the version to delete.
package-type Yes Type of package. Can be one of container, maven, npm, nuget, or rubygems.
num-old-versions-to-delete No Number of versions to delete starting with the oldest version. Defaults to 1.
min-versions-to-keep No Number of versions to keep starting with the latest version By default keeps no version. To delete all versions set this as 0.
ignore-versions No Regex pattern for package versions to ignore. Defaults to delete all versions.
delete-only-pre-release-versions No Deletes only pre-release versions. The number of pre-release versions to keep can be specified by min-versions-to-keep. When this is set num-old-versions-to-delete and ignore-versions will not be taken into account. By default this is set to false
delete-only-untagged-versions No Deletes only untagged versions in case of a container package. Does not work for other package types. The number of untagged versions to keep can be specified by min-versions-to-keep. When this is set num-old-versions-to-delete will not be taken into account. By default this is set to false
token No Token with the necessary scopes to delete package versions. If num-old-versions-to-delete is used the token also needs the read packages scope. Defaults to github.token scoped to the repo running the action. To delete package versions of a package outside the repo the action is running in use a Personal Access Token stored as a secret.
×

Dependency Review

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/dependency-review-action

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/dependency-review-action

Description

Prevent the introduction of dependencies with known vulnerabilities

Categories

SecurityDependency management

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
repo-token No Token for the repository. Can be passed in using `{{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}`.
fail-on-severity No Don't block PRs below this severity. Possible values are `low`, `moderate`, `high`, `critical`.
fail-on-scopes No Dependency scopes to block PRs on. Comma-separated list. Possible values are 'unknown', 'runtime', and 'development' (e.g. "runtime, development")
base-ref No The base git ref to be used for this check. Has a default value when the workflow event is `pull_request` or `pull_request_target`. Must be provided otherwise.
head-ref No The head git ref to be used for this check. Has a default value when the workflow event is `pull_request` or `pull_request_target`. Must be provided otherwise.
config-file No A path to the configuration file for the action.
allow-licenses No Comma-separated list of allowed licenses (e.g. "MIT, GPL 3.0, BSD 2 Clause")
deny-licenses No Comma-separated list of forbidden licenses (e.g. "MIT, GPL 3.0, BSD 2 Clause")
allow-dependencies-licenses No Comma-separated list of dependencies in purl format (e.g. "pkg:npm/express, pkg:pypi/pycrypto"). These dependencies will be permitted to use any license, no matter what license policy is enforced otherwise.
allow-ghsas No Comma-separated list of allowed GitHub Advisory IDs (e.g. "GHSA-abcd-1234-5679, GHSA-efgh-1234-5679")
external-repo-token No A token for fetching external configuration file if it lives in another repository. It is required if the repository is private
license-check No A boolean to determine if license checks should be performed
vulnerability-check No A boolean to determine if vulnerability checks should be performed
comment-summary-in-pr No Determines if the summary is posted as a comment in the PR itself. Setting this to `always` or `on-failure` requires you to give the workflow `pull-requests: write` permissions
deny-packages No A comma-separated list of package URLs to deny (e.g. "pkg:npm/express, pkg:pypi/pycrypto"). If version specified, only deny matching packages and version; else, deny all regardless of version.
deny-groups No A comma-separated list of package URLs for group(s)/namespace(s) to deny (e.g. "pkg:npm/express/, pkg:pypi/pycrypto/"). Please note that the group name must be followed by a `/`.
retry-on-snapshot-warnings No Whether to retry on snapshot warnings
retry-on-snapshot-warnings-timeout No Number of seconds to wait before stopping snapshot retries.
warn-only No When set to `true` this action will always complete with success, overriding the `fail-on-severity` parameter.
show-openssf-scorecard No Show a summary of the OpenSSF Scorecard scores.
warn-on-openssf-scorecard-level No Numeric threshold for the OpenSSF Scorecard score. If the score is below this threshold, the action will warn you.

Outputs

NameDescription
comment-content Prepared dependency report comment
dependency-changes All dependency changes (JSON)
vulnerable-changes Vulnerable dependency changes (JSON)
invalid-license-changes Invalid license dependency changes (JSON)
denied-changes Denied dependency changes (JSON)
×

Deploy GitHub Pages site

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/deploy-pages

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/deploy-pages

Description

A GitHub Action to deploy an artifact as a GitHub Pages site

Categories

DeploymentPublishing

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
token Yes GitHub token
timeout No Time in milliseconds after which to timeout and cancel the deployment (default: 10 minutes)
error_count No Maximum number of status report errors before cancelling a deployment (default: 10)
reporting_interval No Time in milliseconds between two deployment status report (default: 5 seconds)
artifact_name No Name of the artifact to deploy
preview No Is this attempting to deploy a pull request as a GitHub Pages preview site? (NOTE: This feature is only in alpha currently and is not available to the public!)

Outputs

NameDescription
page_url URL to deployed GitHub Pages

Download a Build Artifact

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/download-artifact

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/download-artifact

Description

Download a build artifact that was previously uploaded in the workflow by the upload-artifact action

Categories

Dependency managementBuildPackaging

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
name No Name of the artifact to download. If unspecified, all artifacts for the run are downloaded.
artifact-ids No IDs of the artifacts to download, comma-separated. Either inputs `artifact-ids` or `name` can be used, but not both.
path No Destination path. Supports basic tilde expansion. Defaults to $GITHUB_WORKSPACE
pattern No A glob pattern matching the artifacts that should be downloaded. Ignored if name is specified.
merge-multiple No When multiple artifacts are matched, this changes the behavior of the destination directories. If true, the downloaded artifacts will be in the same directory specified by path. If false, the downloaded artifacts will be extracted into individual named directories within the specified path.
github-token No The GitHub token used to authenticate with the GitHub API. This is required when downloading artifacts from a different repository or from a different workflow run. If this is not specified, the action will attempt to download artifacts from the current repository and the current workflow run.
repository No The repository owner and the repository name joined together by "/". If github-token is specified, this is the repository that artifacts will be downloaded from.
run-id No The id of the workflow run where the desired download artifact was uploaded from. If github-token is specified, this is the run that artifacts will be downloaded from.

Outputs

NameDescription
download-path Path of artifact download
×

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/github-script

Description

Run simple scripts using the GitHub client

Categories

InfrastructureAuthenticationCode quality

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
script Yes The script to run
github-token No The GitHub token used to create an authenticated client
debug No Whether to tell the GitHub client to log details of its requests. true or false. Default is to run in debug mode when the GitHub Actions step debug logging is turned on.
user-agent No An optional user-agent string
previews No A comma-separated list of GraphQL API previews to accept
result-encoding No Either "string" or "json" (default "json")‚Äîhow the result will be encoded
retries No The number of times to retry a request
retry-exempt-status-codes No A comma separated list of status codes that will NOT be retried e.g. "400,500". No effect unless `retries` is set
base-url No An optional GitHub REST API URL to connect to a different GitHub instance. For example, https://my.github-enterprise-server.com/api/v3

Outputs

NameDescription
result The return value of the script, stringified with `JSON.stringify`

Go Dependency Submission

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/go-dependency-submission

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/go-dependency-submission

Description

Calculates dependencies for a Go build-target and submits the list to the Dependency Submission API

Categories

Dependency managementDocumentation

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
token No GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT). Defaults to PAT provided by Action runner
metadata No User provided map of max key/value pairs of metadata to include with the snapshot e.g. {"lastModified": "12-31-2022"}
go-mod-path Yes Repo path to the go.mod file used to detect dependencies for the Go build target. Defaults to go.mod in the root of the repository.
go-build-target Yes Build target to detect build dependencies. If unspecified, will use "all", with will detect all dependencies used in all build targets (including tests and tools).
snapshot-sha No The SHA that the results will be linked to in the dependency snapshot
snapshot-ref No The ref that the results will be linked to in the dependency snapshot
detector-name No The name of the detector that generated the dependency snapshot
detector-version No The version of the detector that generated the dependency snapshot
detector-url No The URL to the detector that generated the dependency snapshot

NameRequiredDescription

destination No Output directory of the build. Although it can be nested inside the source, it cannot be the same as the source directory.
future No Publishes posts with a future date. When set to true, the build is made with the --future option which overrides the future option that may be set in a Jekyll configuration file.
build_revision No The SHA-1 of the git commit for which the build is running. Default to GITHUB_SHA.
verbose No Verbose output
token Yes GitHub token

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
directory No The directory that contains the maven project
settings-file No Optional path to a Maven settings.xml file for the dependencies to be resolved
ignore-maven-wrapper No Flag for optionally ignoring any maven wrapper files (mvnw) and instead rely on the PATH provided mvn
maven-args No Additional maven arguments to add to the command line invocation of maven when it generates the dependency snapshot
token No The GitHub token to use to submit the depedency snapshot to the repository
snapshot-sha No The SHA that the results will be linked to in the dependency snapshot
snapshot-ref No The ref that the results will be linked to in the dependency snapshot
detector-name No The name of the detector that generated the dependency snapshot
detector-version No The version of the detector that generated the dependency snapshot
detector-url No The URL to the detector that generated the dependency snapshot
correlator No An optional identifier to distinguish between multiple dependency snapshots of the same type

NameRequiredDescription

Outputs

NameDescription

attestation-manifest-sha The sha256 of the provenance attestation uploaded to GHCR. This is not present if the package is not attested, e.g. in enterprise environments.

Setup .NET Core SDK

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/setup-dotnet

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/setup-dotnet

Description

Used to build and publish .NET source. Set up a specific version of the .NET and authentication to private NuGet repository

Categories

BuildDependency managementAuthentication

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
dotnet-version No Optional SDK version(s) to use. If not provided, will install global.json version when available. Examples: 2.2.104, 3.1, 3.1.x, 3.x, 6.0.2xx
dotnet-quality No Optional quality of the build. The possible values are: daily, signed, validated, preview, ga.
global-json-file No Optional global.json location, if your global.json isn't located in the root of the repo.
source-url No Optional package source for which to set up authentication. Will consult any existing NuGet.config in the root of the repo and provide a temporary NuGet.config using the NUGET_AUTH_TOKEN environment variable as a ClearTextPassword
owner No Optional OWNER for using packages from GitHub Package Registry organizations/users other than the current repository's owner. Only used if a GPR URL is also provided in source-url
config-file No Optional NuGet.config location, if your NuGet.config isn't located in the root of the repo.
cache No Optional input to enable caching of the NuGet global-packages folder
cache-dependency-path No Used to specify the path to a dependency file: packages.lock.json. Supports wildcards or a list of file names for caching multiple dependencies.

Outputs

NameDescription
cache-hit A boolean value to indicate if a cache was hit.
dotnet-version Contains the installed by action .NET SDK version for reuse.
×

otp-version No Version range or exact version of OTP to use

install-hex No Whether to install Hex
install-rebar No Whether to install Rebar

‚úì Official Publisher

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/setup-go

Description

Setup a Go environment and add it to the PATH

Categories

Dependency managementBuild

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
go-version No The Go version to download (if necessary) and use. Supports semver spec and ranges. Be sure to enclose this option in single quotation marks.
go-version-file No Path to the go.mod, go.work, .go-version, or .tool-versions file.
check-latest No Set this option to true if you want the action to always check for the latest available version that satisfies the version spec
token No Used to pull Go distributions from go-versions. Since there's a default, this is typically not supplied by the user. When running this action on github.com, the default value is sufficient. When running on GHES, you can pass a personal access token for github.com if you are experiencing rate limiting.
cache No Used to specify whether caching is needed. Set to true, if you'd like to enable caching.
cache-dependency-path No Used to specify the path to a dependency file - go.sum
architecture No Target architecture for Go to use. Examples: x86, x64. Will use system architecture by default.

Outputs

NameDescription
go-version The installed Go version. Useful when given a version range as input.
cache-hit A boolean value to indicate if a cache was hit

‚úì Official Publisher

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/setup-haskell

Description

Set up a specific version of GHC and Cabal and add the command-line tools to the PATH

Categories

Dependency managementBuildInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
ghc-version No Version of GHC to use. If set to "latest", it will always get the latest stable version.
cabal-version No Version of Cabal to use. If set to "latest", it will always get the latest stable version.
stack-version No Version of Stack to use. If set to "latest", it will always get the latest stable version.
enable-stack No If specified, will setup Stack
stack-no-global No If specified, enable-stack must be set. Prevents installing GHC and Cabal globally
stack-setup-ghc No If specified, enable-stack must be set. Will run stack setup to install the specified GHC

Outputs

NameDescription
ghc-path The path of the ghc executable _directory_
cabal-path The path of the cabal executable _directory_
stack-path The path of the stack executable _directory_
cabal-store The path to the cabal store
ghc-exe The path of the ghc _executable_
cabal-exe The path of the cabal _executable_
stack-exe The path of the stack _executable_

Setup Java JDK

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/setup-java

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/setup-java

Description

Set up a specific version of the Java JDK and add the command-line tools to the PATH

Categories

Dependency managementBuildInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
java-version No The Java version to set up. Takes a whole or semver Java version. See examples of supported syntax in README file
java-version-file No The path to the `.java-version` file. See examples of supported syntax in README file
distribution Yes Java distribution. See the list of supported distributions in README file
java-package No The package type (jdk, jre, jdk+fx, jre+fx)
architecture No The architecture of the package (defaults to the action runner's architecture)
jdkFile No Path to where the compressed JDK is located
check-latest No Set this option if you want the action to check for the latest available version that satisfies the version spec
server-id No ID of the distributionManagement repository in the pom.xml file. Default is `github`
server-username No Environment variable name for the username for authentication to the Apache Maven repository. Default is $GITHUB_ACTOR
server-password No Environment variable name for password or token for authentication to the Apache Maven repository. Default is $GITHUB_TOKEN
settings-path No Path to where the settings.xml file will be written. Default is ~/.m2.
overwrite-settings No Overwrite the settings.xml file if it exists. Default is "true".
gpg-private-key No GPG private key to import. Default is empty string.
gpg-passphrase No Environment variable name for the GPG private key passphrase. Default is $GPG_PASSPHRASE.
cache No Name of the build platform to cache dependencies. It can be "maven", "gradle" or "sbt".
cache-dependency-path No The path to a dependency file: pom.xml, build.gradle, build.sbt, etc. This option can be used with the `cache` option. If this option is omitted, the action searches for the dependency file in the entire repository. This option supports wildcards and a list of file names for caching multiple dependencies.
job-status No Workaround to pass job status to post job step. This variable is not intended for manual setting
token No The token used to authenticate when fetching version manifests hosted on github.com, such as for the Microsoft Build of OpenJDK. When running this action on github.com, the default value is sufficient. When running on GHES, you can pass a personal access token for github.com if you are experiencing rate limiting.
mvn-toolchain-id No Name of Maven Toolchain ID if the default name of "${distribution}_${java-version}" is not wanted. See examples of supported syntax in Advanced Usage file
mvn-toolchain-vendor No Name of Maven Toolchain Vendor if the default name of "${distribution}" is not wanted. See examples of supported syntax in Advanced Usage file

Outputs

NameDescription
distribution Distribution of Java that has been installed
version Actual version of the java environment that has been installed
path Path to where the java environment has been installed (same as $JAVA_HOME)
cache-hit A boolean value to indicate an exact match was found for the primary key
×

Setup Node.js environment

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/setup-node

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/setup-node

Description

Setup a Node.js environment by adding problem matchers and optionally downloading and adding it to the PATH.

Categories

Dependency managementBuildInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
node-version No Version Spec of the version to use. Examples: 12.x, 10.15.1, >=10.15.0.
node-version-file No File containing the version Spec of the version to use. Examples: package.json, .nvmrc, .node-version, .tool-versions.
architecture No Target architecture for Node to use. Examples: x86, x64. Will use system architecture by default.
check-latest No Set this option if you want the action to check for the latest available version that satisfies the version spec.
registry-url No Optional registry to set up for auth. Will set the registry in a project level .npmrc and .yarnrc file, and set up auth to read in from env.NODE_AUTH_TOKEN.
scope No Optional scope for authenticating against scoped registries. Will fall back to the repository owner when using the GitHub Packages registry (https://npm.pkg.github.com/).
token No Used to pull node distributions from node-versions. Since there's a default, this is typically not supplied by the user. When running this action on github.com, the default value is sufficient. When running on GHES, you can pass a personal access token for github.com if you are experiencing rate limiting.
cache No Used to specify a package manager for caching in the default directory. Supported values: npm, yarn, pnpm.
package-manager-cache No Set to false to disable automatic caching. By default, caching is enabled when either devEngines.packageManager or the top-level packageManager field in package.json specifies npm as the package manager.
cache-dependency-path No Used to specify the path to a dependency file: package-lock.json, yarn.lock, etc. Supports wildcards or a list of file names for caching multiple dependencies.
mirror No Used to specify an alternative mirror to downlooad Node.js binaries from
mirror-token No The token used as Authorization header when fetching from the mirror

Outputs

NameDescription
cache-hit A boolean value to indicate if a cache was hit.
node-version The installed node version.
×

Setup Python

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/setup-python

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/setup-python

Description

Set up a specific version of Python and add the command-line tools to the PATH.

Categories

Dependency managementBuildInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
python-version No Version range or exact version of Python or PyPy to use, using SemVer's version range syntax. Reads from .python-version if unset.
python-version-file No File containing the Python version to use. Example: .python-version
cache No Used to specify a package manager for caching in the default directory. Supported values: pip, pipenv, poetry.
architecture No The target architecture (x86, x64, arm64) of the Python or PyPy interpreter.
check-latest No Set this option if you want the action to check for the latest available version that satisfies the version spec.
token No The token used to authenticate when fetching Python distributions from https://github.com/actions/python-versions. When running this action on github.com, the default value is sufficient. When running on GHES, you can pass a personal access token for github.com if you are experiencing rate limiting.
cache-dependency-path No Used to specify the path to dependency files. Supports wildcards or a list of file names for caching multiple dependencies.
update-environment No Set this option if you want the action to update environment variables.
allow-prereleases No When 'true', a version range passed to 'python-version' input will match prerelease versions if no GA versions are found. Only 'x.y' version range is supported for CPython.
freethreaded No When 'true', use the freethreaded version of Python.
pip-version No Used to specify the version of pip to install with the Python. Supported format: major[.minor][.patch].
pip-install No Used to specify the packages to install with pip after setting up Python. Can be a requirements file or package names.

Outputs

NameDescription
python-version The installed Python or PyPy version. Useful when given a version range as input.
cache-hit A boolean value to indicate a cache entry was found
python-path The absolute path to the Python or PyPy executable.

Close Stale Issues

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/stale

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/stale

Description

Close issues and pull requests with no recent activity

Categories

CommunicationCode qualityNotification

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
repo-token No Token for the repository. Can be passed in using `{{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}`.
stale-issue-message No The message to post on the issue when tagging it. If none provided, will not mark issues stale.
stale-pr-message No The message to post on the pull request when tagging it. If none provided, will not mark pull requests stale.
close-issue-message No The message to post on the issue when closing it. If none provided, will not comment when closing an issue.
close-pr-message No The message to post on the pull request when closing it. If none provided, will not comment when closing a pull requests.
days-before-stale No The number of days old an issue or a pull request can be before marking it stale. Set to -1 to never mark issues or pull requests as stale automatically.
days-before-issue-stale No The number of days old an issue can be before marking it stale. Set to -1 to never mark issues as stale automatically. Override "days-before-stale" option regarding only the issues.
days-before-pr-stale No The number of days old a pull request can be before marking it stale. Set to -1 to never mark pull requests as stale automatically. Override "days-before-stale" option regarding only the pull requests.
days-before-close No The number of days to wait to close an issue or a pull request after it being marked stale. Set to -1 to never close stale issues or pull requests.
days-before-issue-close No The number of days to wait to close an issue after it being marked stale. Set to -1 to never close stale issues. Override "days-before-close" option regarding only the issues.
days-before-pr-close No The number of days to wait to close a pull request after it being marked stale. Set to -1 to never close stale pull requests. Override "days-before-close" option regarding only the pull requests.
stale-issue-label No The label to apply when an issue is stale.
close-issue-label No The label to apply when an issue is closed.
exempt-issue-labels No The labels that mean an issue is exempt from being marked stale. Separate multiple labels with commas (eg. "label1,label2").
close-issue-reason No The reason to use when closing an issue.
stale-pr-label No The label to apply when a pull request is stale.
close-pr-label No The label to apply when a pull request is closed.
exempt-pr-labels No The labels that mean a pull request is exempt from being marked as stale. Separate multiple labels with commas (eg. "label1,label2").
exempt-milestones No The milestones that mean an issue or a pull request is exempt from being marked as stale. Separate multiple milestones with commas (eg. "milestone1,milestone2").
exempt-issue-milestones No The milestones that mean an issue is exempt from being marked as stale. Separate multiple milestones with commas (eg. "milestone1,milestone2"). Override "exempt-milestones" option regarding only the issues.
exempt-pr-milestones No The milestones that mean a pull request is exempt from being marked as stale. Separate multiple milestones with commas (eg. "milestone1,milestone2"). Override "exempt-milestones" option regarding only the pull requests.
exempt-all-milestones No Exempt all issues and pull requests with milestones from being marked as stale. Default to false.
exempt-all-issue-milestones No Exempt all issues with milestones from being marked as stale. Override "exempt-all-milestones" option regarding only the issues.
exempt-all-pr-milestones No Exempt all pull requests with milestones from being marked as stale. Override "exempt-all-milestones" option regarding only the pull requests.
only-labels No Only issues or pull requests with all of these labels are checked if stale. Defaults to `` (disabled) and can be a comma-separated list of labels.
any-of-labels No Only issues or pull requests with at least one of these labels are checked if stale. Defaults to `` (disabled) and can be a comma-separated list of labels.
any-of-issue-labels No Only issues with at least one of these labels are checked if stale. Defaults to `` (disabled) and can be a comma-separated list of labels. Override "any-of-labels" option regarding only the issues.
any-of-pr-labels No Only pull requests with at least one of these labels are checked if stale. Defaults to `` (disabled) and can be a comma-separated list of labels. Override "any-of-labels" option regarding only the pull requests.
only-issue-labels No Only issues with all of these labels are checked if stale. Defaults to `[]` (disabled) and can be a comma-separated list of labels. Override "only-labels" option regarding only the issues.
only-pr-labels No Only pull requests with all of these labels are checked if stale. Defaults to `[]` (disabled) and can be a comma-separated list of labels. Override "only-labels" option regarding only the pull requests.
operations-per-run No The maximum number of operations per run, used to control rate limiting (GitHub API CRUD related).
remove-stale-when-updated No Remove stale labels from issues and pull requests when they are updated or commented on.
remove-issue-stale-when-updated No Remove stale labels from issues when they are updated or commented on. Override "remove-stale-when-updated" option regarding only the issues.
remove-pr-stale-when-updated No Remove stale labels from pull requests when they are updated or commented on. Override "remove-stale-when-updated" option regarding only the pull requests.
debug-only No Run the processor in debug mode without actually performing any operations on live issues.
ascending No The order to get issues or pull requests. Defaults to false, which is descending.
sort-by No What to sort results by. Valid options are `created`, `updated`, and `comments`. Defaults to `created`.
delete-branch No Delete the git branch after closing a stale pull request.
start-date No The date used to skip the stale action on issue/pull request created before it (ISO 8601 or RFC 2822).
exempt-assignees No The assignees which exempt an issue or a pull request from being marked as stale. Separate multiple assignees with commas (eg. "user1,user2").
exempt-issue-assignees No The assignees which exempt an issue from being marked as stale. Separate multiple assignees with commas (eg. "user1,user2"). Override "exempt-assignees" option regarding only the issues.
exempt-pr-assignees No The assignees which exempt a pull request from being marked as stale. Separate multiple assignees with commas (eg. "user1,user2"). Override "exempt-assignees" option regarding only the pull requests.
exempt-all-assignees No Exempt all issues and pull requests with assignees from being marked as stale. Default to false.
exempt-all-issue-assignees No Exempt all issues with assignees from being marked as stale. Override "exempt-all-assignees" option regarding only the issues.
exempt-all-pr-assignees No Exempt all pull requests with assignees from being marked as stale. Override "exempt-all-assignees" option regarding only the pull requests.
exempt-draft-pr No Exempt draft pull requests from being marked as stale. Default to false.
enable-statistics No Display some statistics at the end regarding the stale workflow (only when the logs are enabled).
labels-to-add-when-unstale No A comma delimited list of labels to add when an issue or pull request becomes unstale.
labels-to-remove-when-stale No A comma delimited list of labels to remove when an issue or pull request becomes stale.
labels-to-remove-when-unstale No A comma delimited list of labels to remove when an issue or pull request becomes unstale.
ignore-updates No Any update (update/comment) can reset the stale idle time on the issues and pull requests.
ignore-issue-updates No Any update (update/comment) can reset the stale idle time on the issues. Override "ignore-updates" option regarding only the issues.
ignore-pr-updates No Any update (update/comment) can reset the stale idle time on the pull requests. Override "ignore-updates" option regarding only the pull requests.
include-only-assigned No Only the issues or the pull requests with an assignee will be marked as stale automatically.
only-issue-types No Only issues with a matching type are processed as stale/closed. Defaults to `[]` (disabled) and can be a comma-separated list of issue types.

Outputs

NameDescription
closed-issues-prs List of all closed issues and pull requests.
staled-issues-prs List of all staled issues and pull requests.
×

×

Upload a Build Artifact

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/actions/upload-artifact

Author: GitHub

Publisher: actions

Repository: github.com/actions/upload-artifact

Description

Upload a build artifact that can be used by subsequent workflow steps

Categories

PackagingBuildDependency management

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
name No Artifact name
path Yes A file, directory or wildcard pattern that describes what to upload
if-no-files-found No The desired behavior if no files are found using the provided path. Available Options: warn: Output a warning but do not fail the action error: Fail the action with an error message ignore: Do not output any warnings or errors, the action does not fail
retention-days No Duration after which artifact will expire in days. 0 means using default retention. Minimum 1 day. Maximum 90 days unless changed from the repository settings page.
compression-level No The level of compression for Zlib to be applied to the artifact archive. The value can range from 0 to 9: - 0: No compression - 1: Best speed - 6: Default compression (same as GNU Gzip) - 9: Best compression Higher levels will result in better compression, but will take longer to complete. For large files that are not easily compressed, a value of 0 is recommended for significantly faster uploads.
overwrite No If true, an artifact with a matching name will be deleted before a new one is uploaded. If false, the action will fail if an artifact for the given name already exists. Does not fail if the artifact does not exist.
include-hidden-files No If true, hidden files will be included in the artifact. If false, hidden files will be excluded from the artifact.

Outputs

NameDescription
artifact-id A unique identifier for the artifact that was just uploaded. Empty if the artifact upload failed. This ID can be used as input to other APIs to download, delete or get more information about an artifact: https://docs.github.com/en/rest/actions/artifacts
artifact-url A download URL for the artifact that was just uploaded. Empty if the artifact upload failed. This download URL only works for requests Authenticated with GitHub. Anonymous downloads will be prompted to first login. If an anonymous download URL is needed than a short time restricted URL can be generated using the download artifact API: https://docs.github.com/en/rest/actions/artifacts#download-an-artifact This URL will be valid for as long as the artifact exists and the workflow run and repository exists. Once an artifact has expired this URL will no longer work. Common uses cases for such a download URL can be adding download links to artifacts in descriptions or comments on pull requests or issues.
artifact-digest SHA-256 digest for the artifact that was just uploaded. Empty if the artifact upload failed.
×
