semantic-pull-request

Action ID: marketplace/amannn/action-semantic-pull-request

Author: Jan Amann <jan@amann.work>

Publisher: amannn

Repository: github.com/amannn/action-semantic-pull-request

Description

Ensure your PR title matches the Conventional Commits spec (https://www.conventionalcommits.org/).

Categories

Code qualityTesting

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
types No Provide custom types (newline delimited) if you don't want the default ones from https://www.conventionalcommits.org. These are regex patterns auto-wrapped in `^ $`.
scopes No Configure which scopes are allowed (newline delimited). These are regex patterns auto-wrapped in `^ $`.
requireScope No Configure that a scope must always be provided.
disallowScopes No Configure which scopes are disallowed in PR titles (newline delimited). These are regex patterns auto-wrapped in ` ^$`.
subjectPattern No Configure additional validation for the subject based on a regex. E.g. '^(?![A-Z]).+$' ensures the subject doesn't start with an uppercase character.
subjectPatternError No If `subjectPattern` is configured, you can use this property to override the default error message that is shown when the pattern doesn't match. The variables `subject` and `title` can be used within the message.
validateSingleCommit No When using "Squash and merge" on a PR with only one commit, GitHub will suggest using that commit message instead of the PR title for the merge commit, and it's easy to commit this by mistake. Enable this option to also validate the commit message for one commit PRs.
validateSingleCommitMatchesPrTitle No Related to `validateSingleCommit` you can opt-in to validate that the PR title matches a single commit to avoid confusion.
githubBaseUrl No The GitHub base URL will be automatically set to the correct value from the GitHub context variable. If you want to override this, you can do so here (not recommended).
ignoreLabels No If the PR contains one of these labels (newline delimited), the validation is skipped. If you want to rerun the validation when labels change, you might want to use the `labeled` and `unlabeled` event triggers in your workflow.
headerPattern No If you're using a format for the PR title that differs from the traditional Conventional Commits spec, you can use this to customize the parsing of the type, scope and subject. The `headerPattern` should contain a regex where the capturing groups in parentheses correspond to the parts listed in `headerPatternCorrespondence`. For more details see: https://github.com/conventional-changelog/conventional-changelog/tree/master/packages/conventional-commits-parser#headerpattern
headerPatternCorrespondence No If `headerPattern` is configured, you can use this to define which capturing groups correspond to the type, scope and subject.
wip No For work-in-progress PRs you can typically use draft pull requests from Github. However, private repositories on the free plan don't have this option and therefore this action allows you to opt-in to using the special '[WIP]' prefix to indicate this state. This will avoid the validation of the PR title and the pull request checks remain pending. Note that a second check will be reported if this is enabled.
×

LLM Action

Action ID: marketplace/appleboy/LLM-action

Author: appleboy

Publisher: appleboy

Repository: github.com/appleboy/LLM-action

Description

GitHub Action to interact with OpenAI Compatible LLM services

Categories

CommunicationAuthenticationTesting

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
base_url No Base URL for OpenAI Compatible API endpoint
api_key Yes API Key for authentication
model No Model name to use
skip_ssl_verify No Skip SSL certificate verification
system_prompt No System prompt to set the context. Supports plain text, file path, or URL (http://, https://). For files, use absolute/relative path or file:// prefix. Supports Go templates with environment variables (e.g., {{.GITHUB_REPOSITORY}}, {{.MODEL}}).
input_prompt Yes User input prompt for the LLM. Supports plain text, file path, or URL (http://, https://). For files, use absolute/relative path or file:// prefix. Supports Go templates with environment variables (e.g., {{.GITHUB_REPOSITORY}}, {{.MODEL}}).
temperature No Temperature for response randomness (0.0-2.0)
max_tokens No Maximum tokens in the response
tool_schema No JSON schema for structured output via function calling. Supports plain text, file path, or URL. Supports Go templates with environment variables (e.g., {{.GITHUB_REPOSITORY}}).
debug No Enable debug mode to print all parameters
headers No Custom HTTP headers to include in API requests. Format: "Header1:Value1,Header2:Value2" or multiline with one header per line. Useful for log analysis or custom authentication.

Outputs

NameDescription
response The response from the LLM
×

Build and push Docker images

Action ID: marketplace/appleboy/build-push-action

Author: docker

Publisher: appleboy

Repository: github.com/appleboy/build-push-action

Description

Build and push Docker images with Buildx

Categories

BuildPackagingDeployment

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
add-hosts No List of a customs host-to-IP mapping (e.g., docker:10.180.0.1)
allow No List of extra privileged entitlement (e.g., network.host,security.insecure)
attests No List of attestation parameters (e.g., type=sbom,generator=image)
build-args No List of build-time variables
build-contexts No List of additional build contexts (e.g., name=path)
builder No Builder instance
cache-from No List of external cache sources for buildx (e.g., user/app:cache, type=local,src=path/to/dir)
cache-to No List of cache export destinations for buildx (e.g., user/app:cache, type=local,dest=path/to/dir)
cgroup-parent No Optional parent cgroup for the container used in the build
context No Build's context is the set of files located in the specified PATH or URL
file No Path to the Dockerfile
labels No List of metadata for an image
load No Load is a shorthand for --output=type=docker
network No Set the networking mode for the RUN instructions during build
no-cache No Do not use cache when building the image
no-cache-filters No Do not cache specified stages
outputs No List of output destinations (format: type=local,dest=path)
platforms No List of target platforms for build
provenance No Generate provenance attestation for the build (shorthand for --attest=type=provenance)
pull No Always attempt to pull all referenced images
push No Push is a shorthand for --output=type=registry
insecure No insecure
sbom No Generate SBOM attestation for the build (shorthand for --attest=type=sbom)
secrets No List of secrets to expose to the build (e.g., key=string, GIT_AUTH_TOKEN=mytoken)
secret-files No List of secret files to expose to the build (e.g., key=filename, MY_SECRET=./secret.txt)
shm-size No Size of /dev/shm (e.g., 2g)
ssh No List of SSH agent socket or keys to expose to the build
tags No List of tags
target No Sets the target stage to build
ulimit No Ulimit options (e.g., nofile=1024:1024)
github-token No GitHub Token used to authenticate against a repository for Git context

Outputs

NameDescription
imageid Image ID
digest Image digest
metadata Build result metadata
×

Checkout

Action ID: marketplace/appleboy/checkout

Author: Unknown

Publisher: appleboy

Repository: github.com/appleboy/checkout

Description

Checkout a Git repository at a particular version

Categories

Dependency managementAuthentication

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
repository No Repository name with owner. For example, actions/checkout
ref No The branch, tag or SHA to checkout. When checking out the repository that triggered a workflow, this defaults to the reference or SHA for that event. Otherwise, uses the default branch.
token No Personal access token (PAT) used to fetch the repository. The PAT is configured with the local git config, which enables your scripts to run authenticated git commands. The post-job step removes the PAT. We recommend using a service account with the least permissions necessary. Also when generating a new PAT, select the least scopes necessary. [Learn more about creating and using encrypted secrets](https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/creating-and-using-encrypted-secrets)
ssh-key No SSH key used to fetch the repository. The SSH key is configured with the local git config, which enables your scripts to run authenticated git commands. The post-job step removes the SSH key. We recommend using a service account with the least permissions necessary. [Learn more about creating and using encrypted secrets](https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/creating-and-using-encrypted-secrets)
ssh-known-hosts No Known hosts in addition to the user and global host key database. The public SSH keys for a host may be obtained using the utility `ssh-keyscan`. For example, `ssh-keyscan github.com`. The public key for github.com is always implicitly added.
ssh-strict No Whether to perform strict host key checking. When true, adds the options `StrictHostKeyChecking=yes` and `CheckHostIP=no` to the SSH command line. Use the input `ssh-known-hosts` to configure additional hosts.
persist-credentials No Whether to configure the token or SSH key with the local git config
path No Relative path under $GITHUB_WORKSPACE to place the repository
clean No Whether to execute `git clean -ffdx && git reset --hard HEAD` before fetching
sparse-checkout No Do a sparse checkout on given patterns. Each pattern should be separated with new lines
sparse-checkout-cone-mode No Specifies whether to use cone-mode when doing a sparse checkout.
fetch-depth No Number of commits to fetch. 0 indicates all history for all branches and tags.
lfs No Whether to download Git-LFS files
submodules No Whether to checkout submodules: `true` to checkout submodules or `recursive` to recursively checkout submodules. When the `ssh-key` input is not provided, SSH URLs beginning with `git@github.com:` are converted to HTTPS.
set-safe-directory No Add repository path as safe.directory for Git global config by running `git config --global --add safe.directory <path>`
github-server-url No The base URL for the GitHub instance that you are trying to clone from, will use environment defaults to fetch from the same instance that the workflow is running from unless specified. Example URLs are https://github.com or https://my-ghes-server.example.com
×

NameRequiredDescription

database_password No database password
database_name No database name
database_host No database host
database_opts No see the `pg_dump`, `mysqldump` or `mongodump` command
storage_driver No support `s3` or `disk`. default is `s3`
access_key_id No minio or aws s3 access key id
secret_access_key No minio or aws s3 secret access key
storage_endpoint No s3 endpoint. default is `s3.amazonaws.com`

Discord Message Notify

Action ID: marketplace/appleboy/discord-action

Author: Bo-Yi Wu

Publisher: appleboy

Repository: github.com/appleboy/discord-action

Description

Send a message to a Discord channel using a webhook. This action allows you to notify a Discord channel by sending a message through a webhook.

Categories

CommunicationNotification

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
webhook_url No The URL of the Discord webhook. This is the endpoint where the message will be sent.
webhook_id No The ID of the Discord webhook. This is a unique identifier for the webhook.
webhook_token No The token of the Discord webhook. This token is used to authenticate the webhook.
message No The content of the message to send. The message can be up to 2000 characters long.
file No The content of the file to send. You can attach a file to the message.
color No The color code for the embed message. This sets the color of the embed's side border.
wait No Wait for server confirmation before responding. If set to true, the action will return the created message body.
tts No Set to true if the message should be read aloud using text-to-speech. This enables the text-to-speech feature for the message.
username No Override the default username of the webhook. This allows you to set a custom username for the message sender.
avatar_url No Override the default avatar of the webhook. This allows you to set a custom avatar for the message sender.
debug No Enable debug mode. If set to true, the action will output the request and response details.
×

AWS Lambda Deploy

Action ID: marketplace/appleboy/lambda-action

Author: Bo-Yi Wu

Publisher: appleboy

Repository: github.com/appleboy/lambda-action

Description

Deploying Lambda code to an existing function

Categories

DeploymentAuthenticationInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
aws_region No AWS Region
aws_access_key_id No AWS ACCESS KEY
aws_secret_access_key No AWS SECRET KEY
aws_session_token No AWS Session token
aws_profile No AWS profile
function_name No AWS lambda function name
s3_bucket No An Amazon S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as your function. The bucket can be in a different AWS account.
s3_key No The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.
s3_object_version No AWS lambda s3 object version
zip_file No AWS lambda zip file
source No zip file list
dry_run No Set to true to validate the request parameters and access permissions without modifying the function code.
debug No Show debug message after upload the lambda successfully.
publish No Set to true to publish a new version of the function after updating the code.
reversion_id No Only update the function if the revision ID matches the ID that is specified.
memory_size No The amount of memory that your function has access to. Increasing the function memory also increases its CPU allocation. The default value is 128 MB. The value must be a multiple of 64 MB.
timeout No The amount of time that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it. The default is 3 seconds. The maximum allowed value is 900 seconds.
handler No The name of the method within your code that Lambda calls to execute your function.
role No The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function execution role.
runtime No The identifier of the function runtime.
environment No Lambda Environment variables.
layers No A list of function layers, to add to the function execution environment. Specify each layer by its ARN, including the version
image_uri No URI of a container image in the Amazon ECR registry.
subnets No Select the VPC subnets for Lambda to use to set up your VPC configuration.
securitygroups No Choose the VPC security groups for Lambda to use to set up your VPC configuration.
description No A description of the function.
tracing_mode No Set Mode to Active to sample and trace a subset of incoming requests with AWS X-Ray.
max_attempts No the maximum number of times the waiter should attempt to check the resource for the target state
architectures No The instruction set architecture that the function supports. Architecture is a string array with one of the valid values. The default architecture value is x86_64.
ipv6_dual_stack No Enables or disables dual-stack IPv6 support in the VPC configuration

SCP Command to Transfer Files

Action ID: marketplace/appleboy/scp-action

Author: Bo-Yi Wu

Publisher: appleboy

Repository: github.com/appleboy/scp-action

Description

Easily transfer files and folders using the SCP command in Linux.

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
host No Remote host address for SCP (e.g., example.com or 192.168.1.1).
port No Remote SSH port for SCP. Default: 22.
username No Username for SSH authentication.
password No Password for SSH authentication (not recommended; use SSH keys if possible).
protocol No IP protocol to use. Valid values: 'tcp', 'tcp4', or 'tcp6'. Default: tcp.
timeout No Timeout for establishing SSH connection to the remote host. Default: 30s.
command_timeout No Timeout for the SCP command execution. Default: 10m.
key No Content of the SSH private key (e.g., the raw content of ~/.ssh/id_rsa).
key_path No Path to the SSH private key file.
passphrase No Passphrase for the SSH private key, if required.
fingerprint No SHA256 fingerprint of the host's public key. If not set, host key verification is skipped (not recommended for production).
use_insecure_cipher No Enable additional, less secure ciphers for compatibility. Not recommended unless required.
target No Target directory path on the remote server. Must be a directory.
source No List of files or directories to transfer (local paths).
rm No Remove the target directory on the server before uploading new data.
debug No Enable debug messages for troubleshooting.
strip_components No Remove the specified number of leading path elements when extracting files.
overwrite No Use the --overwrite flag with tar to overwrite existing files.
tar_dereference No Use the --dereference flag with tar to follow symlinks.
tar_tmp_path No Temporary path for the tar file on the destination host.
tar_exec No Path to the tar executable on the destination host. Default: tar.
proxy_host No Remote host address for SSH proxy.
proxy_port No SSH proxy port. Default: 22.
proxy_username No Username for SSH proxy authentication.
proxy_password No Password for SSH proxy authentication.
proxy_passphrase No Passphrase for the SSH proxy private key, if required.
proxy_timeout No Timeout for establishing SSH connection to the proxy host. Default: 30s.
proxy_key No Content of the SSH proxy private key (e.g., the raw content of ~/.ssh/id_rsa).
proxy_key_path No Path to the SSH proxy private key file.
proxy_fingerprint No SHA256 fingerprint of the proxy host's public key. If not set, host key verification is skipped (not recommended for production).
proxy_use_insecure_cipher No Enable additional, less secure ciphers for the proxy connection. Not recommended unless required.
curl_insecure No When true, uses the --insecure option with curl for insecure downloads.
capture_stdout No When true, captures and returns standard output from the commands as action output.
version No The version of drone-scp to use.

Outputs

NameDescription
stdout Standard output of the executed commands when capture_stdout is enabled.
×

SSH Remote Commands

Action ID: marketplace/appleboy/ssh-action

Author: Bo-Yi Wu

Publisher: appleboy

Repository: github.com/appleboy/ssh-action

Description

Executing remote ssh commands

Categories

InfrastructureCommunication

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
host No SSH host address or IP to connect to.
port No SSH port number for the connection.
passphrase No Passphrase to decrypt the SSH private key if protected.
username No SSH username for authentication on the remote server.
password No SSH password for authentication (use secrets for sensitive data).
protocol No IP protocol version to use. Options: "tcp" (default), "tcp4" (IPv4 only), or "tcp6" (IPv6 only).
sync No When true, executes commands synchronously across multiple hosts (one after another).
use_insecure_cipher No Enable additional legacy ciphers that might be less secure but more compatible with older systems.
cipher No Specify custom cipher algorithms for encryption. Leave empty to use secure defaults.
timeout No Maximum time to wait when establishing the SSH connection, e.g., '30s', '1m'.
command_timeout No Maximum execution time for the remote commands before terminating, e.g., '10m', '1h'.
key No Raw content of the SSH private key for authentication (use secrets for sensitive data).
key_path No Path to the SSH private key file on the runner.
fingerprint No SHA256 fingerprint of the host public key for verification to prevent MITM attacks.
proxy_host No Proxy server hostname or IP if connecting through an SSH jump host.
proxy_port No SSH port number for the proxy connection.
proxy_username No Username for authentication on the proxy server.
proxy_password No Password for authentication on the proxy server (use secrets for sensitive data).
proxy_protocol No IP protocol version for proxy. Options: "tcp" (default), "tcp4" (IPv4 only), or "tcp6" (IPv6 only).
proxy_passphrase No Passphrase to decrypt the proxy SSH private key if protected.
proxy_timeout No Maximum time to wait when establishing the proxy SSH connection, e.g., '30s', '1m'.
proxy_key No Raw content of the SSH proxy private key for authentication (use secrets for sensitive data).
proxy_key_path No Path to the SSH proxy private key file on the runner.
proxy_fingerprint No SHA256 fingerprint of the proxy host public key for verification.
proxy_cipher No Specify custom cipher algorithms for proxy connection encryption.
proxy_use_insecure_cipher No Enable additional legacy ciphers for proxy connections (less secure but more compatible).
script No Commands to execute on the remote server (inline script string).
script_path No Path to a local file containing commands to execute on the remote server.
envs No Environment variables to expose to the remote script, format: key=value,key2=value2.
envs_format No Format specification for environment variable transfer (for advanced usage).
debug No Set to true to enable verbose logging for troubleshooting connection issues.
allenvs No When true, passes all GitHub Actions environment variables to the remote script.
request_pty No Request a pseudo-terminal from the server (required for interactive commands or sudo).
curl_insecure No When true, uses the --insecure option with curl for insecure downloads.
capture_stdout No When true, captures and returns standard output from the commands as action output.
version No The version of drone-ssh to use.

Outputs

NameDescription
stdout Standard output of the executed commands when capture_stdout is enabled.
×

Gitea Sync Secrets

Action ID: marketplace/appleboy/sync-secrets-action

Author: Bo-Yi Wu

Publisher: appleboy

Repository: github.com/appleboy/sync-secrets-action

Description

Copies secrets from the action's environment to many other repos.

Categories

SecurityDependency management

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
gitea_token Yes Token to use to get repos and write secrets
gitea_server Yes The URL of the Gitea server to use.
repos No New line deliminated to select repositories to copy secrets to.
orgs No New line deliminated to select organizations to copy secrets to.
gitea_skip_verify No When set to `true`, the action will skip SSL verification when making requests to the Gitea API. Defaults to `false`.
secrets Yes New line deliminated regex expressions to select values from `process.env`. Use the action env to pass secrets from the repository in which this action runs with the `env` attribute of the step.
dry_run No Run everything except for secret create and update functionality.
debug No Enable debug mode to output detailed logging information for troubleshooting.
environment No If this value is set, the action will set the secrets to the repositories environment with the name of this value. Only works if `target` is set to `actions` (default).
description No Optional description for the sync operation to help identify the purpose of this secrets synchronization.

Speech to Text OpenAI Whisper

Action ID: marketplace/appleboy/whisper-action

Repository: github.com/appleboy/whisper-action

Description

High-performance inference of OpenAI Whisper automatic speech recognition (ASR) model

Categories

TestingCode quality

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
model No public whisper model. (available: small, medium and large)
audio_path No Audio Path.
output_folder No output folder.
output_format No output format, support txt, srt, csv.
output_filename No output filename.
debug No enable debug mode.
print_progress No print progress.
print_segment No print segment.
youtube_url No youtube url
translate No translate from source language to english
cut_silences No cut silences
prompt No initial prompt
×

Post Amazon Cloudwatch Metrics

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/action-cloudwatch-metrics

Author: ROS Tooling Working Group

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/action-cloudwatch-metrics

Description

Publishes a metric to Amazon CloudWatch.

Categories

MonitoringInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
metric-name No Name of the metric to be published
metric-value No Value of the metric to be published true, and false are respectfully converted to 1.0, and 0.0 automatically
metric-dimensions No Dimension of the metric to be published, as a JSON object
metric-data No Path to a JSON file containing CloudWatch-compatible metrics, according to https://awscli.amazonaws.com/v2/documentation/api/latest/reference/cloudwatch/put-metric-data.html If this input is specified, the action will ignore the single-value inputs "metric-name", "metric-value", "metric-dimensions" and only publish the data from this file.
namespace No The namespace for the metric data.
×

Amazon ECR "Login" Action for GitHub Actions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/amazon-ecr-login

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/amazon-ecr-login

Description

Logs in the local Docker client to one or more Amazon ECR Private registries or an Amazon ECR Public registry

Categories

AuthenticationInfrastructurePackaging

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
http-proxy No Proxy to use for the AWS SDK agent.
mask-password No Mask the docker password to prevent it being printed to action logs if debug logging is enabled. NOTE: This will prevent the Docker password output from being shared between separate jobs. Options: ['true', 'false']
registries No A comma-delimited list of AWS account IDs that are associated with the ECR Private registries. If you do not specify a registry, the default ECR Private registry is assumed. If 'public' is given as input to 'registry-type', this input is ignored.
registry-type No Which ECR registry type to log into. Options: [private, public]
skip-logout No Whether to skip explicit logout of the registries during post-job cleanup. Exists for backward compatibility on self-hosted runners. Not recommended. Options: ['true', 'false']

Outputs

NameDescription
registry The URI of the ECR Private or ECR Public registry. If logging into multiple registries on ECR Private, this output will not be set.
×

Amazon ECS "Deploy Express Service" Action for GitHub Actions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/amazon-ecs-deploy-express-service

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/amazon-ecs-deploy-express-service

Description

Creates or updates an Amazon ECS Express Mode service

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
service-name Yes The name of the ECS Express service. Used for both creating new services and updating existing ones.
image Yes The container image URI to deploy (e.g., 123456789012.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/my-app:latest)
execution-role-arn Yes The ARN of the task execution role that grants the ECS agent permission to pull container images and publish logs
infrastructure-role-arn Yes The ARN of the infrastructure role that grants ECS permission to create and manage AWS resources (ALB, target groups, etc.)
cluster No The name of the ECS cluster. Will default to the 'default' cluster.
container-port No The port number on the container that receives traffic (containerPort in primaryContainer). If not specified, Express Mode will use port 80.
environment-variables No Environment variables to set in the container (environment in primaryContainer). Provide as JSON array: [{"name":"KEY","value":"VALUE"}]
secrets No Secrets to inject into the container (secrets in primaryContainer). Provide as JSON array: [{"name":"KEY","valueFrom":"arn:aws:secretsmanager:..."}]
command No Override the default container command (command in primaryContainer). Provide as JSON array: ["node","server.js"]
log-group No CloudWatch Logs log group name for container logs (logGroup in awsLogsConfiguration). If not specified, Express Mode creates a log group automatically.
log-stream-prefix No CloudWatch Logs stream prefix for container logs (logStreamPrefix in awsLogsConfiguration). If not specified, Express Mode uses a default prefix.
repository-credentials No ARN of the secret containing credentials for private container registry (credentialsParameter in repositoryCredentials). Required for private registries outside ECR.
cpu No The number of CPU units to allocate (256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16384). If not specified, Express Mode defaults to 256 (.25 vCPU).
memory No The amount of memory in MiB to allocate (512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16384, 30720, 61440, 122880). If not specified, Express Mode defaults to 512 MiB.
task-role-arn No The ARN of the IAM role that the container can assume to make AWS API calls (taskRoleArn)
subnets No Comma-separated list of subnet IDs for the service (subnets in networkConfiguration). If not specified, Express Mode uses the default VPC.
security-groups No Comma-separated list of security group IDs for the service (securityGroups in networkConfiguration).
health-check-path No The path for ALB health checks (healthCheckPath). If not specified, Express Mode defaults to /ping.
min-task-count No Minimum number of tasks for auto-scaling (minTaskCount in scalingTarget). Must be less than or equal to max-task-count.
max-task-count No Maximum number of tasks for auto-scaling (maxTaskCount in scalingTarget). Must be greater than or equal to min-task-count.
auto-scaling-metric No The metric to use for auto-scaling (autoScalingMetric in scalingTarget): AVERAGE_CPU, AVERAGE_MEMORY, or REQUEST_COUNT_PER_TARGET
auto-scaling-target-value No The target value for the auto-scaling metric (autoScalingTargetValue in scalingTarget). For example, 60 for 60% CPU utilization.

Outputs

NameDescription
service-arn The ARN of the deployed Express service
endpoint The endpoint URL of the service (from the Application Load Balancer)
×

Amazon ECS "Deploy Task Definition" Action for GitHub Actions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/amazon-ecs-deploy-task-definition

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/amazon-ecs-deploy-task-definition

Description

Registers an Amazon ECS task definition, and deploys it to an ECS service

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
task-definition Yes The path to the ECS task definition file to register.
desired-count No The number of instantiations of the task to place and keep running in your service.
service No The name of the ECS service to deploy to. If no service is given, the action will not deploy the task, but only register the task definition.
cluster No The name of the ECS service's cluster. Will default to the 'default' cluster.
wait-for-service-stability No Whether to wait for the ECS service to reach stable state after deploying the new task definition. Valid value is "true". Will default to not waiting.
wait-for-minutes No How long to wait for the ECS service to reach stable state, in minutes (default: 30 minutes, max: 6 hours). For CodeDeploy deployments, any wait time configured in the CodeDeploy deployment group will be added to this value.
codedeploy-appspec No The path to the AWS CodeDeploy AppSpec file, if the ECS service uses the CODE_DEPLOY deployment controller. Will default to 'appspec.yaml'.
codedeploy-application No The name of the AWS CodeDeploy application, if the ECS service uses the CODE_DEPLOY deployment controller. Will default to 'AppECS-{cluster}-{service}'.
codedeploy-deployment-group No The name of the AWS CodeDeploy deployment group, if the ECS service uses the CODE_DEPLOY deployment controller. Will default to 'DgpECS-{cluster}-{service}'.
codedeploy-deployment-description No A description of the deployment, if the ECS service uses the CODE_DEPLOY deployment controller. NOTE: This will be truncated to 512 characters if necessary.
codedeploy-deployment-config No The name of the AWS CodeDeploy deployment configuration, if the ECS service uses the CODE_DEPLOY deployment controller. If not specified, the value configured in the deployment group or `CodeDeployDefault.OneAtATime` is used as the default.
force-new-deployment No Whether to force a new deployment of the service. Valid value is "true". Will default to not force a new deployment.
service-managed-ebs-volume-name No The name of the volume, to be manage in the ECS service. This value must match the volume name from the Volume object in the task definition, that was configuredAtLaunch.
service-managed-ebs-volume No A JSON object defining the configuration settings for the EBS Service volume that was ConfiguredAtLaunch. You can configure size, volumeType, IOPS, throughput, snapshot and encryption in ServiceManagedEBSVolumeConfiguration. Currently, the only supported volume type is an Amazon EBS volume.
run-task No A boolean indicating whether to run a stand-alone task in a ECS cluster. Task will run before the service is updated if both are provided. Default value is false .
run-task-container-overrides No A JSON array of container override objects which should applied when running a task outside of a service. Warning: Do not expose this field to untrusted inputs. More details: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/APIReference/API_ContainerOverride.html
run-task-security-groups No A comma-separated list of security group IDs to assign to a task when run outside of a service. Will default to none.
run-task-subnets No A comma-separated list of subnet IDs to assign to a task when run outside of a service. Will default to none.
run-task-assign-public-IP No Whether the task's elastic network interface receives a public IP address. The default value is DISABLED but will only be applied if run-task-subnets or run-task-security-groups are also set.
run-task-capacity-provider-strategy No A JSON array of capacity provider strategy items which should applied when running a task outside of a service. Will default to none.
run-task-launch-type No ECS launch type for tasks run outside of a service. Valid values are 'FARGATE' or 'EC2'. Will default to 'FARGATE'. Will only be applied if run-task-capacity-provider-strategy is not set.
run-task-started-by No A name to use for the startedBy tag when running a task outside of a service. Will default to 'GitHub-Actions'.
run-task-tags No A JSON array of tags.
run-task-managed-ebs-volume-name No The name of the volume. This value must match the volume name from the Volume object in the task definition, that was configuredAtLaunch.
run-task-managed-ebs-volume No A JSON object defining the configuration settings for the Amazon EBS task volume that was configuredAtLaunch. These settings are used to create each Amazon EBS volume, with one volume created for each task in the service. The Amazon EBS volumes are visible in your account in the Amazon EC2 console once they are created.
wait-for-task-stopped No Whether to wait for the task to stop when running it outside of a service. Will default to not wait.
enable-ecs-managed-tags No Determines whether to turn on Amazon ECS managed tags 'aws:ecs:serviceName' and 'aws:ecs:clusterName' for the tasks in the service.
propagate-tags No Determines to propagate the tags from the 'SERVICE' to the task.
keep-null-value-keys No A comma-separated list of keys whose empty values (empty string, array, or object) should be preserved in the task definition. By default, empty values are removed.

Outputs

NameDescription
task-definition-arn The ARN of the registered ECS task definition.
codedeploy-deployment-id The deployment ID of the CodeDeploy deployment (if the ECS service uses the CODE_DEPLOY deployment controller).
run-task-arn The ARN(s) of the task(s) that were started by the run-task option. Output is in an array JSON format.
×

Amazon ECS "Render Task Definition" Action for GitHub Actions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/amazon-ecs-render-task-definition

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/amazon-ecs-render-task-definition

Description

Inserts a container image URI into a container definition in an Amazon ECS task definition JSON file, creating a new file.

Categories

InfrastructureDeployment

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
task-definition No The path to the ECS task definition JSON file
task-definition-arn No The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task definition to be used
task-definition-family No The name of a family that the task definition is registered to
task-definition-revision No The revision of the task definition being used
container-name Yes The name of the container or containers defined in the containerDefinitions section of the ECS task definition. If more than one container, add the names comma separated.
image Yes The URI of the container image to insert into the ECS task definition
environment-variables No Variables to add to the container. Each variable is of the form KEY=value, you can specify multiple variables with multi-line YAML strings.
log-configuration-log-driver No Create/Override logDriver inside logConfiguration
log-configuration-options No Create/Override options inside logConfiguration. Each variable is of the form key=value, you can specify multiple variables with multi-line YAML strings.
docker-labels No Create/Override options inside dockerLabels. Each variable is key=value, you can specify multiple variables with multi-line YAML.
command No The command used by ECS to start the container image
env-files No S3 object arns to set env variables onto the container. You can specify multiple files with multi-line YAML strings.
secrets No Secrets to add to the container. Each secret is of the form KEY=valueFrom, where valueFrom is a secret arn. You can specify multiple secrets with multi-line YAML strings.

Outputs

NameDescription
task-definition The path to the rendered task definition file
×

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/application-observability-for-aws

Description

Support Agentic AI‚Äìdriven performance investigation and resolution using live production telemetry.

Categories

MonitoringTestingCommunication

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
bot_name No The bot name to respond to in comments (e.g., @awsapm)
target_branch No The branch to merge PRs into (defaults to repository default branch)
branch_prefix No Prefix for branches created by the action (e.g., 'awsapm/', 'awsapm-')
allowed_non_write_users No Comma-separated list of GitHub usernames allowed to use this action even without write access. Empty string (default) means only users with write/admin access can use it.
github_token No GitHub token to use for API calls. If not provided, uses the default GitHub Actions token.
custom_prompt No Custom instructions to guide the AI agent's analysis and actions
cli_tool No CLI tool to use for investigation
output_file No Path to AI agent execution output file (used to post results back to GitHub). For claude_code path, pass this from claude-code-base-action outputs in a second call to this action.
output_status No Execution status from AI agent (success or failure). Only used when output_file is provided.
comment_id No GitHub comment ID to update with results (required for Step 3 - pass from Step 1 output: steps.prepare.outputs.awsapm_comment_id)
enable_cloudwatch_mcp No Enable CloudWatch MCP server for metrics, alarms, and log insights
test_mode No Enable integration test mode (internal use only)

mcp_config_file Path to the MCP servers configuration JSON file
allowed_tools Comma-separated list of allowed tools
awsapm_comment_id GitHub comment ID for tracking the investigation
branch_name The branch created by Application observability for AWS Action for this execution
github_token The GitHub token used by the action

AWS CloudFormation "Deploy CloudFormation Stack" Action for GitHub Actions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/aws-cloudformation-github-deploy

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/aws-cloudformation-github-deploy

Description

Deploys a AWS CloudFormation stack

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
name Yes The name of the CloudFormation stack
template Yes The path or URL to the CloudFormation template
capabilities No The comma-delimited list of stack template capabilities to acknowledge. Defaults to 'CAPABILITY_IAM'
parameter-overrides No The parameters to override in the stack inputs. You can pass a comma-delimited list or a file URL. Comma-delimited list has each entry formatted as <ParameterName>=<ParameterValue> or <ParameterName>="<ParameterValue>,<ParameterValue>". A JSON file can be a local file with a "file://" prefix or remote URL. The file should look like: [ { "ParameterKey": "KeyPairName", "ParameterValue": "MyKey" }]
no-execute-changeset No Indicates whether to execute to the change set or have it reviewed. Default to '0' (will execute the change set)
no-delete-failed-changeset No Indicates whether to delete to a failed change set. Default to '0' (will delete the failed changeset)
no-fail-on-empty-changeset No If the CloudFormation change set is empty, do not fail. Defaults to '0' (will fail on empty change set)
disable-rollback No Disable rollback of the stack if stack creation fails. Defaults to '0' (will rollback if stack creation fails). This input is only used for stack creation, not for stack update
timeout-in-minutes No The amount of time that can pass before the stack status becomes CREATE_FAILED. This input is only used for stack creation, not for stack update
notification-arns No The comma-delimited list of Amazon SNS topic ARNs to publish stack related events
role-arn No The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that AWS CloudFormation assumes to create the stack. AWS CloudFormation uses the role's credentials to make calls on your behalf. AWS CloudFormation always uses this role for all future operations on the stack. As long as users have permission to operate on the stack, AWS CloudFormation uses this role even if the users don't have permission to pass it. Ensure that the role grants least privilege. If you don't specify a value, AWS CloudFormation uses the role that was previously associated with the stack
tags No Key-value pairs to associate with this stack. This input should be JSON-formatted, for example [ { "Key": "string", "Value": "string" } ]
termination-protection No Whether to enable termination protection on the specified stack. Defaults to '0' (terminated protection will be disabled) This input is only used for stack creation, not for stack update
http-proxy No Proxy to use for the AWS SDK agent
change-set-name No The name of the change set to create. Defaults to '<stack-name>-CS'

Outputs

NameDescription
stack-id The id of the deployed stack. In addition, any outputs declared in the deployed CloudFormation stack will also be set as outputs for the action, e.g. if the stack has a stack output named 'foo', this action will also have an output named 'foo'.
×

"AWS CodeBuild run build" Action For GitHub Actions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/aws-codebuild-run-build

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/aws-codebuild-run-build

Description

Execute CodeBuild::startBuild for the current repo.

Categories

BuildDeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
project-name Yes AWS CodeBuild Project Name
buildspec-override No Buildspec Override
compute-type-override No The name of a compute type for this build that overrides the one specified in the build project.
environment-type-override No A container type for this build that overrides the one specified in the build project.
image-override No The name of an image for this build that overrides the one specified in the build project.
image-pull-credentials-type-override No The type of credentials CodeBuild uses to pull images in your build.
env-vars-for-codebuild No Comma separated list of environment variables to send to CodeBuild
update-interval No How often the action calls the API for updates
update-back-off No Base back-off time for the update calls for API if rate-limiting is encountered
disable-source-override No Set to `true` if you want do disable source repo override
source-version-override No The source version that overrides the sourceVersion provided to Codebuild.
source-type-override No The source input type that overrides the source input defined in the build project for this build. Valid values include NO_SOURCE, CODECOMMIT, CODEPIPELINE, GITHUB, S3, BITBUCKET, and GITHUB_ENTERPRISE.
source-location-override No The location that overrides the source location defined in the build project for this build.
hide-cloudwatch-logs No Set to `true` to prevent the CloudWatch logs from streaming the output to GitHub
disable-github-env-vars No Set to `true` if you want do disable github environment variables in codebuild
artifacts-type-override No The type of build output artifact
stop-on-signals No Comma separated list of process signals on which to stop the build. Default is SIGINT.

Outputs

NameDescription
aws-build-id The AWS CodeBuild Build ID for this build.
×

AWS Device Farm Browser Testing GitHub Action

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/aws-devicefarm-browser-testing

Author: AWS Device Farm

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/aws-devicefarm-browser-testing

Description

GitHub action for automated browser testing on AWS Device Farm

Categories

TestingInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
mode Yes The mode to run the action in. Ther are 2 values supported: Specify `project` mode when you require creation or looking up of an AWS Device Farm Project ARN. Specify `gridurl` mode when you require a Test Grid URL. Specify `artifact` mode when you require retrieval of artifacts from an existing AWS Device Farm Project ARN.
project-arn Yes The ARN of the AWS Device Farm Browser Testing Project. Alternatively supply a name and a project will be created on your behalf
url-expires-seconds No Lifetime, in seconds, of the Test Grid URL.
artifact-types No (Optional) A comma delimited list of Device Farm Artifacts that should be downloaded after the jobs completes. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSJavaScriptSDK/v3/latest/Package/-aws-sdk-client-device-farm/Variable/TestGridSessionArtifactCategory/ Note: To download all artifact types set the value to ALL. To download none skip this input. They will be downloaded to a folder. The name of the folder can be found by referencing the output with name artifact-folder. Please use the GitHub Action [upload-artifact](https://github.com/actions/upload-artifact) to store them.
artifact-folder No (optional) The name of the folder that the test artifacts are downloaded into.

Outputs

NameDescription
console-url The AWS Console URL for the Test Grid Project
project-arn The ARN of the AWS Device Farm Browser Testing Project
grid-url The AWS Device Farm Test Grid URL (only available in gridurl mode)
grid-url-expires The Datetime that the supplied grid-url will expire formatted as YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.fffZ
×

AWS Device Farm Mobile Device Testing GitHub Action

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/aws-devicefarm-mobile-device-testing

Author: AWS Device Farm

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/aws-devicefarm-mobile-device-testing

Description

GitHub action for automated mobile device testing on AWS Device Farm

Categories

TestingDeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
run-settings-json Yes The Run Settings as a json string. The schema for the contents of this file can be found here: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSJavaScriptSDK/v3/latest/Package/-aws-sdk-client-device-farm/Interface/ScheduleRunCommandInput/ The following fields support supplying an ARN or a Name. - projectArn - devicePoolArn - networkProfileArn - vpceConfigurationArns The following fields support supplying an ARN or a path to the file to be found within the repository: - appArn - testPackageArn - testSpecArn - extraDataPackageArn NOTE: If the file specified is not found in the repo the existing Project Uploads in Device Farm will be searched for one with matching type and name.
artifact-types No (Optional) A comma delimited list of Device Farm Artifacts that should be downloaded after the jobs completes. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSJavaScriptSDK/v3/latest/Package/-aws-sdk-client-device-farm/Interface/ListArtifactsCommandOutput/ Note: To download all artifact types set the value to ALL. To download none skip this input. They will be downloaded to a folder. The name of the folder can be found by referencing the output with name artifact-folder. Please use the GitHub Action [upload-artifact](https://github.com/actions/upload-artifact) to store them.
upload-poll-interval No (Optional) The duration (in milliseconds) between successive polls for the status of the file upload.
run-poll-interval No (Optional) The duration (in milliseconds) between successive polls for the status of the test run.

Outputs

NameDescription
arn The ARN of the AWS Device Farm Automated Test Run
status The status of the Automated Test Run
result The result of the Automated Test Run
artifact-folder The name of the folder that the test artifacts are downloaded into
console-url The AWS Console URL for the test run
×

AWS Lambda Deploy Action

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/aws-lambda-deploy

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/aws-lambda-deploy

Description

Updates the code and configuration of AWS Lambda functions. If the function does not exist, a new one will be created.

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
function-name Yes Name of the Lambda function.
package-type No The package type of the Lambda function. Set to "Image" for container image functions, defaults to "Zip" for .zip file functions.
image-uri No The URI of the container image in Amazon ECR. Required when package-type is "Image".
code-artifacts-dir No The path to a directory of code artifacts to zip and deploy to Lambda. Required when package-type is "Zip".
handler No The name of the method within your code that Lambda calls to run your function. Required when package-type is "Zip".
runtime No The identifier of the runtime. Required when package-type is "Zip".
s3-bucket No S3 bucket name to use for Lambda deployment package. If provided, S3 deployment method will be used instead of direct upload.
s3-key No S3 key for the Lambda deployment package in the bucket. If not provided, a key will be auto-generated using the format: lambda-deployments/{function-name}/{timestamp}-{commit-hash}.zip.
publish No Set to true to publish a new version of the function after updating the code.
dry-run No Set true to validate the request parameters and access permissions without modifying the function code. Applicable for updating function code only. Creating and updating function configuration will be skipped since they do not support dry run.
revision-id No Update the function only if the revision ID matches the ID that is specified.
architectures No The instruction set architecture that the function supports.
source-kms-key-arn No The ARN of the Key Management Service (KMS) customer managed key that is used to encrypt your functions .zip deployment package.
role No The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the functions execution role. Required when creating a new function.
function-description No A description of the function.
memory-size No The amount of memory available to the function at runtime.
timeout No The amount of time (in seconds) that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it.
vpc-config No For network connectivity to Amazon Web Services resources in a VPC, specify a list of security groups and subnets in the VPC.
environment No Environment variables as a JSON string
dead-letter-config No Specifies the queue or topic where Lambda sends asynchronous events when they fail processing.
kms-key-arn No The ARN of the Key Management Service (KMS) customer managed key
tracing-config No Set Mode to Active to sample and trace a subset of incoming requests with X-Ray.
layers No A list of function layers to add to the functions execution environment.
file-system-configs No Connection settings for an Amazon EFS file system.
image-config No Configuration for the Lambda functions container image.
ephemeral-storage No The size of the functions /tmp directory in MB. The default value is 512, but can be any whole number between 512 and 10,240 MB.
snap-start No The functions SnapStart setting.
logging-config No The Amazon CloudWatch Logs configuration settings for the function.
code-signing-config-arn No The ARN of a code-signing configuration to use on this function.
tags No Tags to apply to the function as a JSON string (e.g. {"Environment":"Production","Team":"DevOps"})

Outputs

NameDescription
function-arn The ARN of the updated Lambda function.
version The function version if a new version was published.
×

AWS Secrets Manager GitHub Action

GitHub action for retrieving secrets from AWS Secrets Manager

Categories

AuthenticationDependency management

NameRequiredDescription
secret-ids Yes One or more secret names, secret ARNs, or secret prefixes to retrieve
parse-json-secrets No (Optional) If true, JSON secrets will be deserialized, creating a secret environment variable for each key-value pair.
name-transformation No (Optional) Transforms environment variable name. Options: uppercase, lowercase, none. Default value: uppercase.
auto-select-family-attempt-timeout No (Optional) Timeout (ms) for dual-stack DNS first IP connection attempt. Needed for geographically distant GitHub action workers

×

Policy checks to validate AWS IAM policies in CloudFormation templates" Action For GitHub Actions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/cloudformation-aws-iam-policy-validator

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/cloudformation-aws-iam-policy-validator

Description

Validate IAM Policies in CFN templates using ValidatePolicy, CheckAccessNotGranted & CheckNoNewAccess API in Access Analyzer

Categories

SecurityCode qualityInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
policy-check-type Yes Type of the policy check. Valid values: VALIDATE_POLICY, CHECK_NO_NEW_ACCESS, CHECK_ACCESS_NOT_GRANTED
template-path Yes The path to the CloudFormation template.
region Yes The destination region the resources will be deployed to.
parameters No Keys and values for CloudFormation template parameters. Only parameters that are referenced by IAM policies in the template are required. Example format - KEY=VALUE [KEY=VALUE ...]
template-configuration-file No A JSON formatted file that specifies template parameter values, a stack policy, and tags. Only parameters are used from this file. Everything else is ignored. Identical values passed in the --parameters flag override parameters in this file. See CloudFormation documentation for file format: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/continuous-delivery-codepipeline-cfn-artifacts.html
ignore-finding No Allow validation failures to be ignored. Specify as a comma separated list of findings to be ignored. Can be individual finding codes (e.g. "PASS_ROLE_WITH_STAR_IN_RESOURCE"), a specific resource name (e.g. "MyResource"), or a combination of both separated by a period.(e.g. "MyResource.PASS_ROLE_WITH_STAR_IN_RESOURCE"). Names of finding codes may change in IAM Access Analyzer over time. Valid options: FINDING_CODE,RESOURCE_NAME,RESOURCE_NAME.FINDING_CODE
actions No List of comma-separated actions. Example format - ACTION,ACTION,ACTION. This attribute is considered when policy-check-type is "CHECK_ACCESS_NOT_GRANTED". At least one of "actions" or "resources" must be specified.
resources No List of comma-separated resource ARNs. Example format - RESOURCE,RESOURCE,RESOURCE. This attribute is considered when policy-check-type is "CHECK_ACCESS_NOT_GRANTED" At least one of "actions" or "resources" must be specified.
reference-policy No A JSON formatted file that specifies the path to the reference policy that is used for a permissions comparison. This attribute is considered and required when policy-check-type is "CHECK_NO_NEW_ACCESS"
reference-policy-type No The policy type associated with the IAM policy under analysis and the reference policy. Valid values: IDENTITY, RESOURCE. This attribute is considered and required when policy-check-type is "CHECK_NO_NEW_ACCESS"
treat-finding-type-as-blocking No Specify which finding types should be treated as blocking. Other finding types are treated as non blocking. If the tool detects any blocking finding types, it will exit with a non-zero exit code. If all findings are non blocking or there are no findings, the tool exits with an exit code of 0. Defaults to "ERROR" and "SECURITY_WARNING". Specify as a comma separated list of finding types that should be blocking. Pass "NONE" to ignore all findings. This attribute is considered only when policy-check-type is "VALIDATE_POLICY"
treat-findings-as-non-blocking No When not specified, the tool detects any findings, it will exit with a non-zero exit code. When specified, the tool exits with an exit code of 0. This attribute is considered only when policy-check-type is "CHECK_NO_NEW_ACCESS" or "CHECK_ACCESS_NOT_GRANTED"
allow-external-principals No A comma separated list of external principals that should be ignored. Specify as a comma separated list of a 12 digit AWS account ID, a federated web identity user, a federated SAML user, or an ARN. Specify \"*\" to allow anonymous access. (e.g. 123456789123,arn:aws:iam::111111111111:role/MyOtherRole,graph.facebook.com). Valid options: ACCOUNT,ARN". This attribute is considered only when policy-check-type is "VALIDATE_POLICY"
allow-dynamic-ref-without-version No Override the default behavior and allow dynamic SSM references without version numbers. The version number ensures that the SSM parameter value that was validated is the one that is deployed.
exclude-resource-types No List of comma-separated resource types. Resource types should be the same as Cloudformation template resource names such as AWS::IAM::Role, AWS::S3::Bucket. Valid option syntax: AWS::SERVICE::RESOURCE

Outputs

NameDescription
result Result of the policy checks
×

CodeGuru Reviewer

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/codeguru-reviewer

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/codeguru-reviewer

Description

AWS CodeGuru Reviewer Action

Categories

Code qualityTesting

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
name No Repository name
source_path No Path to Java source repository
build_path No Path to build artifact(s) - jar or class files in this directory will be uploaded for review
destination_commit No SHA of next commit to be committed to source code repository after an event
source_commit No SHA of previous commit in the source code repository existed before an event
merge_base_commit No SHA of a commit thats the merge base for before and after commits in a pull or merge request
source_branch No Source branch of the event
destination_branch No Destination branch of the event
kms_key_id No AWS KMS Key ID to use for encrypting source code/build artifacts. By default, Amazon-owned encryption key is used. Supplying this value overrides it to use Customer-owned encryption key
author No Author/Actor who triggered an event in the source code repository
event_id No An identifier for the event that triggered CodeGuru Reviewer Analysis, e.g. Pull or Merge request id
event_name No Name of the event that triggered the CI/CD workflow [supported Events: push, pull, merge_request_event, schedule, workflow_dispatch]
event_state No State of the event that triggered the CI/CD workflow [example: pull_request: "opened"]
client_id No Unique identifier referring to a specific client version
s3_bucket Yes S3 Bucket which will be used for code reviews
vendor_name No Vendor Name(e.g. GITHUB, GITLAB) for CI/CD.
output_format No Expected format for the results (e.g SARIF, SAST, JENKINS)
×

CodeGuru Security

‚úì Official Publisher

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/codeguru-security

Description

AWS CodeGuru Security Action

Categories

SecurityCode quality

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
source_path No Path to source repository
aws_region Yes AWS region where you want to run workflow
scan_name Yes The name of the scan
analysis_type No The type of analysis you want CodeGuru Security to perform in the scan, either Security or All. Defaults to Security type if missing.
fail_on_severity No Fails the action run if any finding is higher than or equal to severity is provided. Default the script does not break the action run. [example: Info, Low, Medium, High, Critical]

"Configure AWS Credentials" Action for GitHub Actions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials

Description

Configures AWS credentials for use in subsequent steps in a GitHub Action workflow

Categories

AuthenticationInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
aws-region Yes AWS Region, e.g. us-east-2
role-to-assume No The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume. Use the provided credentials to assume an IAM role and configure the Actions environment with the assumed role credentials rather than with the provided credentials.
aws-access-key-id No AWS Access Key ID. Provide this key if you want to assume a role using access keys rather than a web identity token.
aws-secret-access-key No AWS Secret Access Key. Required if aws-access-key-id is provided.
aws-session-token No AWS Session Token.
web-identity-token-file No Use the web identity token file from the provided file system path in order to assume an IAM role using a web identity, e.g. from within an Amazon EKS worker node.
role-chaining No Use existing credentials from the environment to assume a new role, rather than providing credentials as input.
audience No The audience to use for the OIDC provider
http-proxy No Proxy to use for the AWS SDK agent
no-proxy No Hosts to skip for the proxy configuration
mask-aws-account-id No Whether to mask the AWS account ID for these credentials as a secret value. By default the account ID will not be masked
role-duration-seconds No Role duration in seconds. Default is one hour.
role-external-id No The external ID of the role to assume.
role-session-name No Role session name (default: GitHubActions)
role-skip-session-tagging No Skip session tagging during role assumption
inline-session-policy No Define an inline session policy to use when assuming a role
managed-session-policies No Define a list of managed session policies to use when assuming a role
output-credentials No Whether to set credentials as step output
output-env-credentials No Whether to export credentials as environment variables. If you set this to false, you probably want to use output-credentials.
unset-current-credentials No Whether to unset the existing credentials in your runner. May be useful if you run this action multiple times in the same job
disable-retry No Whether to disable the retry and backoff mechanism when the assume role call fails. By default the retry mechanism is enabled
retry-max-attempts No The maximum number of attempts it will attempt to retry the assume role call. By default it will retry 12 times
special-characters-workaround No Some environments do not support special characters in AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY. This option will retry fetching credentials until the secret access key does not contain special characters. This option overrides disable-retry and retry-max-attempts. This option is disabled by default
use-existing-credentials No When enabled, this option will check if there are already valid credentials in the environment. If there are, new credentials will not be fetched. If there are not, the action will run as normal.
allowed-account-ids No An option comma-delimited list of expected AWS account IDs. The action will fail if we receive credentials for the wrong account.
force-skip-oidc No When enabled, this option will skip using GitHub OIDC provider even if the id-token permission is set. This is sometimes useful when using IAM instance credentials.
action-timeout-s No A global timeout in seconds for the action. When the timeout is reached, the action immediately exits. The default is to run without a timeout.

Outputs

NameDescription
aws-account-id The AWS account ID for the provided credentials
aws-access-key-id The AWS access key ID for the provided credentials
aws-secret-access-key The AWS secret access key for the provided credentials
aws-session-token The AWS session token for the provided credentials
aws-expiration The expiration time for the provided credentials
×

python No The Python interpreter to use for AWS SAM CLI
use-installer No Set to true to install using native installers instead of pip
token No Authentication token to be used to call GITHUB Apis

'Stale Issue Cleanup' Action for GitHub Actions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/stale-issue-cleanup

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/stale-issue-cleanup

Description

Close issues and pull requests with no recent activity

Categories

CommunicationNotification

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
repo-token Yes Token for the repository. Can be passed in using {{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
issue-types No Issue types to process ("issues", "pull_requests", or "issues,pull_requests")
stale-issue-message No The message to post on the issue when tagging it. If none provided, will not mark issues stale.
stale-pr-message No The message to post on the pr when tagging it. If none provided, will not mark pull requests stale.
days-before-stale No The number of days old an issue can be before marking it stale.
days-before-close No The number of days to wait to close an issue or pull request after it being marked stale.
stale-issue-label No The label to apply when an issue is stale.
exempt-issue-labels No The labels to apply when an issue is exempt from being marked stale. Separate multiple labels with commas (eg. "label1,label2")
stale-pr-label No The label to apply when a pull request is stale.
exempt-pr-labels No The labels to apply when a pull request is exempt from being marked stale. Separate multiple labels with commas (eg. "label1,label2")
ancient-issue-message No The message to post when an issue is very old.
ancient-pr-message No The message to post when a pr is very old.
days-before-ancient No The number of days old an issue can be before marking it ancient.
response-requested-label No The label that gets applied when a response is requested.
closed-for-staleness-label No The label that gets applied when an issue is closed for staleness.
minimum-upvotes-to-exempt No The minimum number of "upvotes" that an issue needs to have before not marking as ancient.
loglevel No Set to DEBUG to enable debug logging
dry-run No Set to true to not perform repository changes
use-created-date-for-ancient No Set to true to use issue created date instead of modified date for determining an ancient issue.
×

Policy checks to validate AWS IAM policies in Terraform templates" Action For GitHub Actions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/terraform-aws-iam-policy-validator

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/terraform-aws-iam-policy-validator

Description

Validate IAM Policies in TF templates using ValidatePolicy, CheckAccessNotGranted & CheckNoNewAccess API in Access Analyzer

Categories

SecurityCode qualityTesting

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
policy-check-type Yes Type of the policy check. Valid values: VALIDATE_POLICY, CHECK_NO_NEW_ACCESS, CHECK_ACCESS_NOT_GRANTED
template-path Yes The path to the Terraform plan file (JSON).
region Yes The destination region the resources will be deployed to.
ignore-finding No Allow validation failures to be ignored. Specify as a comma separated list of findings to be ignored. Can be individual finding codes (e.g. "PASS_ROLE_WITH_STAR_IN_RESOURCE"), a specific resource name (e.g. "MyResource"), or a combination of both separated by a period.(e.g. "MyResource.PASS_ROLE_WITH_STAR_IN_RESOURCE"). Names of finding codes may change in IAM Access Analyzer over time. Valid options: FINDING_CODE,RESOURCE_NAME,RESOURCE_NAME.FINDING_CODE
actions No List of comma-separated actions. Example format - ACTION,ACTION,ACTION. This attribute is considered when policy-check-type is "CHECK_ACCESS_NOT_GRANTED". At least one of "actions" or "resources" must be specified.
resources No List of comma-separated resource ARNs. Example format - RESOURCE,RESOURCE,RESOURCE. This attribute is considered when policy-check-type is "CHECK_ACCESS_NOT_GRANTED" At least one of "actions" or "resources" must be specified.
reference-policy No A JSON formatted file that specifies the path to the reference policy that is used for a permissions comparison. This attribute is considered and required when policy-check-type is "CHECK_NO_NEW_ACCESS"
reference-policy-type No The policy type associated with the IAM policy under analysis and the reference policy. Valid values: IDENTITY, RESOURCE. This attribute is considered and required when policy-check-type is "CHECK_NO_NEW_ACCESS"
treat-finding-type-as-blocking No Specify which finding types should be treated as blocking. Other finding types are treated as non blocking. If the tool detects any blocking finding types, it will exit with a non-zero exit code. If all findings are non blocking or there are no findings, the tool exits with an exit code of 0. Defaults to "ERROR" and "SECURITY_WARNING". Specify as a comma separated list of finding types that should be blocking. Pass "NONE" to ignore all findings. This attribute is considered only when policy-check-type is "VALIDATE_POLICY"
treat-findings-as-non-blocking No When not specified, the tool detects any findings, it will exit with a non-zero exit code. When specified, the tool exits with an exit code of 0. This attribute is considered only when policy-check-type is "CHECK_NO_NEW_ACCESS" or "CHECK_ACCESS_NOT_GRANTED"
allow-external-principals No A comma separated list of external principals that should be ignored. Specify as a comma separated list of a 12 digit AWS account ID, a federated web identity user, a federated SAML user, or an ARN. Specify \"*\" to allow anonymous access. (e.g. 123456789123,arn:aws:iam::111111111111:role/MyOtherRole,graph.facebook.com). Valid options: ACCOUNT,ARN". This attribute is considered only when policy-check-type is "VALIDATE_POLICY"
allow-dynamic-ref-without-version No Override the default behavior and allow dynamic SSM references without version numbers. The version number ensures that the SSM parameter value that was validated is the one that is deployed.
exclude-resource-types No List of comma-separated resource types. Resource types should be the same as Cloudformation template resource names such as AWS::IAM::Role, AWS::S3::Bucket. Valid option syntax: AWS::SERVICE::RESOURCE

Outputs

NameDescription
result Result of the policy checks

Vulnerability Scan GitHub Action for Amazon Inspector

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/aws-actions/vulnerability-scan-github-action-for-amazon-inspector

Author: Unknown

Publisher: aws-actions

Repository: github.com/aws-actions/vulnerability-scan-github-action-for-amazon-inspector

Description

Generate SBOMs and scan for vulnerabilities in artifacts such as files, directories, containers, and more.

Categories

SecurityTestingDependency management

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
artifact_type Yes The artifact you would like to scan with Amazon Inspector. Valid choices are "repository", "container", "binary", or "archive".
artifact_path Yes The file path to the artifact you would like to scan with Amazon Inspector. File paths are relative to the root project directory. If scanning a container image, you must provide a value that follows the docker pull convention: "NAME[:TAG|@DIGEST]", for example, "alpine:latest", or a path to an image exported as tarball using "docker save".
display_vulnerability_findings Yes If set to "enabled", the action will display detailed vulnerability findings in the step summary page; see here for an example report: https://github.com/aws-actions/vulnerability-scan-github-action-for-amazon-inspector/actions/runs/8878213714
output_sbom_path No The destination file path for the generated SBOM.
output_inspector_scan_path No The destination file path for Inspector's vulnerability scan (JSON format).
output_inspector_scan_path_csv No The destination file path for Inspector's vulnerability scan (CSV format).
output_inspector_scan_path_markdown No The destination file path for Inspector's vulnerability scan (markdown format).
output_inspector_dockerfile_scan_path_csv No The destination file path for Inspector's Dockerfile vulnerability scan (CSV format).
output_inspector_dockerfile_scan_path_markdown No The destination file path for Inspector's Dockerfile vulnerability scan (markdown format).
sbomgen_version No The inspector-sbomgen version you wish to use for SBOM generation. See here for more info: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/inspector/latest/user/sbom-generator.html
critical_threshold No Specifies the number of critical vulnerabilities needed to set the 'vulnerability_threshold_exceeded' flag.
high_threshold No Specifies the number of high vulnerabilities needed to set the 'vulnerability_threshold_exceeded' flag.
medium_threshold No Specifies the number of medium vulnerabilities needed to set the 'vulnerability_threshold_exceeded' flag.
low_threshold No Specifies the number of low vulnerabilities needed to set the 'vulnerability_threshold_exceeded' flag.
other_threshold No Specifies the number of other vulnerabilities needed to set the 'vulnerability_threshold_exceeded' flag.
scanners No Specifies the file scanners that you would like inspector-sbomgen to execute. By default, inspector-sbomgen will try to run all file scanners that are applicable to the target artifact. If this argument is set, inspector-sbomgen will only execute the specified file scanners. Provide your input as a single string. Separate each file scanner with a comma. To view a list of available file scanners, execute 'inspector-sbomgen list-scanners'. See here for more info: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/inspector/latest/user/sbom-generator.html
skip_scanners No Specifies a list of file scanners that should NOT be executed; this argument cannot be combined with 'scanners'. If this argument is set, inspector-sbomgen will execute all file scanners except those you specified. Provide your input as a single string. Separate each file scanner with a comma. To view a list of available file scanners, execute 'inspector-sbomgen list-scanners'. See here for more info: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/inspector/latest/user/sbom-generator.html
skip_files No Specifies one or more files and/or directories that should NOT be inventoried. Separate each file with a comma and enclose the entire string in double quotes.
timeout No Specifies a timeout in seconds. If this timeout is exceeded, the action will gracefully conclude and present any findings discovered up to that point.
platform No Specifies the OS and CPU arch of the container image you wish to scan. Valid inputs are of the form 'os/cpu/variant' for example, 'linux/amd64', 'linux/arm64/v8', etc. If no platform is specified, the system will use the same platform as the host that is performing the scan. This argument only affects container image scans. Requires inspector-sbomgen 1.5.1 or later.
threshold_fixable_only No If set to true, only count vulnerabilities with a fix towards threshold exceeded condition.
show_only_fixable_vulns No If set to true, this action will show only fixed vulnerabilities in the GitHub Actions step summary page. All vulnerability metadata is still retained in the raw Inspector scan files.

Outputs

NameDescription
artifact_sbom The filepath to the artifact's software bill of materials.
inspector_scan_results The file path to the Inspector vulnerability scan findings in JSON format.
inspector_scan_results_csv The file path to the Inspector vulnerability scan findings in CSV format.
inspector_scan_results_markdown The file path to the Inspector vulnerability scan findings in markdown format.
inspector_dockerile_scan_results_csv The file path to the Inspector Dockerfile vulnerability scan findings in CSV format.
inspector_dockerile_scan_results_markdown The file path to the Inspector Dockerfile vulnerability scan findings in markdown format.
vulnerability_threshold_exceeded This variable is set to 1 if any vulnerability threshold was exceeded, otherwise it is 0. This variable can be used to trigger custom logic, such as failing the job if vulnerabilities were detected.
×

Description

DEPRECATED: Use Azure CLI action instead. Follow [these instructions](https://aka.ms/appconfig/githubactions) to set up.

Configuration ManagementDependency managementInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
configurationFile Yes Path to the configuration file in the repo, relative to the repo root. Also supports glob patterns and multiple files
format Yes Format of the configuration file. Valid values are: json, yaml, properties
connectionString Yes Connection string for the App Configuration instance
separator Yes Separator used when flattening the configuration file to key-value pairs
strict No Specifies whether to use a strict sync which will make the App Configuration instance exactly match the configuration file (deleting key-values not in the configuration file). Defaults to false
prefix No Prefix that will be added to the front of the keys
label No Label to use when setting the key-value pairs. If not specified, a null label will be used
depth No Max depth (positive number) for flattening the configuration file
tags No Stringified form of a JSON object with the following shape: { [propertyName: string]: string; }
contentType No Content type associated with the values

OverrideArmParameters No Specify deployment parameter values.
Environment Yes Provide the type of cloud environment. Valid values are: Azure Public, Azure China, Azure US Government, Azure Germany
resourceGroup Yes Provide the resource group of the target Synapse workspace.
clientId No Provide client id of service principal.
clientSecret No Provide client secret of the service principal.
subscriptionId Yes Provide subscription id.
tenantId No Provide tenant id.
DeleteArtifactsNotInTemplate No Delete the artifacts which are in the workspace but not in the template.
