Create Azure Container App Review Revisions

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/aca-review-apps

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/aca-review-apps

Description

GitHub Action to create a new Container App revision for PR review. github.com/Azure/Actions

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
resource-group Yes Name of the Resource Group in which the Container App will be created
name Yes Name of the Container App
image Yes Name of Container Image. If the `mode` input is `deactivate-revision`, this input is ignored.
revision-name-suffix Yes Suffixes for New Revision or Target Revision of deactivation. If the `mode` input is `deactivate-revision`, this input needs to be set.
deactivate-revision-mode No Enable Deactivation-Revision Mode of this action. `true` or `false`. Default value is `false`

Outputs

NameDescription
app-url Deployed App URL
×

Deploy to Azure Container Instances

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/aci-deploy

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/aci-deploy

Description

Deploy to Containers to Azure Container Instances. github.com/Azure/Actions

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
resource-group Yes Name of the Resource Group in which the Container Instance will be created
azure-file-volume-account-key No The storage account access key used to access the Azure File Share
azure-file-volume-account-name No The name of the storage account that contains the Azure File Share
azure-file-volume-mount-path No The path within the container where the Azure File Volume should be mounted. Must not contain ":"
azure-file-volume-share-name No The name of the Azure File Share to be mounted as a volume
azure-file-volume-read-only No Should the Azure File Share be Mounted as Read Only. Accepted { true, false }
command-line No The command line to run when the container is started, e.g. "/bin/bash -c myscript.sh"
cpu No Number of CPU Cores Required
dns-name-label Yes The DNS Name Label for Container with Public IP
environment-variables No List of environment variables for the container. Space-seperated in "key=value" format
gitrepo-dir No The target directory path in the git repository. Must not contain ".."
gitrepo-mount-path No The path within the container where the git repo volume should be mounted. Must not contain ":"
gitrepo-revision No The commit hash for the specified revision
gitrepo-url No The URL of a git repository to be mounted as a volume
gpu-count No The Number of GPU Resources needed in the Container
gpu-sku No The SKU for the GPUs specified. Accepted Values are { K80, P100, V100 }
image Yes Specify the fully qualified container image name. For example, "myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest" or "python:3.7.2-alpine/"
ip-address No IP Address type of the Container Group. Accepted Values are { Private, Public }.Currently it only supports { Public }
location Yes Location where the Container will be deployed
log-analytics-workspace No The Log Analytics Workspace Name or Id
log-analytics-workspace-key No The Log Analytics Workspace Key
log-type No The Log type to be used. Accepted Values are { ContainerInsights, ContainerInstanceLogs }
memory No Required Memory of the Containers in GB, accurate to one decimal place
name Yes Name of the Container Group Instance
os-type No The OS type of the Containers. Accepted Values are { Linux, Windows }
ports No The Ports to Open on the Container. Space seperate the ports for multiple values
protocol No The Network protocol to use. Accepted Values are { TCP, UDP }
registry-login-server No The container image registry login server
registry-username No Username to log in Container Image Registry Server
registry-password No Password to log in Container Image Registry Server
restart-policy No Restart Policy for the container(s). Accepted Values are { Always, OnFailure, Never }
secure-environment-variables No List of secure environment variables for the container. Space seperated values in "key=value" format

Outputs

NameDescription
app-url URL of the Deployed Application
×

resourceGroupName No Provide the name of a resource group, only required for resource Group deployments.
template Yes Specify the path or URL to the Azure Resource Manager template.
deploymentMode No Incremental (only add resources to resource group) or Complete (remove extra resources from resource group) or Validate (only validates the template).
deploymentName No Specifies the name of the resource group deployment to create.
parameters No Supply deployment parameter values.
failOnStdErr No Specify whether to fail the action if some data is written to stderr stream of az cli. Valid values are: true, false
additionalArguments No Specify any additional arguments for the deployment.
maskedOutputs No Specify list of output keys that its value need to be register to github action as secret. (checkout https://github.com/actions/toolkit/issues/184#issuecomment-1198653452 for valid multiline string)

Bicep Deploy

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/bicep-deploy

Author: Microsoft

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/bicep-deploy

Description

GitHub Action for deploying to Azure

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
type Yes Specifies the execution type, which can be either 'deployment' or 'deploymentStack'.
operation Yes Specifies the operation to perform. For deployment, choose from 'create', 'validate', 'whatIf'. For deploymentStack, choose from 'create', 'delete', 'validate'.
scope Yes Specifies the scope of the deployment or deploymentStack. For deployment, choose from 'resourceGroup', 'subscription', 'managementGroup', 'tenant'. For deploymentStack, choose from 'resourceGroup', 'subscription', 'managementGroup'.
name No Specifies the name of the deployment or deploymentStack.
location No Specifies the location of the deployment or deploymentStack. Must be provided if the 'scope' parameter is 'subscription', 'managementGroup' or 'tenant'.
tenant-id No Specifies the tenant ID. Required if the 'scope' parameter is 'tenant'.
management-group-id No Specifies the management group ID. Required if the 'scope' parameter is 'managementGroup'.
subscription-id No Specifies the subscription ID. Required if the 'scope' parameter is 'subscription' or 'resourceGroup'.
resource-group-name No Specifies the resource group name. Required if the 'scope' parameter is 'resourceGroup'.
template-file No Specifies the path to the template file.
parameters-file No Specifies the path to the parameters file (.json or .bicepparam).
parameters No Specifies the inline parameters to use (as json object).
masked-outputs No Specifies output names to mask values for.
environment No Specifies the Azure environment to use. Choose from 'azureCloud', 'azureChinaCloud', 'azureGermanCloud', 'azureUSGovernment'.
what-if-exclude-change-types No Specifies the change types to exclude from the 'What If' operation.
validation-level No Specifies the validation level. Only supported for deployment what-if and validate operations. Choose from 'provider', 'template', or 'providerNoRbac'.
action-on-unmanage-resources No Specifies the action to take on unmanaged resources. Choose from 'delete' or 'detach'.
action-on-unmanage-resourcegroups No Specifies the action to take on unmanaged resource groups. Choose from 'delete' or 'detach'.
action-on-unmanage-managementgroup No Specifies the action to take on unmanaged management groups. Choose from 'delete' or 'detach'.
deny-settings-mode No Specifies the mode of the deny settings. Choose from 'denyDelete', 'denyWriteAndDelete', 'none'.
deny-settings-excluded-actions No Specifies the excluded actions for the deny settings.
deny-settings-excluded-principals No Specifies the excluded principals for the deny settings.
deny-settings-apply-to-child-scopes No When specified, the deny setting mode configuration also applies to the child scope of the managed resources.
bypass-stack-out-of-sync-error No Specifies whether to bypass the stack out of sync error. Choose from 'true' or 'false'.
description No Specifies the description of the deploymentStack.
tags No Specifies the tags for the deploymentStack.
bicep-version No Specifies the version of Bicep to use for compilation. If not provided, the latest version will be used. Example string: '0.38.5'
×

Build Azure Virtual Machine Image

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/build-vm-image

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/build-vm-image

Description

Create custom virtual machine images that contain artifacts built in CI workflows

Categories

InfrastructureBuildDeployment

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
location No This is the Azure region in which the Image Builder will run.
resource-group-name Yes This is the Resource Group where the temporary Imagebuilder Template resource will be created.
image-builder-template-name No The name of the image builder template resource to be used for creating and running the Image builder service.
build-timeout-in-minutes No The value is an integer which is used as timeout in minutes for running the image build.
vm-size No You can override the VM size, from the default value i.e. Standard_D1_v2.
managed-identity No The identity that will be used to do the role assignment and resource creation
source-image-type No [ PlatformImage | SharedImageGallery | ManagedImage ]
source-os-type Yes OS types supported: [ linux | windows ].
source-image No Value of source-image supported by Azure Image Builder.
customizer-source No This takes the path to a directory or a file in the runner. By default, it points to the default download directory of the github runner.
customizer-script No The customer can enter multi inline powershell or shell commands and use variables to point to directories inside the downloaded location.
customizer-windows-update No The value is boolean and set to false by default. This value is for Windows images only, the image builder will run Windows Update at the end of the customizations and also handle the reboots it requires.
dist-type No ManagedImage | SharedImageGallery | VHD
dist-resource-id No Image Resource Id to be created by AIB
dist-location No location of Image created by AIB
run-output-name No Every Image builder run is identified with a unique run id.
dist-image-tags No The values set will be used to set the user defined tags on the custom image artifact created.

Outputs

NameDescription
imagebuilder-run-status This value of this output will be the value of Image builder Run status set to either Succeeded or Failed based on the runState returned by Azure Image Builder.
run-output-name The action emits output value run-output-name which can be used to get the details of the Image Builder Run.
custom-image-uri Upon successful completion, The github action emits the URI or resource id of the Image distributed.
×

Azure Container Apps Build and Deploy

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/container-apps-deploy-action

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/container-apps-deploy-action

Description

'GitHub Action for building and deploying Azure Container Apps'

Categories

DeploymentBuildInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
appSourcePath No Absolute path on the GitHub runner of the source application code to be built.
acrName No The name of the Azure Container Registry that the runnable application image will be pushed to.
acrUsername No 'The username used to authenticate push requests to the provided Azure Container Registry. If not provided, an access token will be generated via "az acr login" and provided to "docker login" to authenticate the requests.'
acrPassword No 'The password used to authenticate push requests to the provided Azure Container Registry. If not provided, an access token will be generated via "az acr login" and provided to "docker login" to authenticate the requests.'
registryUrl No The base URL of the Container Registry that the runnable application image will be pushed to.
registryUsername No The username used to authenticate push requests to the provided Container Registry using the "docker login" action.
registryPassword No The password used to authenticate push requests to the provided Container Registry using the "docker login" action.
azureCredentials No 'Azure credentials used by the `azure/login` action to authenticate Azure CLI requests if the user has not previously authenticated in the workflow calling this action.'
imageToBuild No 'The custom name of the image that is to be built, pushed to the Container Registry and deployed to the Container App by this action. Note: this image name should include the registry server; e.g., <registryUrl>/<repo>:<tag>. If this argument is not provided, a default image name will be constructed in the form of <acr-name>.azurecr.io/github-action/container-app:<github-run-id>.<github-run-attempt>.'
imageToDeploy No 'The custom name of an image that has already been pushed to the Container Registry and will be deployed to the Container App by this action. Note: this image name should include the registry server; e.g., <registryUrl>/<repo>:<tag>. If this argument is not provided, the value provided (or determined) for the "imageToBuild" argument will be used.'
dockerfilePath No 'Relative path to the Dockerfile in the provided application source that should be used to build the image that is then pushed to the Container Registry and deployed to the Container App. If not provided, this action will check if there is a file named "Dockerfile" in the provided application source and use that to build the image. Otherwise, the Oryx++ Builder will be used to create the image.'
containerAppName No 'The name of the Azure Container App that will be created or updated. If not provided, this value will be gh-action-app-<github-run-id>-<github-run-attempt>.'
resourceGroup No 'The existing resource group that the Azure Container App will be created in. If not provided, this value will be <container-app-name>-rg and its existence will first be checked before attempting to create it.'
containerAppEnvironment No 'The name of the Azure Container App environment to use with the application. If not provided, an existing environment in the resource group of the Container App will be used, otherwise, an environment will be created in the format <container-app-name>-env'
runtimeStack No 'The platform version stack that the application runs in when deployed to the Azure Container App. This should be provided in the format <platform>:<version>. If not provided, this value is determined by Oryx based on the contents of the provided application. Please view the following document for more information on the supported runtime stacks for Oryx: https://github.com/microsoft/Oryx/blob/main/doc/supportedRuntimeVersions.md'
builderStack No 'The stack (OS) that should be used to build the provided application source and produce the runnable application image. You can provide a specific image tag for the stack, such as "debian-bullseye-20231107.2", or you can provide a supported stack name, such as "debian-bookworm" or "debian-bullseye", and the latest supported image tag for that stack will be used. If no stack is provided, this action will attempt to build the provided application source with each supported stack until there's a successful build.'
buildArguments No 'A list of build arguments provided as KEY=VALUE pairings and are space-separated. If a Dockerfile has been provided or is discovered in the application source, each build argument will be passed to the "docker build" command via the --build-arg flag. If the Oryx++ builder is used to create a runnable application image, each build argument will be passed to the "pack build" command via the --env flag.'
targetPort No 'The designated port for the application to run on. If no value is provided and the builder is used to build the runnable application image, the target port will be set to 80 for Python applications and 8080 for all other platform applications. If no value is provided when creating a Container App, the target port will be set to 80 by default. Note: when using this action to update a Container App, the target port may be updated if not provided based on changes to the ingress property.
location No 'The location that the Container App (and other created resources) will be deployed to. To view locations suitable for creating the Container App in, please run the following: az provider show -n Microsoft.App --query "resourceTypes[?resourceType=='containerApps'].locations"'
environmentVariables No 'A list of environment variable(s) for the container. Space-separated values in 'key=value' format. Empty string to clear existing values. Prefix value with 'secretref:' to reference a secret.'
ingress No 'Possible options: external, internal, disabled. If set to "external" (default value if not provided when creating a Container App), the Container App will be visible from the internet or a VNET, depending on the app environment endpoint configured. If set to "internal", the Container App will be visible from within the app environment only. If set to "disabled", ingress will be disabled for this Container App and will not have an HTTP or TCP endpoint.'
yamlConfigPath No 'Full path (on the executing GitHub runner) to the YAML file detailing the configuration of the Container App. The 'resourceGroup' property in the YAML file will not be used; the value for this either comes from the 'resourceGroup' argument provided to the action, or the default resource group name generated by the action. Image and application source arguments (e.g., 'appSourcePath', 'imageToDeploy') will still be used to first build and/or push an image that is used by the Container App; in this case, the provided YAML configuration file will need to reference the image specified by 'imageToDeploy' (or 'imageToBuild', depending on your scenario). When creating a new Container App, all properties listed in the file will be set when the Container App is created. When updating an existing Container App, only the properties listed in the file will be updated on the Container App. For more information on the structure of this YAML configuration file, please visit https://aka.ms/azure-container-apps-yaml'
disableTelemetry No 'If set to "true", no telemetry will be collected by this GitHub Action. If set to "false", or if this argument is not provided, telemetry will be sent to Microsoft about the Container App build and deploy scenario targeted by this GitHub Action.'
targetLabel No 'Specifies the target label for the Azure Container App revision. This will replace any prior revision with the given label. This is required when using ActiveRevisionMode: Labels.'
×

The available levels are: (UNKNOWN, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, CRITICAL); if you set the severity-threshold to be `MEDIUM` every CVE found of a level higher than or equal to `MEDIUM` would be displayed

password No Password to authenticate to the Docker registry
token Yes Github token

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription

context No If your kubeconfig has multiple contexts, use this field to use a specific context, otherwise the default one would be chosen
k8s-url No Cluster Url
k8s-secret No Service account secret. Run kubectl get serviceaccounts <service-account-name> -o yaml and copy the service-account-secret-name. Copy the ouptut of kubectl get secret <service-account-secret-name> -o yaml

container-registry-password No Container registry password
container-registry-email No Container registry email

arguments No Specify keys and literal values to insert in generic type secret. For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".
manifests Yes Path to the manifest files which will be used for deployment.
images No Fully qualified resource URL of the image(s) to be used for substitutions on the manifest files Example: contosodemo.azurecr.io/helloworld:test
imagepullsecrets No Name of a docker-registry secret that has already been set up within the cluster. Each of these secret names are added under imagePullSecrets field for the workloads found in the input manifest files
kubectl-version No Version of kubectl. Installs a specific version of kubectl binary
strategy No Deployment strategy to be used. Allowed values are none, canary
traffic-split-method No Traffic split method to be used. Allowed values are pod, smi
baseline-and-canary-replicas No Baseline and canary replicas count; valid value i.e between 0 to 100.
percentage No Percentage of traffic redirect to canary deployment
args No Arguments
action Yes deploy/promote/reject
namespace No Choose the target Kubernetes namespace. If the namespace is not provided, the commands will run in the default namespace.

Outputs

NameDescription
secret-name Secret name

Azure Functions Action

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/functions-action

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/functions-action

Description

Deploy Function App to Azure Functions

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
app-name Yes Name of the Azure Function App
package No Path to package or folder. *.zip or a folder to deploy
slot-name No Function app slot to be deploy to
publish-profile No Publish profile (*.publishsettings) file contents with web deploy secrets
respect-pom-xml No Automatically look up Java function app artifact from pom.xml (default: 'false'). When this is set to 'true', 'package' should point to the folder of host.json.
respect-funcignore No Remove unwanted files defined in .funcignore file (default: 'false'). When this is set to 'true', 'package' should point to the folder of host.json.
scm-do-build-during-deployment No Enable build action from Kudu when the package is deployed onto the function app. This will temporarily change the SCM_DO_BUILD_DURING_DEPLOYMENT setting for this deployment. To bypass this and use the existing settings from your function app, please set this to an empty string ''. To enable remote build for your project, please set this and 'enable-oryx-build' both to 'true'. By default, GitHub Action respects the packages resolved in GitHub workflow, disabling the redundant build action from Kudu endpoint. (default: 'false').
enable-oryx-build No Use Oryx Build from Kudu when the package is deployed onto the function app. (Linux functions only). This will temporarily change the ENABLE_ORYX_BUILD setting from this deployment. To bypass this and use the existing settings from your function app, please set this to an empty string ''. To enable remote build for your project, please set this and 'scm-do-build-during-deployment' both to 'true'. By default, GitHub Action respects the packages resolved in GitHub workflow, disabling the redundant build action from Kudu endpoint. (default: 'false').
sku No For function app on Flex Consumption plan, set this to 'flexconsumption'. You can skip this parameter for function app on other plans. If using RBAC credentials, then by default, GitHub Action will resolve the value for this paramter. But if using 'publish-profile', then you must set this for function app on Flex Consumption plan.
remote-build No For function app on Flex Consumption plan, enable build action from Kudu when the package is deployed onto the function app by setting this to 'true'. For function app on Flex Consumption plan, do not set 'scm-do-build-during-deployment' and 'enable-oryx-build'. By default, GitHub Action respects the packages resolved in GitHub workflow, disabling the redundant build action from Kudu endpoint. (default: 'false').

Outputs

NameDescription
app-url URL to work with your function app
package-url URL to the package zip file if using package deployment
×

arguments No Acceptable values: helm or kustomize. Arguments to be passed to the Helm or kustomize template command
overrideFiles No Relevant if renderEngine == helm. Array of path to override files. Each path should be mentioned on a newline
overrides No Relevant if renderEngine == helm. Override values to set.
releaseName No Relevant if renderEngine == helm. Release name to be used for Helm option.

kompose-version No Version of kompose. Installs a specific version of kompose binary

container-registry-url No Container Registry URL

Deploy to Kubernetes cluster

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/k8s-deploy

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/k8s-deploy

Description

Deploy to a Kubernetes cluster including, but not limited to Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
namespace No Choose the target Kubernetes namespace. If the namespace is not provided, the commands will automatically use the namespace defined in the manifest files first or otherwise run in the default namespace.
manifests Yes Path to the manifest files which will be used for deployment.
images No Fully qualified resource URL of the image(s) to be used for substitutions on the manifest files Example: contosodemo.azurecr.io/helloworld:test
imagepullsecrets No Name of a docker-registry secret that has already been set up within the cluster. Each of these secret names are added under imagePullSecrets field for the workloads found in the input manifest files
pull-images No Switch whether to pull the images from the registry before deployment to find out Dockerfile's path in order to add it to the annotations
strategy Yes Deployment strategy to be used. Allowed values are basic, canary and blue-green
route-method No Route based on service, ingress or SMI for blue-green strategy
version-switch-buffer No Indicates the buffer time in minutes before the switch is made to the green version (max is 300 min ie. 5hrs)
traffic-split-method No Traffic split method to be used. Allowed values are pod and smi
traffic-split-annotations No Annotations in the form of key/value pair to be added to TrafficSplit. Relevant only if deployement strategy is blue-green or canary
baseline-and-canary-replicas No Baseline and canary replicas count. Valid value between 0 to 100 (inclusive)
percentage No Percentage of traffic redirect to canary deployment
action Yes deploy, promote, or reject
force No Deploy when a previous deployment already exists. If true then --force argument is added to the apply command
server-side No The apply command runs in the server instead of the client. If true then --server-side argument is added to the apply command.
timeout No Timeout for the rollout status
token Yes Github token
annotate-resources No Annotate the resources. If set to false all annotations are skipped completely.
annotate-namespace No Annotate the target namespace. Ignored when annotate-resources is set to false or no namespace is provided.
private-cluster No True if cluster is AKS private cluster
resource-group No Name of resource group - Only required if using private cluster
name No Name of the private cluster - Only required if using private cluster
skip-tls-verify No True if the insecure-skip-tls-verify option should be used. Input should be 'true' or 'false'.
resource-type No Either Microsoft.ContainerService/managedClusters or Microsoft.ContainerService/fleets'.

Manage Azure Policy

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/manage-azure-policy

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/manage-azure-policy

Description

Create or update Azure policies from your GitHub Workflows using Manage Azure Policy action.

Categories

InfrastructureDeployment

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
paths Yes mandatory. The path(s) to the directory that contains Azure policy files. The files present only in these directories will be considered by this action for updating policies in Azure. You can use wild card characters as mentioned * or ** for specifying sub folders in a path. For more details on the use of the wild cards check [glob wildcard patterns](https://github.com/isaacs/node-glob#glob-primer). Note that a definition file should be named as policy.json and assignment filenames should start with assign keyword.
ignore-paths No Optional. These are the directory paths that will be ignored by the action. If you have a specific policy folder that is not ready to be applied yet, specify the path here. Note that ignore-paths has a higher precedence compared to paths parameter.
assignments No Optional. These are policy assignment files that would be considered by the action. This parameter is especially useful if you want to apply only those assignments that correspond to a specific environment for following a safe deployment practice. E.g. _assign.AllowedVMSKUs-dev-rg.json_. You can use wild card character * to match multiple file names. E.g. _assign.\*dev\*.json_. If this parameter is not specified, the action will consider all assignment files that are present in the directories mentioned in paths parameter.
mode No Optional. There are 2 modes for this action - _incremental_ and _complete_. If not specified, the action will use incremental mode by default. In incremental mode, the action will compare already exisiting policy in azure with the contents of policy provided in repository file. It will apply the policy only if there is a mismatch. On the contrary, the complete mode will apply all the files present in the specified paths irrespective of whether or not repository policy file has been updated.
enforce No Optional. To override the property enforcementMode in assignments. Input is similar to assignments input. Add ~ at the beginning if you do not want to enforce the assignment(s)
×

Repository: github.com/azure/online-experimentation-analysis

Description

Download the latest analysis results for an online experiment of an Azure App Configuration feature flag

Categories

MonitoringDocumentation

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription

resource-group Yes The resource group of the Log Analytics workspace.
log-analytics-workspace Yes The name of the Log Analytics workspace.
app-configuration-feature-flag Yes The App Configuration feature flag of the experiment.
app-configuration-label No The App Configuration label. Default to no label.
metric-category-order No The analysis summary displays metrics grouped by their categories. This input specifies the display order of metric categories as a comma separated list. Unspecified categories are appended in alphabetical order, followed by the group of uncategorized metrics. Default: ''.
lookback-days No The number of previous days to search the Log Analytics workspace for the latest analysis results. Default: 30.
github-actions-summary No If the analysis summary should be displayed in the GitHub Action job summary. Default: true.

Outputs

NameDescription
analysis-start-time The start time of the analysis (ISO 8601 format).
analysis-end-time The end time of the analysis (ISO 8601 format).
summary-md Summary of the analysis results (GitHub Flavored Markdown format).

Online Experimentation Deploy Metrics

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/online-experimentation-deploy-metrics

Author: Microsoft

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/online-experimentation-deploy-metrics

Description

Deploy metric definitions from a configuration file to the Online Experimentation workspace

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
path Yes Source file(s) containing metrics. Multiple files can be specified in list or glob format. Example: **/*.json or metrics/*.json. Use ! to exclude files.
online-experimentation-workspace-endpoint Yes Online Experimentation workspace endpoint
operation No Possible values: validate or deploy - deploy by default. validate: only validates the configuration file. deploy: syncs the configuration file with Online Experimentation workspace
strict No If strict, the deploy operation deletes metrics not found in the config file. Choices: true, false (default: true).
add-commit-hash-to-metric-description No Indicates whether to add the git commit hash to the metric description. This is helpful to track the metric version used by experiment analysis. Choices: true, false (default: false)
×

Azure Pipelines Action

‚úì Official Publisher

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/pipelines

Description

Trigger a run in Azure pipelines

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
azure-devops-project-url Yes Fullyqualified URL to the Azure DevOps organization along with project name(eg, https://dev.azure.com/organization/project-name or https://server.example.com:8080/tfs/DefaultCollection/project-name)
azure-pipeline-name Yes Name of the Azure Pipline to be triggered
azure-pipeline-variables No Set/Overwrite pipeline variables
azure-devops-token Yes Paste personal access token of the user as value of secret variable:AZURE_DEVOPS_TOKEN

Azure Policy Compliance Scan

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/policy-compliance-scan

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/policy-compliance-scan

Description

Triggers compliance scan on Azure resources and passes/fails based on the compliance state of the resources

Categories

SecurityMonitoring

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
scopes Yes Mandatory. Takes full identifier for one or more azure resources, resource groups or subscriptions. The on-demand policy compliance scan is triggered for all of these. The ID can generally be found in the properties section of the resource in Azure Portal.
scopes-ignore No Optional. Takes full identifier for one or more azure resources, resource groups(followed by /*). If the resources are found non-compliant after the scan completion, the action fails. However, in this input you can specify resources or resource groups for which the compliance state will be ignored. The action will pass irrespective of the compliance state of these resources. In case you want the action to always pass irrespective of the compliance state of resources, you can set its value as all.
policy-assignments-ignore No Optional. Takes full identifier for one or more policy assignments ids. If the resources are found non-compliant for given policy assignment after the scan completion, the action fails. However, in this input you can specify policy assignments ids for which the compliance state will be ignored. The action will pass irrespective of the compliance state of these policies.
wait No Optional. Depending on the breadth, the time taken for compliance scan can range from a few minutes to several hours. By default, the action will wait for the compliance scan to complete and succeed or fail based on the compliance state of resources. However, you can mark this input as false, in which case the action will trigger the compliance scan and succeed immediately. The status of the triggered scan and the compliance state of resources would have to be then viewed in activity log of the resource in Azure portal.
skip-report No Optional. Defaults to false. If false, the action will upload a CSV file containing a list of resources that are non-compliant after the triggered scan is complete. The CSV file can be downloaded as an artifact from the workflow run for manual analysis. Note that the number of rows in CSV are capped at 100,000.
report-name No Optional. The filename for the CSV to be uploaded. Ignored if skip-report is set to true.
×

Azure PostgreSQL Action

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/postgresql

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/postgresql

Description

Deploy to Azure PostgreSQL database using PL/SQL script files

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructureDatabase Management

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
server-name Yes Server name of Azure DB for PostgreSQL. Example: fabrikam.postgres.database.azure.com
connection-string Yes The connection string, including authentication information, for the Azure PostgreSQL Server. Please provide psql connection string. Example: psql "host={host} port={port} dbname={your_database} user={user} password={your_password} sslmode=require"
plsql-file Yes Path to PL/SQL script file to deploy. To specify multiple files, use the regex syntax : *.sql or folder/x/<regex>.sql
arguments No Additional options supported by postgresql simple SQL shell. These options will be applied when executing the given file on the Azure DB for Postgresql. In case of multiple files, the same args will be applied for all files
×

Author: Unknown

Repository: github.com/azure/powershell

Description

Automate your GitHub workflows using Azure PowerShell scripts.

Categories

InfrastructureBuildDeployment

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
inlineScript Yes Specify the Az PowerShell script here.
azPSVersion Yes Azure PS version to be used to execute the script, example: 1.8.0, 2.8.0, 3.4.0. To use the latest version, specify "latest".
errorActionPreference No Select the value of the ErrorActionPreference variable for executing the script. Options: stop, continue, silentlyContinue. Default is Stop.
failOnStandardError No If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream.
githubToken No Used to pull Az module from Azure/az-ps-module-versions. Since there's a default, this is typically not supplied by the user.

Repository: github.com/azure/run-sqlpackage-action

Description

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
action Yes Action parameter to run with SqlPackage. Supported values are: Publish, DeployReport, DriftReport, Script
sourcepath Yes The path where to look for the DACPAC file. If multiple files exists, all of them are processed
profile Yes The profile path to use during the execution. It has to be an xml file
database-server No Database server URL (without protocol). If not indicated in the publishing profile, it has to be indicated here.
database-name No Database name. If not indicated in the publishing profile, it has to be indicated here.
authtoken No The authentication token used to connect to the database, if credentials not indicated in the connection string
outputpath No The output folder where assets will be generated if any
outputfile No The output file name. The final name of the file will be [dacpac_name].[outputfile]

Azure Spring Apps

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/spring-apps-deploy

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/spring-apps-deploy

Description

Deploy applications to Azure Spring Apps and manage deployments.

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
azure-subscription Yes Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.
action Yes Action to be performed on Azure Spring Apps.
service-name Yes Select the Azure Spring Apps service to which to deploy.
app-name Yes Select the Azure Spring Apps app to deploy.
use-staging-deployment Yes Automatically select the deployment that's set as Staging at the time the task runs.
create-new-deployment No Whether to target the deployment that's set as Staging at the time of execution. If unchecked, the 'Deployment Name' setting must be set.
deployment-name No The deployment to which this task will apply. Lowercase letters, - and numbers only; must start with a letter.
package No File path to the package or a folder containing the Spring Apps app contents.
target-module No Child module to be deployed, required for multiple jar packages built from source code.
cpu No The CPU resource quantity. It should be 500m or number of CPU cores. It is effective only when creating new deployment.
memory No The memory resource quantity. It should be 512Mi or #Gi, e.g., 1Gi, 3Gi. It is effective only when creating new deployment.
environment-variables No Edit the app's environment variables.
jvm-options No Edit the app's JVM options. A String containing JVM Options. Example: `-Xms1024m -Xmx2048m`
runtime-version No The runtime on which the app will run.
dotnetcore-mainentry-path No The path to the .NET executable relative to zip root.
version No The runtime on which the app will run.
build-name No (Enterprise Tier Only) The build name.
builder No (Enterprise Tier Only) Build service builder used to build the executable.
build-cpu No (Enterprise Tier Only) CPU resource quantity for build container. Should be 500m or number of CPU cores. Default: 1
build-memory No (Enterprise Tier Only) Memory resource quantity for build container. Should be 512Mi or #Gi, e.g., 1Gi, 3Gi. Default: 2Gi.
build-env No (Enterprise Tier Only) Space-separated environment variables for the build process in 'key[=value]' format.
config-file-patterns No (Enterprise Tier Only) Config file patterns separated with ',' to decide which patterns of Application Configuration Service will be used. Use '""' to clear existing configurations.
container-registry No The registry of the container image. Default: docker.io.
registry-username No The username of the container registry.
registry-password No The password of the container registry.
container-image No The container image.
container-command No The command of the container.
container-args No The arguments of the container.
language-framework No The language framework of the container.
enable-liveness-probe No If false, will disable the liveness probe of the app instance. Allowed values: false, true.
enable-readiness-probe No If false, will disable the readiness probe of the app instance. Allowed values: false, true.
enable-startup-probe No If false, will disable the startup probe of the app instance. Allowed values: false, true.
termination-grace-period-seconds No Optional duration in seconds the app instance needs to terminate gracefully.
liveness-probe-config No A json file path indicates the liveness probe config
readiness-probe-config No A json file path indicates the readiness probe config
startup-probe-config No A json file path indicates the startup probe config
×

Repository: github.com/azure/static-web-apps-deploy

Description

Deploys an application to Azure Static Web Apps

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
action Yes Action to perform
app_location Yes Directory location of the application source code
azure_static_web_apps_api_token Yes Required token
api_build_command No Custom command for Oryx to run when building Azure Functions source code
api_location No Directory location of the Azure Functions source code
app_artifact_location No Identical in use to output_location
output_location No Directory location of the compiled application code after building
app_build_command No Custom command for Oryx to run when building application source code
repo_token No Token for interacting with the Github repository. Currently used only for commenting on Pull Requests.
routes_location No Directory location where the routes.json file can be found in the source code
skip_app_build No Skips the build step for the application source code if set to true.
config_file_location No Directory location where the staticwebapp.config.json file can be found in the source code
skip_api_build No Skips the build step for the Azure Functions source code if set to true.
production_branch No When specified, deployments from other branches will be considered preview environments.
deployment_environment No Name of the Azure Static Web Apps environment to deploy to.
is_static_export No Indicates you are using `next export` to generate a static site if set to true.
data_api_location No Directory location of the Data API configuration files
github_id_token No GitHub Auth id token

Trusted Signing

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/trusted-signing-action

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/trusted-signing-action

Description

Sign your files with Trusted Signing.

Categories

SecurityAuthentication

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
azure-tenant-id No The Azure Active Directory tenant (directory) ID.
azure-client-id No The client (application) ID of an App Registration in the tenant.
azure-client-secret No A client secret that was generated for the App Registration.
azure-client-certificate-path No A path to certificate and private key pair in PEM or PFX format, which can authenticate the App Registration.
azure-client-send-certificate-chain No Specifies whether an authentication request will include an x5c header to support subject name / issuer based authentication. When set to `true` or `1`, authentication requests include the x5c header.
azure-username No The username, also known as upn, of an Azure Active Directory user account.
azure-password No The password of the Azure Active Directory user account. Note this does not support accounts with MFA enabled.
endpoint Yes The Trusted Signing Account endpoint. The URI value must have a URI that aligns to the region your Trusted Signing Account and Certificate Profile you are specifying were created in during the setup of these resources.
code-signing-account-name No The Code Signing Account name.
trusted-signing-account-name No The Trusted Signing Account name.
certificate-profile-name Yes The Certificate Profile name.
files No A comma or newline separated list of absolute paths to the files being signed. Can be combined with the files-folder and file-catalog inputs.
files-folder No The folder containing files to be signed. Can be combined with the files and file-catalog inputs.
files-folder-filter No A comma separated list of file extensions that determines which types of files will be signed in the folder specified by the files-folder input. E.g., 'dll,exe,msix'. Any file type not included in this list will not be signed. If this input is not used, all files in the folder will be signed. Supports wildcards for matching multiple file names with a pattern.
files-folder-recurse No A boolean value (true/false) that indicates if the folder specified by the files-folder input should be searched recursively. The default value is false.
files-folder-depth No An integer value that indicates the depth of the recursive search toggled by the files-folder-recursive input.
files-catalog No A file containing a list of relative paths to the files being signed. The paths should be relative to the location of the catalog file. Each file path should be on a separate line. Can be combined with the files and files-folder inputs.
file-digest No The name of the digest algorithm used for hashing the files being signed. The supported values are SHA256, SHA384, and SHA512.
timestamp-rfc3161 No A URL to an RFC3161 compliant timestamping service.
timestamp-digest No The name of the digest algorithm used for timestamping. The supported values are SHA256, SHA384, and SHA512.
append-signature No A boolean value (true/false) that indicates if the signature should be appended. If no primary signature is present, this signature is made the primary signature instead.
description No A description of the signed content.
description-url No A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) for the expanded description of the signed content.
generate-digest-path No Generates the digest to be signed and the unsigned PKCS7 files at this path. The output digest and PKCS7 files will be path\FileName.dig and path\FileName.p7u. To output an additional XML file, see `generate-digest-xml`.
generate-digest-xml No A boolean value (true/false) that indicates if an XML file is produced when the `generate-digest-path` input is used. The output file will be Path\FileName.dig.xml.
ingest-digest-path No Creates the signature by ingesting the signed digest to the unsigned PKCS7 file at this path. The input signed digest and unsigned PKCS7 files should be path\FileName.dig.signed and path\FileName.p7u.
sign-digest No A boolean value (true/false) that indicates if only the digest should be signed. The input file should be the digest generated by the `generate-digest-path` input. The output file will be File.signed.
generate-page-hashes No A boolean value (true/false) that indicates if page hashes should be generated for executable files.
suppress-page-hashes No A boolean value (true/false) that indicates if page hashes should be suppressed for executable files. The default is determined by the SIGNTOOL_PAGE_HASHES environment variable and by the wintrust.dll version. This input is ignored for non-PE files.
generate-pkcs7 No A boolean value (true/false) that indicates if a Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) \#7 file is produced for each specified content file. PKCS \#7 files are named path\filename.p7.
pkcs7-options No Options for the signed PKCS \#7 content. Set value to "Embedded" to embed the signed content in the PKCS \#7 file, or to "DetachedSignedData" to produce the signed data portion of a detached PKCS \#7 file. If this input is not used, the signed content is embedded by default.
pkcs7-oid No The object identifier (OID) that identifies the signed PKCS \#7 content.
enhanced-key-usage No The enhanced key usage (EKU) that must be present in the signing certificate. The usage value can be specified by OID or string. The default usage is "Code Signing" (1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.3).
exclude-environment-credential No Exclude the "EnvironmentCredential" type from being considered when authenticating with "DefaultAzureCredential".
exclude-workload-identity-credential No Exclude the "WorkloadIdentityCredential" type from being considered when authenticating with "DefaultAzureCredential".
exclude-managed-identity-credential No Exclude the "ManagedIdentity" type from being considered when authenticating with "DefaultAzureCredential".
exclude-shared-token-cache-credential No Exclude the "SharedTokenCacheCredential" type from being considered when authenticating with "DefaultAzureCredential".
exclude-visual-studio-credential No Exclude the "VisualStudioCredential" type from being considered when authenticating with "DefaultAzureCredential".
exclude-visual-studio-code-credential No Exclude the "VisualStudioCodeCredential" type from being considered when authenticating with "DefaultAzureCredential".
exclude-azure-cli-credential No Exclude the "AzureCliCredential" type from being considered when authenticating with "DefaultAzureCredential".
exclude-azure-powershell-credential No Exclude the "AzurePowerShellCredential" type from being considered when authenticating with "DefaultAzureCredential".
exclude-azure-developer-cli-credential No Exclude the "AzureDeveloperCliCredential" type from being considered when authenticating with "DefaultAzureCredential".
exclude-interactive-browser-credential No Exclude the "InteractiveBrowserCredential" type from being considered when authenticating with "DefaultAzureCredential".
timeout No The number of seconds that the Trusted Signing service will wait for all files to be signed before it exits. The default value is 300 seconds.
batch-size No The summed length of file paths that can be signed with each signtool call. This parameter should only be relevant if you are signing a large number of files. Increasing the value may result in performance gains at the risk of potentially hitting your system's maximum command length limit. The minimum value is 0 and the maximum value is 30000. A value of 0 means that every file will be signed with an individual call to signtool.
cache-dependencies No A boolean value (true/false) that indicates if the dependencies for this action should be cached by GitHub or not. The default value is true. When using self-hosted runners, caches from workflow runs are stored on GitHub-owned cloud storage. A customer-owned storage solution is only available with GitHub Enterprise Server. When enabled, this option can reduce the duration of the action by at least 1 minute.
trace No A boolean value (true/false) that controls trace logging. The default value is false.
clickonce-application-name No The application name for any ClickOnce files being signed.
clickonce-publisher-name No The publisher name for any ClickOnce files being signed.
correlation-id No A unique identifier for the signing request. This value is used to track the signing request in the Trusted Signing service.
×

configuration-file No Path of the Docker-Compose file. Should be a fully qualified path or relative to the default working directory. Required for multi-container scenario

Azure WebApp

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/azure/webapps-deploy

Author: Unknown

Publisher: azure

Repository: github.com/azure/webapps-deploy

Description

Deploy Web Apps/Containerized Web Apps to Azure. github.com/Azure/Actions

Categories

DeploymentInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
app-name Yes Name of the Azure Web App
publish-profile No Applies to Web Apps(Windows and Linux) and Web App Containers(linux). Multi container scenario not supported. Publish profile (*.publishsettings) file contents with Web Deploy secrets
slot-name No Enter an existing Slot other than the Production slot
package No Applies to Web App only: Path to package or folder. *.zip, *.war, *.jar or a folder to deploy
images No Applies to Web App Containers only: Specify the fully qualified container image(s) name. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest' or 'python:3.7.2-alpine/'. For multi-container scenario multiple container image names can be provided (multi-line separated)
configuration-file No Applies to Web App Containers only: Path of the Docker-Compose file. Should be a fully qualified path or relative to the default working directory. Required for multi-container scenario
startup-command No Enter the start up command. For ex. dotnet run or dotnet run
resource-group-name No Enter the resource group name of the web app
type No Enter deployment type (JAR, WAR, EAR, ZIP, Static)
target-path No Target path in the web app. For ex. '/home/site/wwwroot'
clean No Delete existing files target directory before deploying
restart No Restart the app service after deployment
sitecontainers-config No Applies to Sitecontainers, containes a list of siteContainer specs

Outputs

Continuous Benchmark

Action ID: marketplace/benchmark-action/github-action-benchmark

Author: github-action-benchmark developers <https://github.com/benchmark-action>

Publisher: benchmark-action

Repository: github.com/benchmark-action/github-action-benchmark

Description

Continuous Benchmark using GitHub pages as dash board for keeping performance

Categories

TestingMonitoring

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
name Yes Name of the benchmark. This value must be identical among all benchmarks
tool Yes Tool to use get benchmark output. One of "cargo", "go", "benchmarkjs", "pytest", "googlecpp", "catch2", "julia", "benchmarkdotnet", "customBiggerIsBetter", "customSmallerIsBetter"
output-file-path Yes A path to file which contains the benchmark output
gh-pages-branch Yes Branch for gh-pages
gh-repository No Url to an optional different repository to store benchmark results
benchmark-data-dir-path Yes Path to directory which contains benchmark files on GitHub pages branch
github-token No GitHub API token to pull/push GitHub pages branch and deploy GitHub pages. For public repository, this must be personal access token for now. Please read README.md for more details
ref No optional Ref to use when finding commit
auto-push No Push GitHub Pages branch to remote automatically. This option requires github-token input
skip-fetch-gh-pages No Skip pulling GitHub Pages branch before generating an auto commit
comment-always No Leave a comment with benchmark result comparison. To enable this feature, github-token input must be given as well
summary-always No Leave a job summary with benchmark result comparison
save-data-file No Save the benchmark data to external file
comment-on-alert No Leave an alert comment when current benchmark result is worse than previous. Threshold is specified with alert-threshold input. To enable this feature, github-token input must be given as well
alert-threshold No Threshold which determines if an alert should happen or not. Percentage value such as "150%". For example, 150% means that an alert happens when current benchmark result is 1.5x worse than previous
fail-on-alert No Workflow fails when alert comment happens
fail-threshold No Threshold which determines if the current workflow fails. Format is the same as alert-threshold input. If this value is not specified, the same value as alert-threshold is used
alert-comment-cc-users No Comma separated GitHub user names which start with @ (e.g. "@foo,@bar"). They will be mentioned in commit comment for alert.
external-data-json-path No JSON data file for storing benchmark results. When this input is set, github-action-benchmark no longer uses Git branch to store data. Instead, it reads and appends benchmark data from/to the file. User must store the file anywhere
max-items-in-chart No Max data points in a benchmark chart to avoid making the chart too busy. Value must be unsigned integer. No limit by default
×

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription

pngQuality No PNG quality level
webpQuality No WEBP quality level
avifQuality No AVIF quality level
ignorePaths No Paths to ignore during search
compressOnly No Images will be compressed. No commit, or comments will be added to your Pull Request
minPctChange No Minimun percentage reduction to be committed

NameDescription
markdown Output param used to store the Markdown summary for subsequent actions to use

NameRequiredDescription

directory No Directory to search for test result reports. Will run test processing on all files in the directory.
disable-search No Disable search for test result files. This is helpful when specifying what files you want to run test report processing with the --file option.
exclude No Directories to exclude from search.
file No Path to the junit file to run test result processing.
version No Specify which version of the Codecov CLI should be used. Defaults to `latest`.

Codecov

‚úì Official Publisher

Action ID: marketplace/codecov/codecov-action

Author: Thomas Hu <@thomasrockhu-codecov> | Codecov

Publisher: codecov

Repository: github.com/codecov/codecov-action

Description

GitHub Action that uploads coverage reports for your repository to codecov.io

Categories

TestingCode qualityPublishing

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
base_sha No The base SHA to select. This is only used in the "pr-base-picking" run command
binary No The file location of a pre-downloaded version of the CLI. If specified, integrity checking will be bypassed.
codecov_yml_path No The location of the codecov.yml file. This is crrently ONLY used for automated test selection (https://docs.codecov.com/docs/getting-started-with-ats). Note that for all other cases, the Codecov yaml will need to be located as described here: https://docs.codecov.com/docs/codecov-yaml#can-i-name-the-file-codecovyml
commit_parent No SHA (with 40 chars) of what should be the parent of this commit.
directory No Folder to search for coverage files. Default to the current working directory
disable_file_fixes No Disable file fixes to ignore common lines from coverage (e.g. blank lines or empty brackets). Read more here https://docs.codecov.com/docs/fixing-reports
disable_search No Disable search for coverage files. This is helpful when specifying what files you want to upload with the files option.
disable_safe_directory No Disable setting safe directory. Set to true to disable.
disable_telem No Disable sending telemetry data to Codecov. Set to true to disable.
dry_run No Don't upload files to Codecov
env_vars No Environment variables to tag the upload with (e.g. PYTHON | OS,PYTHON)
exclude No Comma-separated list of folders to exclude from search.
fail_ci_if_error No On error, exit with non-zero code
files No Comma-separated list of explicit files to upload. These will be added to the coverage files found for upload. If you wish to only upload the specified files, please consider using disable_search to disable uploading other files.
flags No Comma-separated list of flags to upload to group coverage metrics.
force No Only used for empty-upload run command
git_service No Override the git_service (e.g. github_enterprise)
gcov_args No Extra arguments to pass to gcov
gcov_executable No gcov executable to run. Defaults to 'gcov'
gcov_ignore No Paths to ignore during gcov gathering
gcov_include No Paths to include during gcov gathering
handle_no_reports_found No If no coverage reports are found, do not raise an exception.
job_code No
name No Custom defined name of the upload. Visible in the Codecov UI
network_filter No Specify a filter on the files listed in the network section of the Codecov report. This will only add files whose path begin with the specified filter. Useful for upload-specific path fixing.
network_prefix No Specify a prefix on files listed in the network section of the Codecov report. Useful to help resolve path fixing.
os No Override the assumed OS. Options available at cli.codecov.io
override_branch No Specify the branch to be displayed with this commit on Codecov
override_build No Specify the build number manually
override_build_url No The URL of the build where this is running
override_commit No Commit SHA (with 40 chars)
override_pr No Specify the pull request number manually. Used to override pre-existing CI environment variables.
plugins No Comma-separated list of plugins to run. Specify `noop` to turn off all plugins
recurse_submodules No Whether to enumerate files inside of submodules for path-fixing purposes. Off by default.
report_code No The code of the report if using local upload. If unsure, leave default. Read more here https://docs.codecov.com/docs/the-codecov-cli#how-to-use-local-upload
report_type No The type of file to upload, coverage by default. Possible values are "test_results", "coverage".
root_dir No Root folder from which to consider paths on the network section. Defaults to current working directory.
run_command No Choose which CLI command to run. Options are "upload-coverage", "empty-upload", "pr-base-picking", "send-notifications". "upload-coverage" is run by default.
skip_validation No Skip integrity checking of the CLI. This is NOT recommended.
slug No [Required when using the org token] Set to the owner/repo slug used instead of the private repo token. Only applicable to some Enterprise users.
swift_project No Specify the swift project name. Useful for optimization.
token No Repository Codecov token. Used to authorize report uploads
url No Set to the Codecov instance URl. Used by Dedicated Enterprise Cloud customers.
use_legacy_upload_endpoint No Use the legacy upload endpoint.
use_oidc No Use OIDC instead of token. This will ignore any token supplied
use_pypi No Use the pypi version of the CLI instead of from cli.codecov.io
verbose No Enable verbose logging
version No Which version of the Codecov CLI to use (defaults to 'latest')
working-directory No Directory in which to execute codecov.sh
×

folders_to_exclude No Avoid certain folders when uploading static analysis
force No Force upload of files during static analysis regardless if they are new
label_max_wait_time No Max time (in seconds) to wait for the label analysis. Default is to wait forever.

output_variable No Variable to save down tests string. Defaults to CODECOV_ATS_TESTS

AI-based PR Reviewer & Summarizer with Chat Capabilities

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
debug No Enable debug mode
max_files No Max files to summarize and review. Less than or equal to 0 means no limit.
review_simple_changes No Review even when the changes are simple
review_comment_lgtm No Leave comments even if the patch is LGTM
path_filters No The path filters, e.g., "src/**.py", "!dist/**", each line will be considered as one pattern. See also - https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#onpushpull_requestpull_request_targetpathspaths-ignore - https://github.com/isaacs/minimatch
disable_review No Only provide the summary and skip the code review.
disable_release_notes No Disable release notes
openai_base_url No The url of the openai api interface.
openai_light_model No Model to use for simple tasks like summarizing diff on a file.
openai_heavy_model No Model to use for complex tasks such as code reviews.
openai_model_temperature No Temperature for GPT model
openai_retries No How many times to retry OpenAI API in case of timeouts or errors?
openai_timeout_ms No Timeout for OpenAI API call in millis
openai_concurrency_limit No How many concurrent API calls to make to OpenAI servers?
github_concurrency_limit No How many concurrent API calls to make to GitHub?
system_message No System message to be sent to OpenAI
summarize No The prompt for final summarization response
summarize_release_notes No The prompt for generating release notes in the same chat as summarize stage
language No ISO code for the response language
bot_icon No The icon for the bot

terraform-apply

Action ID: marketplace/dflook/terraform-apply

Author: Daniel Flook

Publisher: dflook

Repository: github.com/dflook/terraform-apply

Description

Apply a Terraform plan

Categories

InfrastructureDeploymentDependency management

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
path No Path to the Terraform root module to apply
workspace No Terraform workspace to run the apply in
label No A friendly name for the environment the Terraform configuration is for. This will be used in the PR comment for easy identification. It must be the same as the `label` used in the corresponding [`dflook/terraform-plan`](https://github.com/dflook/terraform-github-actions/tree/main/terraform-plan) action.
variables No Variables to set for the terraform plan. This should be valid Terraform syntax - like a [variable definition file](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/values/variables#variable-definitions-tfvars-files). Variables set here override any given in `var_file`s.
var_file No List of tfvars files to use, one per line. Paths should be relative to the GitHub Actions workspace
backend_config No List of Terraform backend config values, one per line.
backend_config_file No List of Terraform backend config files to use, one per line. Paths should be relative to the GitHub Actions workspace
replace No List of resources to replace, one per line.
target No List of resources to apply, one per line. The apply operation will be limited to these resources and their dependencies.
destroy No Set to `true` to destroy all resources. This generates and applies a plan in [destroy mode](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/plan#planning-modes).
refresh No Set to `false` to skip synchronisation of the Terraform state with actual resources. This will make the plan faster but may be out of date with the actual resources, which can lead to incorrect plans.
plan_path No Path to a plan file to apply. This would have been generated by a previous [`dflook/terraform-plan`](https://github.com/dflook/terraform-github-actions/tree/main/terraform-plan) action. The default behaviour when this is not set is to generate a plan from the current configuration and compare it to the plan attached to the PR comment. If it is logically the same, the plan will be applied. When this is set to a plan file, the plan will not be generated again. If it is the exact same plan as the one attached to the PR comment, it will be applied. This will be faster than generating a new plan. There are downsides to applying a stored plan: - The plan may contain sensitive information so must be stored securely, possibly outside of GitHub. - It does not account for any changes that have occurred since it was generated, and may no longer be correct. - Plans must be generated and applied in strict order. Multiple open PRs will cause conflicts if they are applied out of order. - Plans are not portable between platforms. - Terraform and provider versions must match between the plan generation and apply. When `auto_approve` is set to `true`, the plan will be applied without checking if it is the same as the one attached to the PR comment.
auto_approve No When set to `true`, plans are always applied. The default is `false`, which requires plans to have been added to a pull request comment.
parallelism No Limit the number of concurrent operations

Outputs

NameDescription
json_plan_path This is the path to the generated plan in [JSON Output Format](https://www.terraform.io/docs/internals/json-format.html). The path is relative to the Actions workspace. Terraform plans often contain sensitive information, so this output should be treated with care. This won't be set if the backend type is `remote` - Terraform does not support saving remote plans.
text_plan_path This is the path to the generated plan in a human-readable format. The path is relative to the Actions workspace. This won't be set if `auto_approve` is true while using a `remote` backend.
failure-reason When the job outcome is `failure`, this output may be set. The value may be one of: - `apply-failed` - The Terraform apply operation failed. - `plan-changed` - The approved plan is no longer accurate, so the apply will not be attempted. - `state-locked` - The Terraform state lock could not be obtained because it was already locked. If the job fails for any other reason this will not be set. This can be used with the Actions expression syntax to conditionally run steps.
lock-info When the job outcome is `failure` and the failure-reason is `state-locked`, this output will be set. It is a json object containing any available state lock information and typically has the form: ```json { "ID": "838fbfde-c5cd-297f-84a4-d7578b4a4880", "Path": "terraform-github-actions/test-unlock-state", "Operation": "OperationTypeApply", "Who": "root@e9d43b0c6478", "Version": "1.3.7", "Created": "2023-01-28 00:16:41.560904373 +0000 UTC", "Info": "" } ```
run_id If the root module uses the `remote` or `cloud` backend in remote execution mode, this output will be set to the remote run id.
json_output_path This is the path to all the root module outputs in a JSON file. The path is relative to the Actions workspace. For example, with the Terraform config: ```hcl output "service_hostname" { value = "example.com" } ``` The file pointed to by this output will contain: ```json { "service_hostname": "example.com" } ``` Terraform list, set and tuple types are cast to a JSON array, map and object types are cast to a JSON object.
×

terraform-check

Action ID: marketplace/dflook/terraform-check

Author: Daniel Flook

Publisher: dflook

Repository: github.com/dflook/terraform-check

Description

Check if there are Terraform changes to apply

Categories

TestingInfrastructureCode quality

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
path No Path to the Terraform root module to check
workspace No Terraform workspace to run the plan in
variables No Variables to set for the terraform plan. This should be valid Terraform syntax - like a [variable definition file](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/values/variables#variable-definitions-tfvars-files). Variables set here override any given in `var_file`s.
var_file No List of tfvars files to use, one per line. Paths should be relative to the GitHub Actions workspace
backend_config No List of Terraform backend config values, one per line.
backend_config_file No List of Terraform backend config files to use, one per line. Paths should be relative to the GitHub Actions workspace
parallelism No Limit the number of concurrent operations

Outputs

NameDescription
failure-reason When the job outcome is `failure` because the there are outstanding changes to apply, this will be set to 'changes-to-apply'. If the job fails for any other reason this will not be set. This can be used with the Actions expression syntax to conditionally run a step when there are changes to apply.
×

terraform-destroy

Action ID: marketplace/dflook/terraform-destroy

Author: Daniel Flook

Publisher: dflook

Repository: github.com/dflook/terraform-destroy

Description

Destroys all resources in a Terraform workspace

Categories

InfrastructureDeployment

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
path No The path to the Terraform root module directory.
workspace No The name of the Terraform workspace to destroy.
variables No Variables to set for the terraform destroy. This should be valid Terraform syntax - like a [variable definition file](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/values/variables#variable-definitions-tfvars-files). Variables set here override any given in `var_file`s.
var_file No List of tfvars files to use, one per line. Paths should be relative to the GitHub Actions workspace
backend_config No List of Terraform backend config values, one per line.
backend_config_file No List of Terraform backend config files to use, one per line. Paths should be relative to the GitHub Actions workspace
parallelism No Limit the number of concurrent operations

Outputs

NameDescription
failure-reason When the job outcome is `failure`, this output may be set. The value may be one of: - `destroy-failed` - The Terraform destroy operation failed. - `state-locked` - The Terraform state lock could not be obtained because it was already locked. If the job fails for any other reason this will not be set. This can be used with the Actions expression syntax to conditionally run a steps.
lock-info When the job outcome is `failure` and the failure-reason is `state-locked`, this output will be set. It is a json object containing any available state lock information and typically has the form: ```json { "ID": "838fbfde-c5cd-297f-84a4-d7578b4a4880", "Path": "terraform-github-actions/test-unlock-state", "Operation": "OperationTypeApply", "Who": "root@e9d43b0c6478", "Version": "1.3.7", "Created": "2023-01-28 00:16:41.560904373 +0000 UTC", "Info": "" } ```
×

var_file No List of tfvars files to use, one per line. Paths should be relative to the GitHub Actions workspace
backend_config No List of Terraform backend config values, one per line.
backend_config_file No List of Terraform backend config files to use, one per line. Paths should be relative to the GitHub Actions workspace
parallelism No Limit the number of concurrent operations

Outputs

NameDescription
failure-reason When the job outcome is `failure`, this output may be set. The value may be one of: - `destroy-failed` - The Terraform destroy operation failed. - `state-locked` - The Terraform state lock could not be obtained because it was already locked. If the job fails for any other reason this will not be set. This can be used with the Actions expression syntax to conditionally run a steps.
lock-info When the job outcome is `failure` and the failure-reason is `state-locked`, this output will be set. It is a json object containing any available state lock information and typically has the form: ```json { "ID": "838fbfde-c5cd-297f-84a4-d7578b4a4880", "Path": "terraform-github-actions/test-unlock-state", "Operation": "OperationTypeApply", "Who": "root@e9d43b0c6478", "Version": "1.3.7", "Created": "2023-01-28 00:16:41.560904373 +0000 UTC", "Info": "" } ```

See [dflook/terraform-version](https://github.com/dflook/terraform-github-actions/tree/main/terraform-version#terraform-version-action) for details.
backend_config_file No List of Terraform backend config files to use, one per line. This is used for discovering the Terraform version to use, if the version is not otherwise specified. See [dflook/terraform-version](https://github.com/dflook/terraform-github-actions/tree/main/terraform-version#terraform-version-action) for details.
