Debugging with tmate

Action ID: marketplace/mxschmitt/action-tmate

Author: Max Schmitt

Publisher: mxschmitt

Repository: github.com/mxschmitt/action-tmate

Description

Debug your GitHub Actions Environment interactively by using SSH or a Web shell

Categories

DebuggingCommunicationInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
sudo No If apt should be executed with sudo or without
install-dependencies No Whether or not to install dependencies for tmate on linux (openssh-client, xz-utils)
limit-access-to-actor No Whether to authorize only the public SSH keys of the user triggering the workflow (defaults to true if the GitHub profile of the user has a public SSH key)
detached No In detached mode, the workflow job will continue while the tmate session is active
connect-timeout-seconds No How long in seconds to wait for a connection to be established
tmate-server-host No The hostname for your tmate server (e.g. ssh.example.org)
tmate-server-port No The port for your tmate server (e.g. 2222)
tmate-server-rsa-fingerprint No The RSA fingerprint for your tmate server
tmate-server-ed25519-fingerprint No The ed25519 fingerprint for your tmate server
msys2-location No The root of the MSYS2 installation (on Windows runners)
github-token No Personal access token (PAT) used to call into GitHub's REST API. We recommend using a service account with the least permissions necessary. Also when generating a new PAT, select the least scopes necessary. [Learn more about creating and using encrypted secrets](https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/creating-and-using-encrypted-secrets)

Outputs

NameDescription
ssh-command The SSH command to connect to the tmate session (only set when detached mode is enabled)
ssh-address The raw SSH address without the "ssh" prefix (only set when detached mode is enabled)
web-url The web URL to connect to the tmate session (only set when detached mode is enabled and web URL is available)
×

Debug with ssh

Action ID: marketplace/mxschmitt/action-upterm

Author: Owen Ou

Publisher: mxschmitt

Repository: github.com/mxschmitt/action-upterm

Description

This GitHub Action enables direct interaction with the host system running your GitHub Actions via SSH

Categories

InfrastructureAuthentication

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
limit-access-to-actor No If only the public SSH keys of the user triggering the workflow should be authorized
limit-access-to-users No If only the public SSH keys of the listed GitHub users should be authorized
upterm-server Yes upterm server address (required), supported protocols are ssh, ws, or wss.
ssh-known-hosts No Content for ~/.ssh/known_hosts file on the server
wait-timeout-minutes No Integer number of minutes to wait for user to connect before shutting down server. Once a user connects, the server will stay up.

Setup Miniconda

Action ID: marketplace/mxschmitt/setup-miniconda

Author: Gonzalo Pe√±a-Castellanos (@goanpeca)

Publisher: mxschmitt

Repository: github.com/mxschmitt/setup-miniconda

Description

Set up Conda package and environment manager with Miniconda.

Categories

Dependency managementBuildPackaging

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
installer-url No If provided, this installer will be used instead of a miniconda installer, and cached based on its full URL Visit https://github.com/conda/constructor for more information on creating installers
miniconda-version No If provided, this version of Miniconda3 will be downloaded and installed. Visit https://repo.continuum.io/miniconda/ for more information on available versions.
miniforge-variant No If provided, this variant of Miniforge will be downloaded and installed. If `miniforge-version` is not provided, the `latest` version will be used. Currently-known values: - Miniforge3 (default) - Miniforge-pypy3 - Mambaforge - Mambaforge-pypy3 Visit https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge/releases/ for more information on available variants
miniforge-version No If provided, this version of the given Miniforge variant will be downloaded and installed. If `miniforge-variant` is not provided, `Miniforge3` will be used. Visit https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge/releases/ for more information on available versions
conda-version No Specific version of Conda to install after miniconda is located or installed. See https://anaconda.org/anaconda/conda for available "conda" versions.
conda-build-version No Version of conda build to install. If not provided conda-build is not installed. See https://anaconda.org/anaconda/conda-build for available "conda-build" versions.
environment-file No Environment.yml to create an environment. See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/tasks/manage-environments.html#creating-an-environment-from-an-environment-yml-file for more information.
activate-environment No Environment name (or path) to activate on all shells. Default is `test` which will be created in `$CONDA/envs/test`. If an empty string is used, no environment is activated by default (For `base` activation see the `auto-activate-base` option). If the environment does not exist, it will be created and activated. If `environment-file` is used and you want that to be the environment used, you need to explicitely provide the name of that environment on `activate-environment`. If using sh/bash/cmd.exe shells please read the IMPORTANT! section on the README.md! to properly activate conda environments on these shells.
python-version No Exact version of a Python version to use on "activate-environment". If provided, this will be installed before the "environment-file". See https://anaconda.org/anaconda/python for available "python" versions.
add-anaconda-token No Conda configuration. When the channel alias is Anaconda.org or an Anaconda Server GUI, you can set the system configuration so that users automatically see private packages. Anaconda.org was formerly known as binstar.org. This uses the Anaconda command-line client, which you can install with conda install anaconda-client, to automatically add the token to the channel URLs. The default is "true". See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/use-condarc.html#add-anaconda-org-token-to-automatically-see-private-packages-add-anaconda-token for more information.
add-pip-as-python-dependency No Conda configuration. Add pip, wheel, and setuptools as dependencies of Python. This ensures that pip, wheel, and setuptools are always installed any time Python is installed. The default is "true". See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/use-condarc.html#add-pip-as-python-dependency-add-pip-as-python-dependency for more information.
allow-softlinks No Conda configuration. When allow_softlinks is "true", conda uses hard-links when possible and soft-links---symlinks---when hard-links are not possible, such as when installing on a different file system than the one that the package cache is on. When allow_softlinks is "false", conda still uses hard-links when possible, but when it is not possible, conda copies files. Individual packages can override this option, specifying that certain files should never be soft-linked. The default is "true". See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/use-condarc.html#disallow-soft-linking-allow-softlinks for more information.
auto-activate-base No Conda configuration. If you‚Äôd prefer that conda‚Äôs base environment not be activated on startup, set the to "false". Default is "true". This setting always overrides if set to "true" or "false". If you want to use the "condarc-file" setting pass and empty string. See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/ for more information.
auto-update-conda No Conda configuration. When "true", conda updates itself any time a user updates or installs a package in the base environment. When "false", conda updates itself only if the user manually issues a conda update command. The default is "true". This setting always overrides if set to "true" or "false". If you want to use the "condarc-file" setting pass and empty string. See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/ for more information.
condarc-file No Conda configuration. Path to a conda configuration file to use for the runner. This file will be copied to "~/.condarc". See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/ for more information.
channel-alias No Conda configuration. Whenever you use the -c or --channel flag to give conda a channel name that is not a URL, conda prepends the channel_alias to the name that it was given. The default channel_alias is https://conda.anaconda.org. See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/use-condarc.html#set-a-channel-alias-channel-alias for more information.
channel-priority No Conda configuration. Accepts values of "strict", "flexible", and "disabled". The default value is "flexible". With strict channel priority, packages in lower priority channels are not considered if a package with the same name appears in a higher priority channel. With flexible channel priority, the solver may reach into lower priority channels to fulfill dependencies, rather than raising an unsatisfiable error. With channel priority disabled, package version takes precedence, and the configured priority of channels is used only to break ties. In previous versions of conda, this parameter was configured as either "true" or "false". "true" is now an alias to "flexible". See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/tasks/manage-channels.html#strict-channel-priority for more information.
channels No Conda configuration. Comma separated list of channels to use in order of priority. See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/ for more information.
show-channel-urls No Conda configuration. Show channel URLs when displaying what is going to be downloaded and in conda list. The default is "false". See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/use-condarc.html#show-channel-urls-show-channel-urls for more information.
use-only-tar-bz2 No Conda configuration. Conda 4.7 introduced a new .conda package file format. .conda is a more compact and faster alternative to .tar.bz2 packages. It is thus the preferred file format to use where available. Nevertheless, it is possible to force conda to only download .tar.bz2 packages by setting the use_only_tar_bz2 boolean to "true". The default is "false". See https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda/en/latest/user-guide/configuration/use-condarc.html#force-conda-to-download-only-tar-bz2-packages-use-only-tar-bz2 for more information.
remove-profiles No Advanced. Prior to runnning "conda init" all shell profiles will be removed from the runner. Default is "true".
mamba-version No Experimental. Use mamba (https://github.com/QuantStack/mamba) as a faster drop-in replacement for conda installs. Disabled by default. To enable, use "*" or a "x.y" version string.
use-mamba No Experimental. Use mamba as soon as available (either as provided by `mamba-in-installer` or installation by `mamba-version`)
architecture No Architecture of Miniconda that should be installed. Available options on GitHub-hosted runners are "x86" and "x64". Default is "x64".
×

workspace No Custom workspace directory that contains the package.json file.
publish_command No Custom publish command.
publish_args No Publish command arguments.

Outputs

changed Whether the version has changed in the examined commits
version The detected version number
commit The SHA of the commit where the version change has been detected

append-separator No The separator to use when appending to an existing comment. (`newline`, `space`, `none`)
reactions No A comma or newline separated list of reactions to add to the comment.

Create Pull Request

Action ID: marketplace/peter-evans/create-pull-request

Author: Unknown

Publisher: peter-evans

Repository: github.com/peter-evans/create-pull-request

Description

Creates a pull request for changes to your repository in the actions workspace

Categories

CommunicationCode qualityTesting

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
token No The token that the action will use to create and update the pull request.
branch-token No The token that the action will use to create and update the branch. Defaults to the value of `token`.
path No Relative path under $GITHUB_WORKSPACE to the repository. Defaults to $GITHUB_WORKSPACE.
add-paths No A comma or newline-separated list of file paths to commit. Paths should follow git's pathspec syntax. Defaults to adding all new and modified files.
commit-message No The message to use when committing changes.
committer No The committer name and email address in the format `Display Name <email@address.com>`. Defaults to the GitHub Actions bot user.
author No The author name and email address in the format `Display Name <email@address.com>`. Defaults to the user who triggered the workflow run.
signoff No Add `Signed-off-by` line by the committer at the end of the commit log message.
branch No The pull request branch name.
delete-branch No Delete the `branch` if it doesn't have an active pull request associated with it.
branch-suffix No The branch suffix type when using the alternative branching strategy.
base No The pull request base branch. Defaults to the branch checked out in the workflow.
push-to-fork No A fork of the checked out parent repository to which the pull request branch will be pushed. e.g. `owner/repo-fork`. The pull request will be created to merge the fork's branch into the parent's base.
sign-commits No Sign commits as `github-actions[bot]` when using `GITHUB_TOKEN`, or your own bot when using GitHub App tokens.
title No The title of the pull request.
body No The body of the pull request.
body-path No The path to a file containing the pull request body. Takes precedence over `body`.
labels No A comma or newline separated list of labels.
assignees No A comma or newline separated list of assignees (GitHub usernames).
reviewers No A comma or newline separated list of reviewers (GitHub usernames) to request a review from.
team-reviewers No A comma or newline separated list of GitHub teams to request a review from. Note that a `repo` scoped Personal Access Token (PAT) may be required.
milestone No The number of the milestone to associate the pull request with.
draft No Create a draft pull request. Valid values are `true` (only on create), `always-true` (on create and update), and `false`.
maintainer-can-modify No Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request.

Outputs

NameDescription
pull-request-number The pull request number
pull-request-url The URL of the pull request.
pull-request-operation The pull request operation performed by the action, `created`, `updated` or `closed`.
pull-request-head-sha The commit SHA of the pull request branch.
pull-request-branch The pull request branch name
×

Inputs

Python Action

Action ID: marketplace/peter-evans/python-action

Author: Peter Evans

Publisher: peter-evans

Code qualityCommunication

NameRequiredDescription

repository No The target GitHub repository
head No Filter pull requests by head user or head organization and branch name in the format user:ref-name or organization:ref-name. For example: github:new-script-format or octocat:test-branch.
base No Filter pull requests by base branch name. Example: gh-pages.
include-labels No A comma or newline separated list of pull request labels to include. Allows any labels if unspecified.
exclude-labels No A comma or newline separated list of pull request labels to exclude
exclude-drafts No Exclude draft pull requests
rebase-options No A comma or newline separated list of options to pass to the git rebase command. For example, `-Xtheirs`.

Action ID: marketplace/pypa/gh-action-pip-audit

Author: William Woodruff <william@trailofbits.com>

Publisher: pypa

Repository: github.com/pypa/gh-action-pip-audit

Description

Use pip-audit to scan Python dependencies for known vulnerabilities

Categories

SecurityDependency managementCode quality

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
summary No render a Markdown summary of the audit (default true)
no-deps No don't do any dependency resolution (requires fully pinned requirements) (default false)
require-hashes No enforce hashes (requirements-style inputs only) (default false)
vulnerability-service No the vulnerability service to use (PyPI or OSV, defaults to PyPI)
inputs No the inputs to audit, whitespace separated (defaults to current path)
virtual-environment No the virtual environment to audit within (default none)
local No for environmental audits, consider only packages marked local (default false)
index-url No the base URL for the PEP 503-compatible package index to use
extra-index-urls No extra PEP 503-compatible indexes to use, whitespace separated
ignore-vulns No vulnerabilities to explicitly exclude, if present (whitespace separated)
disable-pip No disable pip
locked No audit lock files from the local Python project
internal-be-careful-allow-failure No don't fail the job if the audit fails (default false)
internal-be-careful-extra-flags No extra flags to be passed in to pip-audit

Outputs

NameDescription
internal-be-careful-output the column-formatted output from pip-audit, wrapped as base64

NameRequiredDescription
github_token No The GitHub token used to authenticated with GitHub.
continue_on_error No Whether the workflow run should also fail when linter failures are detected
auto_fix No Whether linters should try to fix code style issues automatically
commit No Whether to commit and push the changes made by auto_fix
git_no_verify No Bypass the pre-commit and pre-push git hooks
git_name No Username for auto-fix commits
git_email No Email address for auto-fix commits
commit_message No Template for auto-fix commit messages. The "${linter}" variable can be used to insert the name of the linter which has created the auto-fix
check_name No Template for the name of the check run. The "${linter}" and "${dir}" variables can be used to insert the name and directory of the linter.
neutral_check_on_warning No Whether the check run should conclude with a neutral status instead of success when the linter finds only warnings
stylelint No Enable or disable stylelint checks
stylelint_args No Additional arguments to pass to the linter
stylelint_dir No Directory where the stylelint command should be run
stylelint_extensions No Extensions of files to check with stylelint
stylelint_command_prefix No Shell command to prepend to the linter command
stylelint_auto_fix No Whether this linter should try to fix code style issues automatically. If set to `true`, it will only work if "auto_fix" is set to `true` as well
gofmt No Enable or disable gofmt checks
gofmt_args No Additional arguments to pass to the linter
gofmt_dir No Directory where the gofmt command should be run
gofmt_extensions No Extensions of files to check with gofmt
gofmt_command_prefix No Shell command to prepend to the linter command

golint No Enable or disable golint checks
golint_args No Additional arguments to pass to the linter
golint_dir No Directory where the golint command should be run
golint_extensions No Extensions of files to check with golint
golint_command_prefix No Shell command to prepend to the linter command
golint_auto_fix No Whether this linter should try to fix code style issues automatically. If set to `true`, it will only work if "auto_fix" is set to `true` as well
eslint No Enable or disable ESLint checks
eslint_args No Additional arguments to pass to the linter
eslint_dir No Directory where the ESLint command should be run

eslint_auto_fix No Whether this linter should try to fix code style issues automatically. If set to `true`, it will only work if "auto_fix" is set to `true` as well

Changelog Updater

Action ID: marketplace/stefanzweifel/changelog-updater-action

Author: Stefan Zweifel <stefan@stefanzweifel.dev>

Publisher: stefanzweifel

Repository: github.com/stefanzweifel/changelog-updater-action

Description

Automatically update a CHANGELOG with the latest release notes.

Categories

DocumentationCode qualityPublishing

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
release-notes No The release notes you want to add to your CHANGELOG. Should be markdown. If not provided, the content between the Unreleased heading and the previous release heading is taken as release notes.
latest-version Yes Semantic version number of the latest release. The value will be used as a heading text.
release-date No The date the latest version has been released. Defaults to the current date.
path-to-changelog No Defaults to `CHANGELOG.md`. Path to CHANGELOG.md file.
compare-url-target-revision No Target revision used in compare URL inside a possible "Unreleased" heading.
heading-text No Text used in the new release heading. Defaults to the value from latest-version.
hide-release-date No Hide release date in the new release heading.
parse-github-usernames No Experimental: Find GitHub usernames in release notes and link to their profile.

Outputs

NameDescription
release_compare_url The generated compare URL for the just created relase. For example https://github.com/org/repo/compare/v1.0.0...v1.1.0
release_url_fragment The URL fragment for the just created release. For example '#v100---2021-02-01'. You can use this to generate URLs that point to the newly created release in your CHANGELOG.
unreleased_compare_url The generated compare URL between the latest version and the target revision. For example https://github.com/org/repo/compare/v1.0.0...HEAD
×

Git Auto Commit

Action ID: marketplace/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action

Author: Stefan Zweifel <stefan@stefanzweifel.dev>

Publisher: stefanzweifel

Repository: github.com/stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action

Description

Automatically commits files which have been changed during the workflow run and push changes back to remote repository.

Categories

Code qualityAutomationDependency management

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
commit_message No Commit message
branch No Git branch name, where changes should be pushed too. Required if Action is used on the `pull_request` event
commit_options No Commit options (eg. --no-verify)
add_options No Add options (eg. -u)
status_options No Status options (eg. --untracked-files=no)
file_pattern No File pattern used for `git add`. For example `src/*.js`
repository No Local file path to the git repository. Defaults to the current directory (`.`)
commit_user_name No Name used for the commit user
commit_user_email No Email address used for the commit user
commit_author No Value used for the commit author. Defaults to the username of whoever triggered this workflow run.
tag_name No Tag name used for creating a new git tag with the commit. Keep this empty, if no tag should be created.
tagging_message No Tagging message used for creating a new git tag with the commit. Keep this empty, if no tag should be created.
push_options No Push options (eg. --force)
skip_dirty_check No Skip the check if the git repository is dirty and always try to create a commit.
skip_fetch No Skip the call to git-fetch.
skip_checkout No Skip the call to git-checkout.
disable_globbing No Stop the shell from expanding filenames (https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/html_node/Filename-Expansion.html)
create_branch No Create new branch with the name of `branch`-input in local and remote repository, if it doesn't exist yet.
create_git_tag_only No Perform a clean git tag and push, without commiting anything
internal_git_binary No Internal use only! Path to git binary used to check if git is available. (Don't change this!)

Outputs

NameDescription
changes_detected Value is "true", if the repository was dirty and file changes have been detected. Value is "false", if no changes have been detected.
commit_hash Full hash of the created commit. Only present if the "changes_detected" output is "true".
create_git_tag_only Value is "true", if a git tag was created using the `create_git_tag_only`-input.
×

Autosquash

Action ID: marketplace/tibdex/autosquash

Author: Thibault Derousseaux <tibdex@gmail.com>

Publisher: tibdex

Repository: github.com/tibdex/autosquash

Description

Automatically update PRs with outdated checks and squash and merge the ones matching all branch protections.

Categories

AutomationCode qualityTesting

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
github_token Yes Token for the GitHub API.
label Yes Name of the label used by Autosquash to find the pull requests to handle.
×

Backporting

Action ID: marketplace/tibdex/backport

Author: Thibault Derousseaux <tibdex@gmail.com>

Publisher: tibdex

Repository: github.com/tibdex/backport

Description

Automatically backport PRs to other branches by simply labeling them.

Categories

DeploymentCommunicationCode quality

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
body_template No Lodash template for the backport PR's body. The data properties are: - base: backport PR's base branch - body: original PR's body - mergeCommitSha: SHA of the original PR's merge commit - number: original PR's number
github_token Yes Token for the GitHub API.
head_template No Lodash template for the backport PR's head branch. The data properties are: - base: backport PR's base branch - number: original PR's number
label_pattern No The regular expression pattern that PR labels will be tested on to decide whether the PR should be backported and where. The backport PR's base branch will be extracted from the pattern's required `base` named capturing group.
labels_template No Lodash template compiling to a JSON array of labels to add to the backport PR. The data properties are: - base: backport PR's base branch - labels: array containing the original PR's labels, excluding those matching `label_pattern`.
title_template No Lodash template for the backport PR's title. The data properties are: - base: backport PR's base branch - number: original PR's number - title: original PR's title

Outputs

NameDescription
created_pull_requests A JSON stringified object mapping the base branch of the created pull requests to their number.
×

GitHub App token

Action ID: marketplace/tibdex/github-app-token

Author: Thibault Derousseaux <tibdex@gmail.com>

Publisher: tibdex

Repository: github.com/tibdex/github-app-token

Description

Run a GitHub Action as a GitHub App instead of using secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN or a personal access token.

Categories

AuthenticationInfrastructure

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
app_id Yes ID of the GitHub App.
github_api_url No The API URL of the GitHub server.
installation_retrieval_mode No The mode used to retrieve the installation for which the token will be requested. One of: - id: use the installation with the specified ID. - organization: use an organization installation (https://docs.github.com/en/rest/apps/apps?apiVersion=2022-11-28#get-an-organization-installation-for-the-authenticated-app). - repository: use a repository installation (https://docs.github.com/en/rest/apps/apps?apiVersion=2022-11-28#get-a-repository-installation-for-the-authenticated-app). - user: use a user installation (https://docs.github.com/en/rest/apps/apps?apiVersion=2022-11-28#get-a-user-installation-for-the-authenticated-app).
installation_retrieval_payload No The payload used to retrieve the installation. Examples for each retrieval mode: - id: 1337 - organization: github - repository: tibdex/github-app-token - user: tibdex
permissions No The JSON-stringified permissions granted to the token. Defaults to all permissions granted to the GitHub app. See https://docs.github.com/en/rest/apps/apps?apiVersion=2022-11-28#create-an-installation-access-token-for-an-app's `permissions`.
private_key Yes Private key of the GitHub App (can be Base64 encoded).
repositories No The JSON-stringified array of the full names of the repositories the token should have access to. Defaults to all repositories that the installation can access. See https://docs.github.com/en/rest/apps/apps?apiVersion=2022-11-28#create-an-installation-access-token-for-an-app's `repositories`.
revoke No Revoke the token at the end of the job.

Outputs

NameDescription
token An installation access token for the GitHub App.
×

Sync branches

Action ID: marketplace/tibdex/sync-branches

Author: Thibault Derousseaux <tibdex@gmail.com>

Publisher: tibdex

Repository: github.com/tibdex/sync-branches

Description

Automatically merge a repository branch into other branches to keep them in sync.

Categories

Dependency managementCommunicationCode quality

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
body_template No Lodash template for the syncing PR's body. The data properties are: - base: syncing PR's base branch - head: branch to merge into `base`.
branches_pattern No Branches matching this `minimatch` pattern will be synced with the branch from which this action is run. If empty, all the protected branches will be synced.
github_token No Token for the GitHub API.
head_template No Lodash template for the syncing PR's head branch. The data properties are: - base: syncing PR's base branch - head: branch to merge into `base`.
labels_template No Lodash template compiling to a JSON array of labels to add to the syncing PR. The data properties are: - base: syncing PR's base branch - head: branch to merge into `base`.
title_template No Lodash template for the syncing PR's title. The data properties are: - base: syncing PR's base branch - head: branch to merge into `base`.

Outputs

NameDescription
created_pull_requests A JSON stringified object mapping the base branch of the created pull requests to their number.
×

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription

check-latest No Set this option to true if you want the action to always check for the latest available Go version that satisfies the version spec
cache No Used to specify whether Go caching is needed. Set to true, if you would like to enable caching.
go-package No Go Package to scan with govulncheck
work-dir No Directory in which to run govulncheck
repo-checkout No Checkout the repository
go-version-file No Path to the go.mod or go.work file.
output-format No The format of the output
output-file No The file to which the govulncheck output is saved

Publish Docker

Action ID: marketplace/wangyoucao577/Publish-Docker-Github-Action

Author: Lars Gohr

Publisher: wangyoucao577

Repository: github.com/wangyoucao577/Publish-Docker-Github-Action

Description

Uses the git branch as the docker tag and pushes the container

Categories

PublishingPackagingAuthentication

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
name Yes The name of the image you would like to push
username Yes The login username for the registry
password Yes The login password for the registry
registry No Use registry for pushing to a custom registry
snapshot No Use snapshot to push an additional image
default_branch No Set the default branch of your repository (default: master)
dockerfile No Use dockerfile when you would like to explicitly build a Dockerfile
workdir No Use workdir when you would like to change the directory for building
context No Use context when you would like to change the Docker build context.
buildargs No Use buildargs when you want to pass a list of environment variables as build-args
buildoptions No Use buildoptions when you want to configure options for building
cache No Use cache when you have big images, that you would only like to build partially
tags No Use tags when you want to bring your own tags (separated by comma)
tag_names No Use tag_names when you want to push tags/release by their git name
tag_semver No Push semver docker tags. e.g. image:1.2.3, image:1.2, image:1
no_push No Set no_push to true if you want to prevent the action from pushing to a registry (default: false)
platforms No Use platforms for building multi-arch images

Outputs

NameDescription
tag Is the tag, which was pushed
snapshot-tag Is the tag that is generated by the snapshot-option and pushed
digest Is the digest of the image, which was pushed
×

Go Release Binaries

Action ID: marketplace/wangyoucao577/go-release-action

Author: Jay Zhang <wangyoucao577@gmail.com>

Publisher: wangyoucao577

Repository: github.com/wangyoucao577/go-release-action

Description

Build and Release Go Binaries to GitHub Release Assets

Categories

BuildDeploymentPublishing

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
github_token Yes GITHUB_TOKEN for uploading releases to Github asserts.
goos Yes GOOS is the running programs operating system target: one of darwin, freebsd, linux, and so on.
goarch Yes GOARCH is the running programs architecture target: one of 386, amd64, arm, s390x, loong64 and so on.
goamd64 No GOAMD64 is the running programs amd64 microarchitecture level: one of v1, v2, v3, v4.
goarm No GOARM is the running programs arm microarchitecture level: ARMv5,ARMv6,ARMv7
gomips No GOMIPS is the running programs mips microarchitecture level: hardfloat,softfloat
goversion No The `Go` compiler version.
build_flags No Additional arguments to pass the go build command.
ldflags No Values to provide to the -ldflags argument
project_path No Where to run `go build .`
binary_name No Specify another binary name if do not want to use repository basename
pre_command No Extra command that will be executed before `go build`, may for solving dependency
build_command No The actual command to build binary, typically `go build`.
executable_compression No Compression executable binary by some third-party tools. Only `upx` is supported at the moment.
extra_files No Extra files that will be packaged into artifacts either.
md5sum No Publish `.md5` along with artifacts.
sha256sum No Publish `.sha256` along with artifacts.
release_tag No Upload binaries to specified release page that indicated by Git tag.
release_name No Upload binaries to specified release page that indicated by release name.
release_repo No Repository to upload the binaries
overwrite No Overwrite asset if it's already exist.
asset_name No Customize asset name if do not want to use the default format.
retry No How many times retrying if upload fails.
post_command No Extra command that will be executed for teardown work
compress_assets No Compress assets before uploading
upload No Upload release assets or not
multi_binaries No Build and package multiple binaries together

Outputs

NameDescription
release_asset_dir Release file directory provided for use by other workflows

Setup ccache action

Action ID: marketplace/zhongfly/setup-ccache-action

Author: Chocobo1 <https://github.com/Chocobo1>

Publisher: zhongfly

Repository: github.com/zhongfly/setup-ccache-action

Description

Setup ccache easily in your workflow, with all the tuning knobs you need!

Categories

Dependency managementBuild

Inputs

NameRequiredDescription
update_packager_index No By default, this action will update packager's indexes to avoid installation issues (`apt`/`brew` on linux/macOS respectively). You can disable it to save some time however you are then responsible for ensuring the packager's indexes are up-to-date *before* using this action
install_ccache No By default, this action will install ccache with package manager. You can omit installation if you've already installed ccache and it is accessible in the shell
prepend_symlinks_to_path No By default, this action will prepend ccache's compiler symlinks directory to PATH so that compiler invocations will be handled by ccache transparently. https://ccache.dev/manual/latest.html#_run_modes
windows_compile_environment No Specify which compiler environment you are going to use on Windows image. Note that this field (a single value) is mandatory if you use this action on a Windows image. Available options are: ['msvc', 'msys2']
api_token No Token for using GitHub API
restore_cache No Whether to restore the cache at the start of this action
store_cache No Whether to store the cache at the end of job execution
remove_stale_cache No Whether to remove previous/stale cache entries after store cache completed. This requires parameter `api_token` to be valid. This requires `actions: write` permission. Note that for GitHub Pull Requests, only `actions: read` permission will be given so this feature won't work reliably there.
override_cache_key No Override cache key which is used for storing/retrieving the cache. Accept a string. Leave it empty to use the default value
override_cache_key_fallback No Override additional cache keys for retrieving the cache. Accept a list of strings. Leave it empty to use the default value
ccache_options No Config settings for ccache. Accept a list of key=value pairs. Ref: https://ccache.dev/manual/latest.html#_configuration_options

Outputs

NameDescription
cache_hit This variable will be set to `true` when there is an cache hit, otherwise `false`

Generated on 2025-12-15 00:09 UTC
